If man’s capacity for thinking and acting is dependent on one’s “teenah”, then he will be compelled to behave himself in a fixed way on account of which he will neither deserve praise for good deeds nor be held blameworthy for bad ones. But this hypothe sis is incorrect because it is well established that just as Allah knows everything in creation after its coming into being, in the same way, He knew it before its creation. Thus, He knew what actions man would perform of his free will and what he could leave. Therefore, Allah gave him the ability to act according to his free will and created him from a suitable “teenah”. This “teenah” is not the cause of his actions so as to snatch away from him his free will. But the meaning of creating from suitable “teenah” is that Allah does not by force stand in man’s way but allows him to tread the path which he wants of his own free will.
سقطمنالنسخة

Arabic: ومن كلام له (عليه السلام) قاله وهو يلي غسل رسول الله(صلى الله عليه وآله) وتجهيزه
English: Spoken When Imam Ali Ibn Abu Talib Was Busy in the Funeral Ablution (Ghusl) and Shrouding of the Holy Prophet

Arabic: بِأَبِي أَنْتَ وأُمي، لَقَدِ انْقَطَعَ بِمَوْتِكَ مَا لَمْ يَنْقَطِعْ بِمَوْتِ غَيْرِكَ مِنَ النبُوةِ وَالانْبَاءِ وأَخْبَارِ السماءِ، خَصَصْتَ حَتى صِرْتَ مُسَلياً عَمنْ سِوَاكَ، وَعَمَمْتَ حَتّى صَارَ الناسُ فِيكَ سَواءً،
English: May my parents be sacrificed for you, O Messenger of Allah! With your death, the process of Prophethood, the revelation and heavenly messages have stopped and which had not stopped at the death of others (prophets). Your status with us (members of your family) is so special that our grief for having lost you has become a source of consolation (to us) as against the grief of all others; our grief for having lost you is also common so that all Muslims may share it equally.

Arabic: وَلَوْلاَ أَنكَ أَمَرْتَ بِالصبْرِ، وَنَهَيْتَ عَنِ الْجَزَعِ، لانْفَدْنَا عَلَيْكَ مَاءَ الشؤُونِ، وَلَكَانَ الداءُ مُمَاطِلاً، وَالْكَمَدُ مُحَالِفاً، وَقَلا لَكَ ! وَلكِنهُ مَا لاَ يُمْلَكُ رَدهُ، وَلاَ يُسْتَطَاعُ دَفْعُهُ! بِأَبِي أَنْتَ وَأُمّي! اذْكُرْنَا عِنْدَ رَبكَ، وَاجْعَلْنَا مِنْ بَالِكَ!
English: If you had not commended endurance and prevented us from wailing, we would have produced tears abundantly. Even then, the pain will not have subsided and this grief will not have ended. They will have been too little an indication of our grief for you. But this (death) is a matter that cannot be reversed nor is it possible to avoid. May my father and mother die for you; do remember us with Allah and take care of us.

Arabic: سقطمنالنسخة
English: Sermon 234
سقطمنالنسخة

Arabic: ومن كلام له (عليه السلام) اقتصّ فيه ذكر ما كان منه بعد هجرة النبي(صلى الله عليه وآله) ثم لحاقه به
English: Imam Ali Ibn Abu Talib Relating His Own Condition after the Prophet’s Migration till Their Meeting

Arabic: فَجَعَلْتُ أَتْبَعُ مَأْخَذَ رَسُولِ الله(صلى الله عليه وآله) فَأَطَأُ ذِكْرَهُ، حَتى انْتَهَيْتُ إِلَى الْعَرَجِ.
English: I began to follow the path adopted by the Prophet and tread on the tracks of his remembrance till I reached al-Arj.

Arabic: في حديث طويل. فقوله (عليه السلام): «فَأطَأُ ذِكْرَهُ»، من الكلام الذي رُمِيَ به إلى غايتي والفصاحة والايجاز، وأراد أني كنتُ أُعْطي خبره(عليه السلام) من بدء خروجي إلى أن انتهيتُ إلى هذا الموضع، وكنّى عن ذلك بهذه الكناية العجيبة.
English: Sayyid ar-Radi says the following: “Imam Ali ibn Abu Talib’s words “faata’u dhikrahu” constitute the highest forms of brevity and eloquence. He means to say that he was being given news about the Prophet from the commencement of his setting out till he reached this place, and he has expressed this notion in this wonderful expression.”

Arabic: سقطمنالنسخة
English:
Since the inception of Prophethood, the Prophet remained in Mecca for thirteen years. For him, this period was one of the most severe oppression and destitution. The unbelievers from the Quraish tribe had closed all the doors of livelihood against him, sparing no means to inflict hardship upon him, so much so that in order to put an end to his life, they began plotting with each other as to how to do so. Forty of their dignitaries assembled in the hall of audience (Dar an-Nadwa) for consultation and decided that one individual should be picked out fromevery tribe, then they would jointly attack him. In this way, Banu Hashim would not dare to face all the other tribes, and the matter would quiet down on the payment of blood money. To give a practical shape to this scheme, these people lay in ambush near the house of the Prophet on the night of the first of Rabi’al-Awwal. As the Prophet slept in his bed, he was to be thus attacked. On one hand, the preparation for killing him was complete. On the other hand, Allah informed him of all the intrigues of the unbelieving tribesmen of Quraish, commanding him to let Ali sleep in his bed while he himself had to immigrate to Medina. The Prophet sent for Ali. Disclosing to him his plan, he said the following: “Ali ! Lie in my bed.” Imam Ali ibn Abu Talib inquired: “O Messenger of Allah! Will your life be saved by my sleeping here?” The Prophet said, “Yes.” Hearing this, Imam Ali ibn Abu Talib performed a prostration as a token of thanks-giving and, exposing himself fully to the danger, lay on the Prophet’s bed while the Prophet departed. The unbelieving tribesmen of Quraish were peeping and getting ready for the attack. Abu Lahab said, “It is not proper to attack in the night because there are women and children also living in the house. When the morning dawns, you should attack him, but keep watch during the night lest he should not move and go anywhere else.” Consequently, they kept their eyes on the bed throughout the night and soon. When dawn drew nigh, they proceeded stealthily. Hearing the sound of their footsteps, Imam Ali ibn Abu Talib removed the covering from his face and stood up. The tribesmen of Quraish gazed at him with disbelieving eyes as to whether it was an illusion or a fact. After making sure that it was Ali, they inquired, “Where is Muhammad (<)?” Ali replied, “Did you entrust him to me so that now you are asking me about him?!” They had no reply. Men ran to pursue him but found footprints only up to the cave [of Hira] in themountain of Thawr. Beyond that, there were neither footprints nor any sign of hiding in the cave. They came back bewildered while the Prophet, after staying in the cave for three days, left for Medina. Imam Ali ibn Abu Talib passed these three days in Mecca, returned to the people their properties which they had entrusted the Prophet to safeguard for them then set off towards Medina to join the Prophet. Up to al-Arj, a place between Mecca and Medina, he kept getting news about the Prophet and he maintained his anxious march till he finally met the Prophet at Quba on the twelfth of Rabi’ al- Awwal where the Prophet was waiting for him, refusing to enter Medina without him (al-Tabari, Tafsir, Vol. 9, pp. 148-151; Tarikh, Vol.
1, pp. 1232-1234; Ibn Sa'd, Al-Tabaqat, Vol. 1, Part. 1, pp. 153-154; Ibn Hisham, As-Sira, Vol. 2, pp. 124-128; Ibn al-Athir, Usd al-Ghabah, Vol. 4, p. 25; Al-Kamil, Vol. 2, pp. 101-104; Ibn Kathir, Tafsir, Vol. 2, pp. 302-303; Tarikh, Vol. 3, pp. 180-181; Ibn Abul-Hadid, Vol. 13, pp. 303¬306; al-Sayyuti, Al-Durr al-Manthur, Vol. 3, pp. 179-180;’allama al- Majlisi, Bihar al-Anwar, Vol. 19, pp. 28-103).

Arabic: سقطمنالنسخة
English: Sermon 235
Sermon 236

Arabic: ومن خطبة له (عليه السلام) في شأن الحكمين وذمّ أهل الشام
English: About the Two Arbitrators (Abu Musa al-Ashari and Amr Ibn Al-As) and the Disparagement of the Syrians.

Arabic: جُفَاةٌ طَغَامٌ، عَبِيدٌ أَقْزَامٌ، جُمعُوا مِنْ كُل أَوْب، وَتُلُقطُوا مِنْ كُل شَوْب، مِمنْ يَنْبَغِي أَنْ يُفَقهَ وَيُؤَدبَ، وَيُعَلمَ وَيُدَربَ، وَيُوَلى عَلَيْهِ، وَيُؤْخَذَ عَلَى يَدَيْهِ، لَيْسُوا مِنَ الْمُهَاجِرِينَ وَالانْصَارِ، وَلاَ مِنَ الذِينَ تَبَوؤا الدارَ.
English: Rude, low people and mean slaves! They have been collected from all sides and picked up from every pack. They need to be taught the tenets (of Islam), disciplined, instructed, trained, supervised and led by the hand. They are neither Muhajirun nor Ansar, nor are those who made their dwellings in the abode (in Medina) and in belief.

Arabic: أَلاَ وَإِن الْقَوْمَ اخْتَارُوا لانْفُسِهِمْ أَقْرَبَ الْقَوْمِ مِما تُحِبونَ، وَاخْتَرْتُمْ لانْفُسِكُمْ أَقْرَبَ الْقَوْمِ مِما تَكْرَهُونَ، وَإِنمَا عَهْدُكُمْ بَعَبْدِ اللهِ بْنِ قَيْس بِالامْسِ يَقُولُ: إِنهَا فِتْنَةٌ فَقَطعُوا أَوْتَارَكُمْ وَشِيمُوا سُيُوفَكُمْ، فَإِنْ كَانَ صَادِقاً فَقَدْ أَخْطَأَ بِمَسِيرِهِ غَيْرَ مُسْتَكْرَه، وَإِنْ كَانَ كَاذِباً فَقَدْ لَزِمَتْهُ التهَمَهُ.
English: Look! They have chosen for themselves one who is nearest of all to what they desire, while you have chosen one who is nearest to what you dislike. You may certainly recall that the other day Abdullah ibn Qays (Abu Musa al-Ash’ari) was saying, “It is mischief; therefore, cut away your bow-string and sheathe your swords.” If he was right (in what he said), then he was wrong in marching (against us) without being forced. But if he was lying, then he should be viewed with suspicion.

Arabic: فَادْفَعُوا فِي صَدْرِ عَمْرِوبْنِ الْعَاصِ بِعَبْدِ اللهِ بْنِ الْعَباسِ، وَخُذُوا مَهَلَ الايامِ، وَحُوطُوا قَوَاصِيَ الاسْلاَمِ، أَلاَ تَرَوْنَ إِلَى بَلاَدِكُمْ تُغْزَى، وَإِلَى صَفَاتِكُمْ تُرْمَى ؟.
English: Therefore, send ‘Abdullah ibn Abbas to face ‘Amr ibn al-As. Make use of these days and safeguard the borders of Islam. Do you not see that your cities are being attacked and your prowess is being aimed at?
Sermon 237

Arabic: ومن خطبة له (عليه السلام) يذكر فيها آل محمد(عليهم السلام)
English: Imam Ali Ibn Abu Talib Describes Here the Members of the Prophet’s Family

Arabic: هُمْ عَيْشُ الْعِلْمِ، وَمَوْتُ الْجَهْلِ، يُخْبِرُكُمْ حِلْمُهُمْ عَنْ عِلْمِهِمْ، وَصَمْتُهُمْ عَنْ حِكَمِ مَنْطِقِهِمْ، لاَ يُخَالِفُونَ الْحَق وَلاَ يَخْتَلِفُونَ فِيهِ، هُمْ دَعَائِمُ الاسْلاَمِ، وَوَلاَئِجُ الاْعْتِصَامِ،
English: They are the life of knowledge and the death of ignorance. Their forbearance tells you of their knowledge and their silence the wisdom of their speech. They do not go against right, nor do they differ (among themselves) about it. They are the pillars of Islam and the havens of (its) protection.

Arabic: بِهِمْ عَادَ الْحَق فِي نِصَابِهِ، وَانْزَاحَ الْبَاطِلُ عَنْ مُقَامِهِ، وَانْقَطَعَ لِسَانُهُ عَنْ مَنْبِتِهِ، عَقَلُوا الدينَ عَقْلَ وِعَايَة وَرِعَايَة، لاَ عَقْلَ سَمَاع وَرِوَايَة، فَإِن رُوَاةَ الْعِلْمِ كَثِيرٌ، وَرُعَاتَهُ قَلِيلٌ.
English: With them, right has returned to its status and wrong has left its place, so its tongue is severed from the root. They have understood the religion attentively and carefully, not by mere heresy nor from relaters because those who relate knowledge are many, but those who absorb it are few.
Sermon 238

Arabic: ومن خطبة له (عليه السلام)[في المسارعة إلى العمل]
English: About Preparing Provisions for the next World, While Being in this World, and Performing Good Deeds Before Death

Arabic: فَاعْمَلُوا وَأَنْتُمْ فِي نَفَسِ الْبَقَاءِ، وَالصحُفُ مَنْشُورَةٌ، وَالتوْبَةُ مَبْسُوطَةٌ، وَالْمُدْبِرُ يُدْعَى، وَالْمُسِيءُ يُرْجَى، قَبْلَ أَنْ يَخْمُدَ العَمَلُ، وَيَنَقَطِعَ الْمَهَلُ، وَتَنْقَضِيَ الْمُدةُ، وَتُسَد أبْوابُ التوْبَةِ، وَتَصْعَدَ الْمَلاَئِكَةُ.
English: Perform (good) deeds while you are still in the vastness of this life, while the books are open (for recording your deeds), repentance is allowed, the runner away (from Allah) is being called upon (to revert) and the sinner is being given hope (of forgiveness) before the (light of) action is put off, before time expires, life ends, the door of repentance is closed and the angels ascend to the sky.

Arabic: فَأخَذَ امْرُؤٌ مِنْ نَفْسِهِ لِنَفْسِهِ، وَأَخَذَ مِنْ حَيّ لِمَيت، وَمِنْ فَان لِبَاق، وَمِنْ ذَاهِب لِدَائِم. امْرُءٌ خَافَ اللهَ وَهُوَ مُعَمرٌ إلَى أَجَلِهِ، وَمَنْظُورٌ إلَى عَمَلِهِ.امْرُءٌ أَلْجَمَ نَفْسَهُ بِلِجَامِهَا، وَزَمهَا بِزِمَامِهَا، فَأَمْسَكَهَا بِلِجَامِهَا عَنْ مَعَاصِي اللهِ، وَقَادَها بِزِمَامِهَا إِلَى طَاعَةِ اللهِ.
English: Therefore, a man should derive benefit from himself for himself, from the living for the dead, from the mortal for the immortal, and from the who departs for the one who stays. A man should fear Allah while he is given a life to lead up to his death and is given time to act. A man should control himself by the rein and hold it with its bridle. Thus, by the rein he should prevent it from disobedience towards Allah, and by the bridle he should lead it towards obedience to Allah.
Sermon 239

Arabic: ومن كلام له (عليه السلام) يحثّ فيه أصحابه على الجهاد وَاللهُ مُسْتأْدِيكُمْ شُكْرَهُ، وَمُوَرثُكُمْ أَمْرَهُ، وَمُمْهِلُكُمْ فِي مِضْمار مَحْدُود، لِتَتَنَازَعُوا سَبَقَهُ، فَشدوا عُقَدَ الْمَـآزِرِ، وَاطْوُوا فُضُولَ الْخَوَاصِر، وَلاَ تَجْتَمِعُ عَزِيمَةٌ وَوَلِيمَةٌ، وَمَا أَنْقَضَ النوْمَ لِعَزَائِمِ الْيَوْمِ،أَمحَى الظلَمَ لِتَذَاكِيرِ الْهِمَمِ!
English: Exhorting His Men to Carry out Jihad, Asking Them to Refrain from Seeking a Life of Luxury Allah admonishes you to thank Him and assigns to you His affairs. He has allowed time in the limited field (of life) so that you may vie with each other in seeking the reward (of Paradise). Therefore, tighten your belts and wrap up the hems. High courage and dinners do not go together. Sleep causes weakness in the big affairs of the day and (its) darkness obliterates the thoughts of courage.
سقطمنالنسخة

Arabic: ومن كلام له (عليه السلام) قاله لعبد الله بن العباس وقد جاء برسالة من عثمان بن عفان وهو محصور يسأله فيها الخروج إلى ماله بينبُع، ليقلّ هتف الناس باسمه للخلافة، بعد أن كان سأله مثل ذلك من قبل.
English: When Othman ibn Affan was surrounded, Abdullah ibn Abbas brought a letter to Imam Ali ibn Abu Talib from Othman in which the latter expressed the desire that Imam Ali ibn Abu Talib go to his estate, Yanbu’, so that the proposal that was being mooted out for him to become caliph would subside. Othman had made this same request earlier.

Arabic: فقال(عليه السلام): يَابْنَ عَباس، مَا يُرِيدُ عُثْـمَانُ إِلا أَنْ يَجَعَلَنِي جَمَلاً نَاضِحاً بِالْغَرْبِ، أَقْبِلْ وَأَدْبِرْ! بَعَثَ إِلَي أَنْ أَخْرُجَ، ثُم بَعَثَ إِلي أَنْ أَقْدُمَ، ثُم هُوَ الاْنَ يَبْعَثُ إِلَي أَنْ أَخْرُجَ! وَاللهِ لَقَدْ دَفَعْتُ عَنْهُ حَتى خَشِيتُ أَنْ أَكُونَ آثِماً.
English: Upon this, Imam Ali ibn Abu Talib said the following to Ibn Abbas:. O Ibn Abbas! Othman just wants to treat me like the water¬drawing camel so that I may go forward and backward with the bucket. Once he sent word that I should go out, then he sent me word that I should return. Now, again he sends me word that I should go out. By Allah, I continued to protect him till I feared lest I should become a sinner.

Arabic: آخر الخطب، و يتلوه المختار من كتبه و رسائله.
English: سقطمنالنسخة

Arabic: باب المختار من كتب أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام
English: Selected writings of our Master, Imam Ali Ibn Abu Talib, His Letters to his Enemies and Governors of his Provinces, including selections of his Letters appointing his Administrative Officers and Injunctions to Members of his Family and Companions.

Arabic: من كتاب له (عليه السلام) إلى أهل الكوفة، عند مسيره من المدينة إلى البصرة
English: Addressed to the people of Kufa at the time of his march from Medina to Basra.

Arabic: مِنْ عَبْدِ اللهِ عَلِيّ أَمِيرِالْمُؤْمِنِينَ إلَى أَهْلِ الْكُوفَةِ، جَبْهَةِ الاْنْصَارِ وَسَنَامِ الْعَرَبِ.
English: From the servant of Allah, Ali, the Commander of the Faithful, to the people of Kufa who are the foremost among the supporters and the chiefs of the Arabs.

Arabic: أَما بَعْدُ، فَإِني أُخْبِرُكُمْ عَنْ أَمْرِ عُثْمانَ حَتى يَكُونَ سَمْعُهُ كَعِيَانِهِ:
English: I am reminding you of what happened to Othman so that its memory may be like seeing its events:

Arabic: إِن الناسَ طَعَنُوا عَلَيْهِ، فَكُنْتُ رَجُلاً مِنَ الْمُهَاجِرِينَ أُكْثِرُ اسْتِعْتَابَه، وَأُقِل عِتَابَهُ، وَكَانَ طَلْحَةُ وَالزبَيْرُ أَهْوَنُ سَيْرِهِمَا فِيهِ الْوَجيِفُ.
English: People criticized him, and I was the only man from among the Muhajirun (immigrants) to ask him to make it his pursuit to please (the Muslims) the most and to offend them the very least. As for Talhah and az-Zubayr.

Arabic: وَأَرْفَقُ حِدَائِهِمَا الْعَنِيفُ، وَكَانَ مِنْ عَائِشَةَ فِيهِ فَلْتَةُ غَضَب، فَأُتِيحَ لَهُ قَوْمٌ فَقَتَلُوهُ، وَبَايَعَنِي الناسُ غَيْرَ مُسْتَكْرَهِينَ وَلاَ مُجْبَرِينَ، بَلْ طَائِعِينَ مُخَيرِينَ.
English: their lightest step about him was hard, and their softest voice was strong. Aisha, too, was angry with him. Consequently, a group overpowered him and killed him. Then, people swore allegiance to me, not by force or compulsion, but obediently and out of their free will.

Arabic: وَاعْلَمُوا أَن دَارَ الْهِجْرَةِ قَدْ قَلَعَتْ بِأَهْلِهَا وَقَلَعُوا بِهَا، وَجَاشَتْ جَيْشَ الْمِرْجَلِ، وَقَامَتِ الْفِتْنَةُ عَلَى الْقُطْبِ، فَأَسْرِعُوا إِلَى أَمِيرِكُمْ، وَبَادِرُوا جَهَادَ عَدُوكُمْ، إِنْ شَاءَ اللهُ.
English: You should know that Medina has been vacated by its residents who have abandoned it. It is boiling like a huge cauldron and rebellion is fixed on its axis, moving with full force. So, hasten towards your amir (commander) and proceed forward to fight your enemy, if Allah, to Whom Might and Majesty belong, so wills.

Arabic: سقطمنالنسخة
English: Ibn Maythmam writes (in Sharh Nahjul-Balagha, Vol. 4, p. 338) that when on hearing about themischief-mongering of Talhah and az- Zubayr, Imam Ali ibn Abu Talibset off for Basra. He sent this letter to the people of Kufa through Imam al-Hassan and Ammar ibn Yasir from [the town of] al-Maa’al-Adhb, while ibn Abul-Hadid has written (in Sharh Nahjul-Balagha, Vol. 14, pp. 8, 16; al-Tabari, Vol. 1, p. 3139, and ibn al-Athir, Vol. 3, p. 223) that when Imam Ali ibn Abu Talibcamped at ar-Rabadha, he sent this letter through Muhammad ibn Jafar ibn Abu Talib and Muhammad ibn Abu Bakr. In this letter, Imam Ali ibn Abu Talibclearly sheds a light on the point that the assassination of Othman was the result of the efforts of Aisha, Talhah and az-Zubayr, and that it was they who played a major role in it. In fact, Aisha went beyond her bounds and exposed his shortcomings in public meetings, ordering that he should be killed. Thus, Shaikh Muhammad Abdo has written the following: “Once, Othman was on the pulpit when Umm al-Mu’minin [mother of the faithful] Aisha took out the shoes and the shirt of the Prophetfrom under her outer covering mantle and said the following: ‘These are the shoes of the Messenger of Allah and his shirt. They have not yet decayed while you have altered his religion and changed his Sunnah.’ Upon this, heated words were exchanged between them following which she said, ‘Kill this Na’thal’, likening Othman with a known long-bearded Jew (of that name)” (Nahjul-Balagha, printed in Egypt, Vol. 2, p. 3; also see Ansab al-Ashraf, Vol. 5, p. 88; Abul-Fida’, Vol. 1, p. 172).People were already displeased with Othman, so this event increased their boldness. They, hence, surrounded his mansion so that he might mend his ways or abdicate from the caliphate. In these circumstances, there was serious apprehension that if he did not accept either of the two alternatives, he would be killed. All this was observed by Aisha, but she paid no heed to it and, leaving him under siege, she decided to leave Medina for Mecca. On this occasion, Marwan ibn al- Hakam [her cousin] and Attab ibn Asld said the following to her, “If you postpone your departure, it is possible his [‘Othman’s] life may be saved and this crowd [laying siege around his mansion] may disperse,” whereupon she said that she had decided to go for hajj and that that could not be changed. It was then that Marwan recited this couplet by way of a proverb:Qays set fire to my cities, and when they were ablaze,He slipped away, saving himself clear of it.Similarly, Talhah and az-Zubayr were also very angry with him and they were in the vanguard of those fanning this fire, intensifying the opposition to his caliphate. From this angle, they were, to a great extent, taking part in the assassination and were responsible for shedding his blood. Other people also knew them in this light and regarded them as his murderers, while their supporters, too, were not able to offer any explanation (for absolving them). Thus, Ibn Qutaybah writes that when al- Mughirah ibn Shu’bah met Aisha at Awtas, he asked her the following question: “O Umm al-Mu’minin! Where are you bound for?” She replied, “I am going to Basra.” He inquired for what purpose and she replied, “To avenge Othman’s murder.” He said, “But his assassins are with you!” Then he turned to Marwan and inquired where he was going. He replied that he, too, was going to Basra. He inquired about the purpose and the reply was: “To avenge Othman’s murder.” Then he again said, “’Othman’s assassins are with you. These Talhah and az-Zubayr have killed him” (Al-Imama wal-Siyasa, Vol. 1, p. 60).In any case, when, after laying the blame on Imam Ali ibn Abu Talib, this group that had killed Othman reached Basra, Imam Ali ibn Abu Talibalso rose to quell this mischief; he wrote this letter to the people of Kufa to solicit their support. Upon this, their combatants and warriors rose in large numbers and enlisted in his army. They faced the enemy with full courage which Imam Ali ibn Abu Talibalso acknowledged. Thus, the letter hereafter is in acknowledgment.

Arabic: ومن كتاب له (عليه السلام)إليهم، بعد فتح البصرة.
English: Written to the People of Kufa after the Victory in Basra.

Arabic: وَجَزَاكُمُ اللهُ مِنْ أَهْلِ مِصْر عَنْ أَهْلِ بَيْتِ نَبِيكُمْ أَحْسَنَ مَا يَجْزِي الْعَامِلِينَ بِطَاعَتِهِ، وَالشاكِرِينَ لِنِعْمَتِهِ، فَقَدْ سَمِعْتُمْ وَأَطَعْتُمْ، وَدُعِيتُمْ فَأَجَبْتُمْ.
English: May Allah reward you, townsmen (of Kufa), on behalf of a member of your Prophet’s family, with the best reward that He bestows on those who act in obedience to Him and on those who thank Him for His bounties. Surely, you heard (me) and obeyed, and when you were called upon, you promptly responded.

Arabic: ومن كتاب كتبه (عليه السلام) لشريح بن الحارث قاضيه
English: Written to Shurayh ibn al-Harith (al-Kindi), Kufa’s Judge

Arabic: روي أنّ شريح بن الحارث قاضي أمير المؤمنين(عليه السلام) اشترى على عهده داراً بثمانين ديناراً، فبلغه(عليه السلام)ذلك، فاستدعى شريحاً، وقال له:
English: It is related that Shurayh ibn al-Harith (al-Kindi), who was Imam Ali ibn Abu Talib’s Qadi (judge) of Kufa, during his tenure, bought a house for eighty dinars. When it became known to Imam Ali ibn Abu Talib, he sent for him saying:

Arabic: بَلَغَنِي أَنكَ ابْتَعْتَ دَاراً بِثَمانِينَ دِينَاراً، وَكَتَبْتَ لَهَا كِتَاباً، وَأَشْهَدْتَ فِيهِ شُهُوداً.
English: سقطمنالنسخة

Arabic: فقال شريح: قد كان ذلك يا أمير المؤمنين.
English: Shurayh replied, “Yes, O Imam ibn Abu Talib; it is so.”

Arabic: قال: فنظر إليه (عليه السلام) نظر مغضب ثمّ قال له:
English: Imam Ali ibn Abu Talibcast an angry look at him and said:

Arabic: يَا شُرَيْحُ، أَمَا إِنهُ سَيَأْتِيكَ مَنْ لاَ يَنْظُرُ فِي كِتَابِكَ، وَلاَ يَسْأَلُكَ عَنْ بَينَتِكَ، حَتى يُخْرِجَكَ مِنْهَا شَاخِصاً، وَيُسْلِمَكَ إلَى قَبْرِكَ خَالِصاً.
English: O Shurayh, beware, shortly one person (the angel of death) will come to you who will not look at the document, nor will he question you about your testimony but take you out of it far away and deposit you in your grave quite alone.

Arabic: فَانْظُرْ يَا شُرَيْحُ لاَ تَكُونُ ابْتَعْتَ هذِهِ الدارَ مِنْ غَيْرِ مَالِكَ، أَوْ نَقَدْتَ الثمَنَ مِنْ غَيْرِ حَلاَلِكَ! فَإِذَا أَنْتَ قدْ خَسِرْتَ دَارَ الدنْيَا وَدَارَ الاْخِرَةِ!
English: Look, O Shurayh! If you have purchased this house from money other than yours, or paid the price from an unlawful source, you have incurred on your soul the loss of this world as well as of the next.

Arabic: أَمَا إِنكَ لَوْ كُنْتَ أَتَيْتَنِي عِنْدَ شِرَائِكَ مَا اشْتَرَيْتَ لَكَتَبْتُ لَكَ كِتاباً عَلَى هذِهِ النسْخَةِ، فَلَمْ تَرْغَبْ فِي شِرَاءِ هذِهِ الدارِ بِدِرْهَم فَمَا فَوْقُ.والنسخة هذه:
English: If you had come to me at the time of purchase, I would have written for you a document on this paper, then you would have liked to purchase the house even for one dirham, not to speak of more.That document is this:

Arabic: هذَا مَا اشْتَرَى عَبْدٌ ذَلِيلٌ، مِنْ مَيت قَدْ أُزْعِجَ لِلرحِيلِ.
English: This is about a purchase made by a humble slave (of Allah) from another slave ready to depart (for the next world).

Arabic: اشْتَرَى مِنْهُ دَاراً مِنْ دَارِ الْغُرُورِ، مِنْ جَانِبِ الْفَانِينَ، وَخِطةِ الْهَالِكِينَ.
English: He has purchased a house out of houses of deceit in the area of mortals and in the neighborhood of mortals.

Arabic: وَتَجْمَعُ هذِهِ الدارَ حُدُودٌ أَرْبَعَةٌ: الْحَد الاولُ يَنْتَهِي إِلَى دَوَاعِي الاْفَاتِ، وَالْحَد الثانِي يَنْتَهِي إِلَى دَوَاعِي الْمُصِيباتِ، وَالْحَد الثالِثُ يَنْتَهِي إلَى الْهَوَى الْمُرْدِي، وَالْحَد.
English: This house has four boundaries as follows: The first boundary is contiguous to sources of calamities; the second boundary adjoins the sources of distress; the third boundary adjoins devastating desires.

Arabic: الرابِعُ يَنْتَهِي إِلَى الشيْطَانِ الْمُغْوِي، وَفِيهِ يُشْرَعُ بَابُ هذِهِ الدارِ.
English: and the fourth boundary adjoins deceitful Satan, and it is towards this that the door of this house opens.

Arabic: اشْتَرَى هذَا الْمُغْتَر بِالامَلِ، مِنْ هذَا الْمُزْعَجِ بِالاجَلِ، هذِهِ الدارَ بِالْخُرُوجِ مِنْ عِز الْقَنَاعَةِ، وَالدخُولِ فِي ذُل الطلَبِ وَالضرَاعَةِ.
English: This house has been purchased by one who has been waylaid by desires from one who is being driven by death at the price of leaving the honor of contentment and entering into the humility of want and submissiveness.

Arabic: فَمَا أَدْرَكَ هذَا الْمُشْتَرِي فِيَما اشْتَرَى مِنْ دَرَك، فَعَلَى مُبَلْبِلِ أَجْسَامِ الْمُلُوكِ، وسَالِبِ نُفُوسِ الْجَبَابِرَةِ، وَمُزِيلِ مُلْكِ الْفَراعِنَةِ، مِثْلِ كِسْرَى وَقَيْصَرَ، وَتُبع وَحِمْيَرَ.
English: If the buyer encounters some (evil) consequences of this transaction, then it is for the one who dismantles the bodies of monarchs, snatches the lives of despots, destroys the domain of Pharaohs, Kisras, Caesars, Tubbas and Himyars

Arabic: وَمَنْ جَمَعَ الْمَالَ عَلَى الْمَالِ فَأَكْثَرَ، وَمَنْ بَنَى وَشَيدَ، وَزَخْرَفَ وَنَجدَ، وَادخَرَ واعْتَقَدَ، وَنَظَرَ بِزَعْمِهِ لِلْوَلَدِ، إِشْخَاصُهُمْ جَمِيعاً إِلَى مَوْقِفِ الْعَرْضِ وَالْحِسَابِ، وَمَوْضِعِ الثوَابِ وَالْعِقَابِ.
English: and all those who amass wealth upon wealth and go on increasing it, who build high houses and decorate them and collect treasures and preserve them, as they claimed according to their own thinking, for children to take them to the place of accounting and judgement and the status of reward and punishment.

Arabic: إذَا وَقَعَ الامْرُ بِفَصْلِ الْقَضَاءِ، (وَخَسِرَ هُنَا لِكَ الْمُبْطِلُونَ)
English: “When the verdict will be passed those who stood on falsehood will then be the losers” (Holy Quran, 40: 78).

Arabic: شَهِدَ عَلَى ذلِكَ الْعَقْلُ إِذَا خَرَجَ مِنْ أَسْرِ الْهَوَى، وَسَلِمَ مِنْ عَلاَئِقِ الدنْيَا.
English: This document is appreciated by intelligence when free from the shackles of desire and from the adornments of this world.

Arabic: ومن كتاب كتبهإلى بعض أُمراء جيشه.
English: To One of the Officers of His Army

Arabic: فَإِنْ عَادُوا إِلَى ظِل الطاعَةِ فَذَاكَ الذِي نُحِب.
English: If they return to the umbrella of obedience, then this is all that we want.

Arabic: وَإِنْ تَوَافَتِ الامُورُ بِالْقَوْمِ إِلَى الشقَاقِ وَالْعِصْيَانِ فَانْهَدْ بِمَنْ أَطاعَكَ إِلَى مَنْ عَصَاكَ.
English: But if the condition of these people points out towards disruption and disobedience, then, taking with you those who obey you, you must rush against those who disobey you.

Arabic: وَاسْتَغْنِ بِمَنِ انْقَادَ مَعَكَ عَمنْ تَقَاعَسَ عَنْكَ، فَإِن الْمُتَكَارِهَ مَغِيبُهُ خَيْرٌ مِنْ شُهُودِهِ، وَقُعُودُهُ أَغْنَى مِنْ نُهُوضِهِ.
English: While you have those with you who follow you, do not worry about those who hold back from you because the absence of a half-hearted man is better than his presence, and his sitting down is better than his rising.

Arabic: ومن كتاب له (عليه السلام)إلى الاشعث بن قيس عامل أذربيجان.
English: To al-Ash’ath ibn Qays (al-Kindi), Governor of Azerbaijan

Arabic: وَإِن عَمَلَكَ لَيْسَ لَكَ بِطُعْمَة، وَلكِنهُ فِي عُنُقِكَ أَمَانةٌ، وَأَنْتَ مُسْتَرْعىً لِمَنْ فَوْقَكَ.
English: Certainly, your assignment is not a morsel for you, but it is a trust round your neck, and you have been charged with the protection (of the people) on behalf of your superiors.

Arabic: لَيْسَ لَكَ أَنْ تَفتَاتَ فِي رَعِية، وَلاَ تُخَاطِرَ إِلا بِوَثِيقَة.
English: It is not for you to be oppressive towards the subjects, nor to put your life at risk save on strong grounds.

Arabic: وَفي يَدَيْكَ مَالٌ مِنْ مَالِ اللهِ عَزوَجَل، وَأَنْتَ مِنْ خُزانِهِ حَتى تُسَلمَهُ إِلَي.
English: You have in your hands the funds which are the property of Allah to Whom belong Might and Majesty, and you hold its charge till you pass it on to me.

Arabic: وَلَعَلي أَلا أَكُونَ شَر وُلاَتِكَ لَكَ، وَالسلاَمُ.
English: Probably I will not be one of the bad rulers for you, and this is the end of the matter.

Arabic: سقطمنالنسخة
English: When Imam Ali ibn Abu Talibwas through with the Battle of Jamal, he wrote to al-Ash’ath ibn Qays (al-Kindi), who had been the Governor of Azerbaijan since the days of Othman, to send the revenue and levies of his province to him [in Kufa]. But since al-Ash’ath had fears about the future of his status and assignment, he intended to pocket all this money like other officers appointed by Othman. Therefore, as soon as this letter reached him, he sent for his chief associates. Having mentioned this letter to them, he said the following: “I fear that this money will be taken away from me; I, therefore, intend to join Mu’awiyah.” It was then that those people said that it was a matter of shame to leave the kith and kin and to seek refuge with Mu’awiyah. Consequently, on the advice of those people, he postponed the implementation of his idea to run away, but he did not agree to part with the money. On getting this information, Imam Ali ibn Abu Talibsent Hijr ibn Adiy al-Kindi to bring the man to him to Kufa. He persuaded him and brought him to Kufa. On reaching there, his kit was found to contain four hundred thousand Dirhams out of which Imam Ali ibn Abu Talibleft thirty thousand for the man and deposited the rest in the public treasury.

Arabic: ومن كتاب له (عليه السلام)إلى معاوية.
English: To Mu’awiyah (ibn Abu Sufyan).

Arabic: إِنهُ بَايَعَنِي الْقَوْمُ الذِينَ بَايَعُوا أَبَا بَكْر وَعُمَرَ وَعُثْمانَ عَلَى مَا بَايَعُوهُمْ عَلَيْهِ.
English: Verily, those who swore allegiance to Abu Bakr, Umar and Othman have sworn allegiance to me on the same basis on which they swore allegiance to them.

Arabic: فَلَمْ يَكُنْ لِلشاهِدِ أَنْ يَخْتَارَ، وَلاَ لِلغَائِبِ أَنْ يَرُد، وَإنمَا الشورَى لِلْمُهَاجِرِينَ وَالانْصَارِ.
English: Whoever was present had no choice (tconsider), and whoever was absent had no right to reject, and consultation was confined to the Muhajirun and the Ansar.

Arabic: فَإِنِ اجْتَمَعُوا عَلَى رَجُل وَسَموْهُ إِمَاماً كَانَ ذلِكَ لله رِضىً.
English: If they agree on an individual and take him to be the Caliph, it will be deemed to imply seeking Allah’s pleasure.

Arabic: فَإِنْ خَرَجَ عَنْ أَمْرِهِمْ خَارِجٌ بِطَعْن أَوْبِدْعَة رَدوهُ إِلَى مَاخَرَجَ منه.
English: If anyone keeps away by way of demonstrating his objection or for innovation, they will return him to the status from where he kept away.

Arabic: فَإِنْ أَبَى قَاتَلُوهُ عَلَى اتبَاعِهِ غَيْرَ سَبِيلِ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ، وَوَلاهُ اللهُ مَا تَوَلى.
English: If he refuses, they will fight him for following a course other than that of the believers, and Allah will put him back from where he had run away.

Arabic: وَلَعَمْرِي، يَا مُعَاوِيَةُ، لَئِنْ نَظَرْتَ بِعَقْلِكَ دُونَ هَوَاكَ لَتَجِدَني أَبْرَأَ الناسِ مِنْ دَمِ عُثْمانَ، وَلَتَعْلَمَن أَني كُنْتُ فِي عُزْلَة عَنْهُ، إِلا أَنْ تَتَجَنى.
English: By my life, O Mu’awiyah, if you see with your brain without any passion, you will find me the most innocent of all with regard to Othman’s blood, and you will surely know that I was in seclusion from him, unless you conceal what is quite open to you.

Arabic: فَتَجَن مَا بَدَا لَكَ! وَالسلاَمُ.
English: Then you may commit an outrage (on me) as you like, and that is the end of the matter.

Arabic: ومن كتاب منه(عليه السلام)إليه أيضاً
English: To Mu’awiyah

Arabic: أَما بَعْدُ، فَقَدْ أَتَتْني مِنْكَ مَوْعِظَةٌ مُوَصلَةٌ، وَرِسَالَةٌ مُحَبرَةٌ.
English: I have received from you the packet of unconnected pieces of advice and an embellished letter.

Arabic: نَمقْتَهَا بِضَلاَلِكَ، وَأَمْضَيْتَهَا بِسُوءِ رَأْيِكَ.
English: You have written it because of your misguidance and dispatched it because of your lack of wisdom.

Arabic: وَكِتَابُ امْرِىء لَيْسَ لَهُ بَصَرٌ يَهْدِيهِ، وَلاَ قَائِدٌ يُرْشِدُهُ.
English: This is the letter of a man who has neither light to show him the way nor a leader to guide him on the right path.

Arabic: قَدْ دَعَاهُ الْهَوَى فَأَجَابَهُ، وَقَادَهُ الضلاَلُ فَاتبَعَهُ، فَهَجَرَ لاَغِطاً، وَضَل خَابِطاً.
English: Passion prompted him and he responded to it. Misguidance led him and he followed it. Consequently, he began to speak nonsense and went recklessly astray.

Arabic: ومن هذا الكتاب،
English: An Excerpt from the Same Letter:

Arabic: لانهَا بَيْعَهٌ وَاحِدَةٌ لاَ يُثَنى فِيهَا النظَرُ، وَلاَ يُسْتَأْنَفُ فِيهَا الْخِيَارُ.
English: Because allegiance is once and for all, it is not open for reconsideration, nor is there any scope for fresh proceedings of an election.

Arabic: الْخَارِجُ مِنْهَا طَاعِنٌ، وَالْمُرَوي فِيهَا مُدَاهِنٌ.
English: Whoever remains out of it is deemed to be critical of Islam, while whoever remains argumentative about it is a hypocrite.

Arabic: ومن كتاب له (عليه السلام)إلى جرير بن عبدالله البجلي لما أرسله إلى معاوية.
English: To Jarir Ibn Abdillah Al-bajali When Imam Ali Ibn Abu TalibSent Him to Mu’awiyah (And There Was a Delay in His Return).

Arabic: أَما بَعْدُ، فَإِذَا أَتَاكَ كِتَابِي فَاحْمِلْ مُعَاوِيَةَ عَلَى الْفَصْلِ، وَخُذْهُ بَالامْرِ الْجَزْمِ.
English: When you receive this letter of mine, you must ask Mu’awiyah to take a final decision and to follow a determined course.

Arabic: ثُم خَيرْهُ بَيْنَ حَرْب مُجْلِيَة، أَوْ سِلْم مُخْزِيَة.
English: Then ask him to choose either war that exiles him from home or a dishonorable peace.

Arabic: فَإِنِ اخْتَارَ الْحَرْبَ فَانْبِذْ إِلَيْهِ، وَإِنِ اخْتَارَ السلْمَ فَخُذْ بَيْعَتَهُ، وَالسلاَمُ.
English: If he chooses war, leave him alone, but if he chooses peace, secure an oath of allegiance from him, and that is an end to the matter.

Arabic: ومن كتاب له (عليه السلام)إلى معاوية
English: To Mu’awiyah

Arabic: فَأَرَادَ قَوْمُنَا قَتْلَ نَبِينَا، وَاجْتِيَاحَ أَصْلِنَا.
English: Our people (the tribesmen of Quraish) decided to kill our Prophetand to uproot us.

Arabic: وَهَموا بِنَا الْهُمُومَ، وَفَعَلُوا بِنَا الافَاعِيلَ، وَمَنَعُونَا الْعَذْبَ، وَأَحْلَسُونَا الْخَوْفَ، وَاضْطَرونَا إِلَى جَبَل وَعْر، وَأَوْقَدُوا لَنَا نَارَ الْحَرْبِ.
English: They caused us many worries, behaved with us harshly, denied us the ease of life, exposed us to fear, forced us to seek refuge in a rugged mountain and ignited for us the flames of war.

Arabic: فَعَزَمَ اللهُ لَنَا عَلَى الدب عَنْ حَوْزَتِهِ، وَالرمْيِ مِنْ وَرَاءِ حُرْمَتِهِ.
English: Allah then gave us determination to protect His religion and defend His honor.

Arabic: مُؤْمِنُنَا يَبْغِي بِذلِكَ الاجْرَ، وَكَافِرُنَا يُحَامِي عَنِ الاصْلِ.
English: The believers among us expected (heavenly) rewards from so doing, and the unbelievers among us gave their support because of kinship.

Arabic: وَمَنْ أَسْلَمَ مِنْ قُرَيش خِلْوٌ مِما نَحْنُ فِيهِ بِحِلْف يَمْنَعُهُ، أَوْ عَشِيرَة تَقُومُ دُونَهُ، فَهُوَ مِنَ الْقَتْلِ بِمَكَانِ أَمْن.
English: Those who accepted Islam from among the tribesmen of Quraish were away from the distresses in which we were involved either because of a pledge that protected them or because of the tribe that would rise to support them. They were, therefore, safe from being killed.

Arabic: وَكَانَ رَسُولُ اللهِ(صلى الله عليه وآله) إذَا احْمَر الْبَأْسُ، وَأَحْجَمَ الناسُ، قَدمَ أَهْلَ بَيْتِهِ فَوَقَى بِهِمْ أَصَحَابَهُ حَر السيُوفِ وَالاسِنةِ.
English: The way with the Prophetwas that when fighting became fierce and people began to lose ground, he would send forward members of his family and through them protect his companions from the attacks with swords and spears.

Arabic: فَقُتِلَ عُبَيْدَةُ بْنُ الْحَارِثِ يَوْمَ بَدْر، وَقُتِلَ حَمْزَةُ يَوْمَ أُحُد، وَقُتِلَ جعفر يَوْمَ مُؤْتَةَ.
English: In this way, Ubaydah ibn al-Harith was killed on the Day of Badr, Hamzah (ibn ‘ Abdul-Muttalib) on the Day of Uhud, and Jafar (ibn Abu Talib) on the Day of Mu’tah.

Arabic: وَأَرَادَ مَنْ لَوْ شِئْتُ ذَكَرْتُ اسْمَهُ مِثْلَ الذِي أَرَادُوا مِنَ الشهَادَةِ، وَلكِن آجَالَهُمْ عُجلَتْ،مَنِيتَهُ أُجلَتْ.
English: One more person, whom I can name if I wish, desired to seek martyrdom as they did, but their deaths approached, while his had not.

Arabic: فَيَاعَجَباً لِلدهْرِ! إِذْ صِرْتُ يُقْرَنُ بِي مَنْ لَمْ يَسْعَ بِقَدَمِي، وَلَمْ تَكُنْ لَهُ كَسَابِقَتِي التِي لاَ يُدْلِي أحَدٌ بِمِثْلِهَا، إِلا أَنْ يَدعِيَ مُدع مَا لاَ أَعْرِفُهُ.
English: How strange it is that I am being grouped with him who never had a briskness of pace like mine, nor had he, to his credit, any achievement like mine unless he claims something of which I do not know.

Arabic: وَلاَ أَظُن اللهَ يَعْرِفُهُ، وَالْحَمْدُ لله عَلَى كُل حَال.
English: In any case, all praise belongs to Allah.

Arabic: وَأَما مَا سَأَلْتَ مِنْ دَفْعِ قَتَلَةِ عُثْمانَ إِلَيْكَ، فَإِني نَظَرْتُ فِي هذَا الامْرِ، فَلَمْ أَرَهُ يَسَعُنِي دَفْعُهُمْ إِلَيْكَ وَلاَ إِلَى غَيْرِكَ.
English: As regarding your request to hand over to you the murderers of Othman, I have contemplated over this matter and I do not find that handing them over to you or to someone else is possible for me.

Arabic: وَلَعَمْرِي لَئِنْ لَمْ تَنْزِعْ عَنْ غَيكَ وَشِقَاقِكَ لَتَعْرِفَنهُمْ عَنْ قَلِيل يَطلُبُونَكَ.
English: By my life, if you do not give up your wrong ways and disruptive deeds, you would surely know them.

Arabic: لاَ يُكَلفُونَكَ طَلَبَهُمْ فِي بَرّ وَلاَ بَحْر، وَلاَ جَبَللاَ سَهْل.
English: They would shortly be seeking you and would not give you the trouble of seeking them on land, sea, mountains or plains.

Arabic: إِلا أَنهُ طَلَبٌ يَسُوءُكَ وِجْدَانُهُ، وَزَوْرٌ لاَ يَسُركَ لُقْيَانُهُ، وَالسلاَمُ لاهْلِهِ.
English: But this search would be painful for you and their visit would not give you happiness. Peace be on those whoever deserves it.

Arabic: ومن كتاب له (عليه السلام)إليه أيضاً
English: To Mu’awiyah

Arabic: وَكَيْفَ أَنْتَ صَانِعٌ إِذَا تَكَشفَتْ عَنْكَ جَلاَبِيبُ مَا أَنْتَ فِيهِ مِنْ دُنْيَا قَدْ تَبَهجَتْ بِزِينَتِهَا، وَخَدَعَتْ بِلَذتِهَا.
English: What would you do when the coverings of this world in which you are wrapped are removed from you? The world attracted you with its embellishments and deceived you with its pleasures.

Arabic: دَعَتْكَ فَأَجَبْتَهَا.
English: It called you, and you responded to it.

Arabic: وَقَادَتْكَ فَاتبَعْتَهَا.
English: It led you, and you followed it.

Arabic: وَأَمَرَتْكَ فَأَطَعْتَهَا.
English: It commanded you, and you obeyed it.

Arabic: وَإِنهُ يُوشِكُ أَنْ يَقِفَكَ وَاقِفٌ عَلَى مَا لاَ يُنْجيِكَ مِنْهُ.
English: Shortly an informer will inform you of things against which there will be no shield (to protect you).

Arabic: ِجَن، فَاقْعَسْ عَنْ هذَا الامْرِ، وَخُذْ أُهْبَةَ الْحِسَابِ، وَشَمرْ لِمَا قَدْ نَزَلَ بِكَ، وَلاَ تُمَكنِ الْغُوَاةَ مِنْ سَمْعِكَ.
English: Therefore, keep off from this affair, take heed of the accounting (on the Day of Judgement), get ready for death that will soon overtake you, and do not lend your ears to those who have gone astray.

Arabic: موَإِلا تَفْعَلْ أُعْلِمْكَ مَا أَغْفَلْتَ مِنْ نَفْسِكَ، فَإِنكَ مُتْرَفٌ.
English: If you do not do so, I shall recall to you whatever you have forgotten because you are a man living in ease and luxury.

Arabic: قَدْ أَخَذَ الشيْطَانُ مِنْكَ مَأْخَذَهُ، وَبَلَغَ فِيكَ أَمَلَهُ، وَجَرَى مِنْكَ مَجْرَى الروحِ وَالدمِ.
English: Satan has taken you in his clutches, secured his wishes in you and taken complete control of you like your soul and blood.

Arabic: وَمَتَى كُنْتُمْ يَا مُعَاوِيَةُ سَاسَةَ الرعِيةِ، وَوُلاَةَ أَمْرِ الامةِ ؟ بِغَيْرِ قَدَم سَابِق، وَلاَ شَرَف بَاسِق، وَنَعُوذُ بِاللهِ مِنْ لُزومِ سَوَابِقِ الشقَاءِ، وَأُحَذرُكَ أَنْ تَكُونَ مُتَمادِياً فِي غِرةِ الامْنِيةِ، مُخْتَلِفَ الْعَلاَنِيَةِ والسرِيرَةِ.
English: O Mu’awiyah! When were you ever a protector of the subjects and a guardian of the affairs of the people without granting some people distinction (over others)? We seek Allah’s protection against the befalling of previous misfortunes, and I warn you lest you should continue being deceived by desires and your outer appearance becomes different from your inner self.

Arabic: وَقَدْ دَعَوْتَ إِلَى الْحَرْبِ.
English: You have called me to war.

Arabic: فَدَعِ الناسَ جَانِباً وَاخْرُجْ إِلَي، وَأَعْفِ الْفَرِيقَينِ مِنَ الْقِتَالِ.
English: It is better if you left the people on one side and you yourself came out to meet me (on the battlefield) and thus spare both our parties having to fight.

Arabic: لِتَعْلَمَ أينَا الْمَرِينُ عَلَى قَلْبِهِ، وَالْمُغَطى عَلَى بَصَرِهِ!
English: It will then be known which one of us has a rusted heart and covered eyes.

Arabic: فَأَنَا أَبُو حَسَن قَاتِلُ جَدكَ وَخَالِكَ وأَخِيكَ شَدْخاً يَوْمَ بَدْر.
English: I am the father of al-Hassan who killed your grandfather (‘Utbah ibn Rabi’ah), your brother (Hanzalah ibn Abu Sufyan) and your uncle (Al-Walid ibn Utbah) by cutting them to pieces on the day of Badr.

Arabic: ذلكَ السيْفُ مَعِي، وَبِذلِكَ الْقَلْبِ أَلْقَى عَدُوي.
English: The same sword is with me, and I meet my adversary with the same heart.

Arabic: مَا اسْتَبْدَلْتُ دِيناً، وَلاَ اسْتَحْدَثْتُ نَبِيّاً.
English: I have not altered the religion, nor do I follow any new prophet.

Arabic: وَإني لَعَلَى الْمِنْهَاجِ الذِي تَرَكْتُمُوهُ طَائِعِينَ، وَدَخَلْتُمْ فِيهِ مُكْرَهِينَ.
English: I am surely treading on that very highway which you had willingly forsaken then was forced to adopt.

Arabic: وَزَعَمْتَ أَنكَ جِئْتَ ثَائراً بِدَمِ عُثْمانَ.
English: You think that you have come out seeking revenge for Othman’s blood.

Arabic: وَلَقَدْ عَلِمْتَ حَيْثُ وَقَعَ دَمُ عُثْمانَ فَاطْلُبْهُ مِنْ هُنَاكَ إِنْ كُنتَ طَالباً.
English: Certainly, you know how Othman’s blood was shed. If you want to avenge it, avenge it there.

Arabic: فَكَأَني قدْ رَأَيْتُكَ تَضِج مِنَ الْحَرْبِ إِذَا عَضتْكَ ضَجِيجَ آلْجِمَالِ بِالاثْقَالِ.
English: It is as though I see that when war is cutting you with its teeth, you cry like camels moaning under heavy loads.

Arabic: وَكَأَني بِجَمَاعَتِكَ تَدْعُونِي جَزَعاً مِنَ الضرْبِ الْمُتَتَابِعِ، وَالْقَضَاءِ الْوَاقِعِ، وَمَصَارِعَ بَعْدَ مَصَارِعَ، إِلَى كِتَابِ اللهِ، وَهِيَ كَافِرةٌ جَاحِدَهٌ، أَوْ مُبَايِعَةٌ حَائِدَةٌ.
English: And it is as though I see your party bewildered by the incessant striking of the swords, the occurrence of death, and the falling of bodies after bodies, calling me towards the Holy Quran although they would themselves be either unbelievers, deniers of the truth or renegades of allegiance after having sworn it.

Arabic: سقطمنالنسخة
English: This previous prediction of Imam Ali ibn Abu Talibis about the battle of Siffin. Herein, he has depicted the whole picture in very few words. Thus, on one side Muawiyah was bewildered on account of the attacks of the Iraqis and was thinking to run away while, on the other, his army was crying under the constant onslaught of death. Eventually, when there was no way to escape, they raised the Holy Quran on the spears and shouted for peace. By this device, the remaining persons saved their lives.This prediction, as ibn Abul-Hadid al-Mu’tazili says, “is either a true prophetic keen eye of Imam Ali ibn Abu Talib, which signifies a great power, or it is an information through knowledge of the unknown (ilmul-ghayb) which is the most significant and wonderful.However, both cases are in the state of extreme significance and beauty.Ibn Abul-Hadid has further quoted the same prediction from other letters of Imam Ali ibn Abu Talibto Mu’awiyah (Sharh Nahjul- Balagha, Vol. 15, pp. 83-85).This prediction cannot be attributed to imagination, to guessing or to the drawing of inference from events, nor can these details be ascertained by wit or far-sightedness. Only he could disclose them whose source of information is either the Prophet’s own revelation-bearing tongue or the Divine inspiration.

Arabic: ومن وصية وصّى بها(عليه السلام) جيشاً بعثه إلى العدو.
English: Given to the Contingent Sent to Confront an Enemy.

Arabic: فَإذَا نزَلتُمْ بِعَدُوّ أَوْ نَزَلَ بِكُمْ، فَلْيَكُنْ مُعَسْكَرُكُمْ فِي قُبُلِ الاشْرَافِ، أَوْ سِفَاحِ الْجِبَالِ، أَوْ أثْنَاءِ الانْهَارِ، كَيْما يَكُونَ لَكُمْ رِدْءاً، وَدُونَكُمْ مَرَدّاً.
English: When you proceed towards your enemy, the status of your force should be on the approaches of high grounds or edges of mountains or bends of rivers, so that it may serve you as a place to return to.

Arabic: وَلْتَكُنْ مُقَاتَلَتُكُمْ مِنْ وَجْه وَاحِد أَوِ اثْنيْنِ.
English: Your encounter should be from one side or from two.

Arabic: واجْعَلُوا لَكُمْ رُقَبَاءَ فِي صَيَاصِي الْجِبَالِ، وَمَنَاكِبِ الْهِضَابِ، لِئَلا يَأْتِيَكُمُ الْعَدُو مِنْ مَكَانِ مَخَافَة أَوْ أَمْن.
English: Position scouts on the peaks of mountains and the raised sides of the high ground so that the enemy may not approach you from any place, whether of danger or of safety.

Arabic: وَاعْلَمُوا أَن مُقَدمَةَ الْقَومِ عُيُونُهُمْ، وَعُيُونَ الْمُقَدمَةِ طَلاَئِعُهُمْ.
English: And be admonished that the vanguard of an army serves as their eyes and the eyes of the vanguard are their informers.

Arabic: وَإِياكُمْ وَالتفَرقَ.
English: Beware of dispersal.

Arabic: فَإِذَا نَزَلْتُمْ فَانْزِلُوا جَمِيعاً، وَإذا ارْتحَلْتُمْ فَارْتَحِلُوا جَمِيعاً.
English: When you halt, do so collectively, and when you move, you should move together.

Arabic: وَإِذَا غشِيكُمُ الليْلُ فَاجْعَلُوا الرمَاحَ كِفةً، وَلاَ تَذُوقُوا النوْمَ إِلا غِرَاراً أَوْ مَضْمَضَةً.
English: When night comes, fix your spears in a circle and do not sleep except for dosing or napping.

Arabic: ومن وصيته لمعقل بن قيس الرياحي حين أنفذه إلى الشام في ثلاثة آلاف مقدّمةً له.
English: Given to Ma’qil Ibn Qays ar-Riyahi as He Was Dispatched to Syria at the Command of a Vanguard Contingent of Three Thousand Strong.

Arabic: قال ع له: اتقِ اللهَ الذِي لاَبُدّ لَكَ مِنْ لِقَائِهِ، وَلاَ مُنْتَهَى لَكَ دُونَهُ.
English: Fear Allah before Whom attendance is inevitable and with other than Whom there is no meeting.

Arabic: وَلاَ تُقَاتِلَن إِلا مَنْ قَاتَلَكَ.
English: Do not fight except those who fight you.

Arabic: وَسِرِ الْبَرْدَيْنِ.
English: Travel in the two cool periods (i.e. morning and evening).

Arabic: غَورْ بِالناسِ.
English: Let the men have a midday sleep.

Arabic: وَرَفهْ فِي السيْرِ، وَلاَ تَسِرْ أَولَ الليْلِ، فَإِن اللهَ جَعَلَهُ سَكَناً، وَقَدرَهُ مُقَاماً لاَ ظَعْناً.
English: March easily and do not travel during the early night for Allah has made it for resting and has ordained it for staying, not for journeying.

Arabic: فَأَرِحْ فِيهِ بَدَنَكَ، وَرَوحْ ظَهْرَكَ.
English: Therefore, give rest to your body in the night and let your beasts of burden also rest.

Arabic: فَإِذَا وَقَفْتَ حِينَ يَنْبَطِحُ السحَرُ، أَوْ حِينَ يَنْفَجِرُ الْفَجْرُ، فَسِرْ عَلَى بَرَكَةِ اللهِ.
English: When you are sure that the morning has approached, and when dawn has drawn nigh, start your journey with Allah’s blessings.

Arabic: فَإِذَا لَقِيتَ الْعَدُو فَقِفْ مِنْ أَصْحَابِكَ وَسَطاً.
English: If you face the enemy, stand in the midst of your comrades.

Arabic: وَلاَ تَدْنُ مِنَ الْقَوْمِ دُنُو مَنْ يُريدُ أَنْ يُنْشِبَ الْحَرْبَ، وَلاَ تَبَاعَدْ منهم تَبَاعُدَ مَنْ يَهَابُ الْبَأْسَ، حَتى يَأْتِيَكَ أَمْرِي.
English: Do not get too near to the enemy like one who wants to commence the fighting, nor should you remain too distant like one who is afraid of action, till you receive my orders.

Arabic: وَلاَ يَحْمِلَنكُمْ شَنَآنُهُمْ عَلَى قِتَالِهِمْ، قَبْلَ دُعَائِهِمْ وَالاعْذَارِ إِلَيْهِمْ.
English: Hatred for them should not lead you to fight before inviting them (to guidance) and exhausting your pleas before them.

Arabic: ومن كتاب له (عليه السلام) إلى أميرين من أُمراء جيشه.
English: To Two Officers in His Army.

Arabic: وَقَدْ أَمرْتُ عَلَيْكُمَا وَعَلى مَنْ فِي حَيزِكُمَا مَالِكَ بْنَ الْحَارثِ الاشْترِ.
English: I have placed Malik 1 ibn al-Harith al-Ashtar in command over you and over all those under you.

Arabic: فَاسْمَعَا لَهُ وَأَطِيعاً، واجْعَلاَهُ دِرْعاً وَمِجَنّاً، فَإِنّهُ مِمنْ لاَ يُخَافُ وَهْنُهُ، وَلاَ سَقْطَتُهُ، وَلاَ بُطْؤُهُ عَما الاْسْرَاعُ إِلَيْهِ أَحْزَمُ، وَلاَ إِسْرَاعُهُ إِلَى مَا الْبُطءُ عَنْهُ أَمْثَلُ.
English: Therefore, follow his commands and take him as the armour and shield for yourselves because he is one of those from whom I have no fear of weakness nor any mistake, nor laziness where haste is more appropriate,nor haste where slackness is expected of him.

Arabic: ومن وصيّته (عليه السلام) لعسكره قبل لقاء العدوبصفّين.
English: To the Army Before the Encounter with the Enemy at Siffin.

Arabic: لاَ تُقَاتِلُوهُمْ حَتى يَبْدَأُوكُمْ، فَإِنكُمْ بِحَمْدِ اللهِ عَلَى حُجة، وَتَرْكُكُمْ إِياهُمْ حَتى يَبْدَأُوكُمْ حُجةٌ أُخْرَى لَكُمْ عَلَيْهِمْ.
English: Do not fight them unless they start the fighting because, by the grace of Allah, you are right, and to leave them till they begin fighting will be another point from your side against them.

Arabic: فَإذَا كَانَتِ الْهَزِيمَةُ بِإذْنِ اللهِ فَلاَ تَقْتُلُوا مُدْبِراً، وَلاَ تُصيِبُوا مُعْوِراً، وَلاَ تُجْهِزُوا عَلَى جَرِيح.
English: If, by the will of Allah, the enemy is defeated, do not kill those who flee away, do not strike a helpless person, do not finish off the wounded.

Arabic: لاَ تَهِيجُوا النسَاءَ بِأَذىً، وَإِنْ شَتَمْنَ أَعْرَاضَكُمْ، وَسَبَبْنَ أُمَرَاءَكُمْ، فَإِنهُن ضَعِيفَاتُ الْقُوَى وَالانْفُسِ وَالْعُقُولِ.
English: and do not inflict pain on women even though they may attack your honor with filthy words and abuse your officers because they are weak in character, mind and intelligence.

Arabic: إِنْ كُنا لَنُؤْمَرُ بِالْكَف عَنْهُن وَإِنهُن لَمُشْرِكَاتٌ.
English: We have been ordered to avoid them although they may be unbelievers.

Arabic: وَإِنْ كَانَ الرجُلُ لَيَتَنَاوَلُ الْمَرْأَةَ فِي الْجَاهِلِيةِ بِالْفِهْرِ أَوِ الْهِرَاوَةِ فَيُعَيرُ بِهَا وَعَقِبُهُ مِنْ بَعْدِهِ.
English: Even in pre-Islamic (jahiliyya) period, if a man struck a woman with a stone or a stick, he was rebuked along with his posterity after him.

Arabic: وكان(عليه السلام) يقول إذا لقى العدوّ محارباً:
English: By Imam Ali Ibn Abu TalibWhen He Used to Face the Enemy.

Arabic: اللهُم إِلَيْكَ أَفْضَتِ الْقُلُوبُ، وَمُدتِ الاعْنَاقُ، وَشَخَصَتِ الابْصَارُ، وَنُقِلَتِ الاقْدَامُ، وَأُنْضِيَتِ الابْدَانُ.
English: O Lord! Hearts are drawn to You, necks are stretching (towards You), eyes are fixed (on You), steps are in motion and bodies have turned lean!

Arabic: اللهُم قَدْ صَرحَ مَكْنُونُ الشنَآنِ، وَجَاشَتْ مَرَاجِلُ الاضْغَانِ.
English: O Lord! Hidden animosity has become manifest and the cauldrons of malice are boiling.

Arabic: اللهُم إِنا نَشْكُوا إِلَيكَ غَيْبَةَ نَبِينَا، وَكَثْرَةَ عَدُونَا، وَتَشَتتَ أَهْوَائِنَا.
English: O Lord! We complain to You of the absence of our Prophet, the numerousness of our enemy and the diffusion of our passions.

Arabic: (رَبنَا افْتَحْ بَيْنَنَا وَبَيْنَ قَوْمِنَا بِالْحَق وَأَنْتَ خَيْرُ الْفَاتِحِينَ)
English: “Our Lord! Decide between us and our people with truth; You are the Best of those who decide” (Holy Quran, 7: 89).

Arabic: وكان يقول (عليه السلام)لاصحابه عند الحرب
English: He Used to Issue this Instruction to His Followers During Battle Time.

Arabic: تَشْتَدن عَلَيْكُمْ فَرةٌ بَعْدَهَا كَرةٌ، وَلاَ جَوْلَةٌ بَعْدَهَا حَمْلَةٌ.
English: The retreat after which return is intended and the withdrawal after which an attack is in view should not make you unhappy.

Arabic: لاَ وَأَعْطُوا السيُوفَ حُقُوقَهَا.
English: Do justice with the swords (allow your swords to do their duties).

Arabic: وَوَطئُوا لِلْجُنُوبِ مَصَارِعَهَا، وَاذْمُرُوا أَنْفُسَكُمْ عَلَى الطعْنِ الْدعْسِي، وَالضرْبِ الطلَحْفِي، وَأَمِيتُوا الاصْوَاتَ، فإِنهُ أَطْردُ لِلْفَشَلِ.
English: Keep ready a place for the falling of bodies (of your foe); prepare yourselves for hurling strong spears and striking swords with full force, and keep your voices down as doing so keeps cowardice off.

Arabic: [فـ] والذِي فَلَقَ الْحَبةَ، وَبَرَأَ النسَمَةَ، مَا أَسْلَمُوا وَلَكِنِ اسْتَسْلَمُوا، وَأَسَروا الْكُفْرَ، فَلَما وَجَدُوا أَعْوَاناً عَلَيْهِ أَظْهَرُوهُ.
English: By the One Who broke open the seed (for growth) and created living beings, they had not accepted Islam but had only secured safety (by verbally professing it), hiding their lack of faith. Consequently, when they found helpers for their lack of faith, they disclosed it.

Arabic: ومن كتاب له (عليه السلام)إلى معاوية، جواباً عن كتاب منه
English: In Reply to a Letter from Muawiyah.

Arabic: وَأَما طَلَبُكَ إِلَي الشامَ، فَإِني لَمْ أَكُنْ لاعْطِيَكَ الْيَوْمَ مَا مَنَعْتُكَ أَمْسِ.
English: As for your demand to me to (hand over) Syria, I cannot give you today what I denied you the day before.

Arabic: وَأَما قَوْلُكَ: إِن الْحَرْبَ قَدْ أَكَلَتِ الْعَرَبَ إِلا حُشَاشَاتِ أَنْفُس بَقِيَتْ، فَمَنْ أَكَلَهُ الْحَق فَإِلَى [الْجَنةِ،مَنْ أَكَلَهُ الْبَاطِلُ فَإِلَى] النّارِ.
English: As regarding your statement that the war has eaten up Arabia save its last breath, you should know that those whose right has been eaten up will go to Paradise, whereas those who are wrong shall go to Hell.

Arabic: وَأَما اسْتِوَاؤُنَا فِي الْحَرْبِ والرجَالِ، فَلَسْتَ بِأَمْضَى عَلَى الشك مِني عَلَى الْيَقِينِ، وَلَيْسَ أَهْلُ الشامِ بِأَحْرَصَ عَلَى الدنْيَا مِنْ أَهْلِ الْعِرَاقِ عَلَى الاْخِرَةِ.
English: As for your equality in war and in (the numbers of) men, certainly you cannot be more penetrating in doubtfulness (of belief) than I am in certainty (of belief), and the people of Syria are not more greedy for this world than the people of Iraq are for the next one.

Arabic: وَأَما قَوْلُكَ: إِنا بَنُو عَبْدِ مَنَاف، فَكَذلِكَ نَحْنُ، وَلكِنْ لَيْسَ أُمَيةُ كَهَاشِمَ، وَلاَ حَرْبٌ كَعَبْدِ الْمُطلِبِ، وَلاَ أَبُوسُفْيَانَ كَأَبِي طَالِب.
English: As for your saying that both of us are sons of Abd Manaf, it is undoubtedly so, but Umayyah cannot be like Hashim, nor can Harb be like Abdul-Muttalib, nor can Abu Sufyan be like Abu Talib.

Arabic: وَلاَ المُهَاجرُ كَالطلِيقِ، وَلاَ الصرِيحُ كَاللصِيقِ، وَلاَ الْـمُحِق كَالْمُبطِلِ، وَلاَ الْمُؤْمِنُ كَالمُدْغِلِ.
English: The muhajir (immigrant) cannot be a match for whoever was set free (when Mecca fell), nor can one of a pure descent be a match for one who is adopted, nor the pursuer of truth can be a match to the adherent to wrongdoing, nor can a believer be a match for a hypocrite.

Arabic: وَلَبِئْسَ الْخَلَفُ خَلَفٌ يَتْبَعُ سَلَفاً هَوَى فِي نَارِ جَهَنمَ.
English: How bad are the successors who go on following their predecessors who have already fallen into the fire of Hell!

Arabic: وَفِي أَيْدِينَا بعْدُ فَضْلُ النبُوةِ التِي أَذْلَلْنَا بِهَا الْعَزِيزَ، وَنَعَشْنَا بِهَا الذلِيلَ.
English: Besides, we also have the distinction of Prophethood among us by virtue of which we subdued the strong and raised up the downtrodden.

Arabic: وَلَما أَدْخَلَ اللهُ الْعَرَبَ فِي دِينِهِ أَفْوَاجاً، وَأَسْلَمَتْ لَهُ هذِهِ الامةُ طَوْعاً وَكَرْهاً.
English: When Allah made Arabia enter (the fold of) His religion and when the [Arab] people submitted to it willingly or unwillingly.

Arabic: كُنْتُمْ مِمنْ دَخَلَ فِي الدينِ: إِما رَغْبَةً وَإِما رَهْبَةً، عَلَى حِينَ فَازَ أَهْلُ السبْقِ بِسَبْقِهِمْ، وَذَهَبَ الْمُهَاجِرُونَ الاولُونَ بِفَضْلِهِمْ.
English: you were among those who entered the religion either out of greed or out of fear, at a time when those who had gone first had preceded and when the first Muhajirun had acquired their own distinction.

Arabic: فَلاَ تَجْعَلَن لِلشيْطَانِ فِيكَ نَصِيباً، وَلاَ عَلَى نَفْسِكَ سَبِيلاً، وَالسلاَمُ.
English: Now, do not give Satan have a share in you, nor should you let him have his sway over you, and that is an end of the matter.

Arabic: ومن كتاب له (عليه السلام)إلى عبد الله بن العباس وهو عامله على البصرة
English: To Abdullah ibn Abbas, his Governor over Basra

Arabic: وَاعْلَمْ أَن الْبَصْرَةَ مَهْبِطُ إِبْلِيسَ، وَمَغْرِسُ الْفِتَنِ.
English: You should know that Basra is the place where Satan descends and mischief takes place.

Arabic: فَحَادِثْ أَهْلَهَا بِالاحْسَانِ إِلَيْهِمْ، وَاحْلُلْ عُقْدَةَ الْخَوْفِ عَنْ قُلُوبِهِمْ.
English: Keep the people of this place pleased with good treatment and remove the knots of fear from their hearts.

Arabic: وَقَدْ بَلَغَنِي تَنَمرُكَ لِبَنِي تَمِيم.
English: I have come to know of your strictness and harshness with Banu Tamim.

Arabic: وَغِلْظَتُكَ عَلَيْهِمْ، وَإِن بَنِي تَمِيم لَمْ يَغِبْ لَهُمْ نَجْمٌ إِلا طَلَعَ لَهُمْ آخَرُ، وَإِنهُمْ لَمْ يُسْبَقُوا بِوَغْم فِي جَاهِلِية وَلاَ إِسْلاَم.
English: Banu Tamim are such that if one star sets, another rises for them. They were never exceeded in (the art of) war in pre-Islamic times or after Islam.

Arabic: وَإِن لَهُمْ بِنَا رَحِماً مَاسةً، وَقَرَابَةً خَاصةً.
English: They have a special kinship with us and a particular relationship.

Arabic: نَحْنُ مَأْجُورُونَ عَلَى صِلَتِهَا، وَمَأزُورُونَ عَلَى قَطِيعَتِهَا.
English: We shall be rewarded if we pay heed to the tie of kinship and be deemed sinful if we disregard it.

Arabic: فَارْبَعْ أَبَا الْعَباسِ، رَحِمَكَ اللهُ، فِيَما جَرَى عَلَى يَدِكَ وَلِسَانِكَ مِنْ خَيْر وَشَرّ! فَإِنا شَرِيكَانِ فِي ذلِكَ.
English: O Abut-Abbas! May Allah have mercy on you! Keep yourself restrained in whatever you say or do, in anything good or bad relevant to your people, as we are both partners in this (responsibility).

Arabic: كُنْ عِنْدَ صَالِحِ ظَني بِكَ، وَلاَ يَفِيلَن رَأَيِي فِيكَ، وَالسلاَمُ.
English: Prove yourself according to my good impressions about you, and do not prove my opinion (about you) to be wrong, and this is the end of the matter.

Arabic: ومن كتاب له (عليه السلام)إلى بعض عماله.
English: To One of His Officers.

Arabic: أَما بَعْدُ، فَإِن دَهَاقِينَ أهْلِ بَلَدِكَ شَكَوْا مِنْكَ غِلْظَةً وَقَسْوَةً، وَاحْتِقَاراً وَجَفْوَةً.
English: Now, the cultivators [dahaqin, plural of dihqan] of your city have complained of your strictness, hard- heartedness, humiliating treatment and harshness.

Arabic: وَنَظَرْتُ فَلَمْ أَرَهُمْ أَهْلاً لانْ يُدْنَوْا لِشِرْكِهِمْ، وَلاَ أَنْ يُقْصَواْ وَيُجْفَوْا لِعَهْدِهِمْ، فَالْبَسْ لَهُمْ جِلْبَاباً مِنَ اللينِ تَشُوبُهُ بِطَرَف مِنَ الشدةِ.
English: I thought it over and found that since they are unbelievers, they cannot be brought near nor kept away nor treated severely because of the pledge with them.

Arabic: وَدَاوِلْ لَهُمْ بَيْنَ الْقَسْوَةِ وَالرأْفَةِ، وَامْزُجْ لَهُمْ بَيْنَ التقْرِيبِ وَالادْنَاءِ، وَالابْعَادِ وَالاقْصَاءِ، إِنْ شَاءَاللهُ.
English: Behave with them in-between strictness and softness, and adopt for them a mingling or remoteness, aloofness with nearness, if Allah so pleases.

Arabic: ومن كتاب له (عليه السلام)إلى زياد بن أبيه.
English: To Ziyad Ibn Abih.

Arabic: وهو خليفة عامله عبدالله بن العباس على البصرة، وعبد الله عامل أمير المؤمنين(عليه السلام)يومئذ عليها وعلى كور الاهواز وفارس وكرمان:
English: when Abdullah Ibn Abbas Was the Governor of Basra, the Suburbs of Ahwaz, Pars and Kirman, While Ziyad Was His Deputy in Basra.

Arabic: وَإِني أُقْسِمُ بِاللهِ قَسَماً صَادِقاً، لَئِنْ بَلَغَني أَنكَ خُنْتَ مِنْ فَيْءِ الْمُسْلِمِينَ شَيْئاً صَغِيراً أَوْ كَبِيراً، لاشُدن عَلَيْكَ شَدةً تَدَعُكَ قَلِيلَ الْوَفْرِ، ثَقِيلَ الظهْرِ، ضَئِيلَ الامْرِ، وَالسلاَمُ.
English: I truthfully swear by Allah that if I come to know that you have misappropriated the funds of the Muslim, small or big amounts, I shall inflict upon you such punishment that would leave you empty-handed, heavy backed and humiliated, and that is the end of the matter.

Arabic: ومن كتاب له (عليه السلام)إليه أيضاً
English: Also to Ziyad

Arabic: فَدَعِ الاسْرَافَ مُقْتَصِداً.
English: Give up luxury and be moderate.

Arabic: وَاذْكُرْ فِي الْيَوْمِ غَداً.
English: Every day, remember the coming Day [of Judgment].

Arabic: وَأَمْسِكْ مِنَ الْمَالِ بِقَدْرِ ضَرُورَتِكَ، وَقَدمِ الْفَضْلَ لِيَوْمِ حَاجَتِكَ.
English: Hold back from the funds what you need and send forward the balance for the day of your need.

Arabic: أَتَرْجُوا أَنْ يُعْطِيَكَ اللهُ أَجْرَ الْمُتَوَاضِعِينَ وَأَنْتَ عِنْدَهُ مِنَ الْمُتَكَبرِينَ!
English: Do you expect that Allah may give you the reward of the humble while you yourself remain vain in His view?

Arabic: وَتَطْمَعُ ـ وَأَنْتَ مُتَمَرغٌ فِي النعِيمِ، تَمْنَعُهُ الضعِيفَ والارْمَلَةَ ـ أَنْ يُوجِبَ لَكَ ثَوَابَ الْمتَصَدقِينَ؟
English: And do you covet that He may give you the reward of those practicing charity while you enjoy means of comfort, denying them to the weak and the widows?

Arabic: وَإِنمَا الْمَرْءُ مَجْزِيٌ بَمَا [أ] سلَفَ، وَقَادِمٌ عَلَى مَا قَدمَ، وَالسلاَمُ.
English: Certainly, a man is awarded according to his deeds. He shall meet what he has sent before, and that is the end of the matter.

Arabic: ومن كتاب له (عليه السلام)إلى عبدالله بن العباس
English: To Abdullah ibn Abbas.

Arabic: وكان ابن عباس يقول: ما انتفعت بكلام بعد كلام رسول الله كانتفاعي بهذا الكلام:
English: Abdullah ibn Abbas used to say, “Apart from the Prophet’s statements, I did not derive a greater benefit from any other statement.”

Arabic: أَما بَعْدُ، فَإِن الْمَرْءَ قَدْ يَسُرهُ دَرَكُ مَا لَمْ يَكُنْ لِيَفُوتَهُ، وَيَسُوؤُهُ فَوْتُ مَا لَمْ يَكُنْ لِيُدْرِكَهُ.
English: Let it be known to you that sometimes a man gets pleased with securing a thing which he was not going to miss at all and gets displeased at missing a thing which he would not in any case get.

Arabic: فَلْيَكُنْ سُرُورُكَ بِمَا نِلْتَ مِنْ آخِرَتِكَ، وَلْيَكُنْ أسَفُكَ عَلَى مَا فَاتَكَ مِنْهَا، وَمَا نِلْتَ مِنْ دُنْيَاكَ فَلاَ تُكْثِرْ بِهِ فَرَحاً، وَمَا فَاتَكَ مِنْهَا فَلاَ تَأْسَ عَلَيْهِ جَزَعاً.
English: Your pleasure should be about what you secure with regard to your next life, and our grief for having lost you should be for what you miss in respect thereof. Do not be very much pleased with what you secure from this world, nor should you get extremely grieved over what you miss of it.

Arabic: وَلْيَكُنْ هَمكَ فِيَما بَعْدَ الْمَوْتِ.
English: Your worry should be about what is to come after death.

Arabic: ومن كلام له (عليه السلام)قاله قُبَيْلَ موته لمّا ضربه ابن ملجم على سبيل الوصية
English: Made Shortly Before His Death When He Had Been Fatally Wounded by a Blow from the Sword of (Abd Ar-rahman) Ibn Muljim (The Curse of Allah Be Upon Him).

Arabic: وَصِيتِي لَكُمْ: أَنْ لاَ تُشْرِكُوا بِاللهِ شَيْئاً، وَمُحَمدٌ(صلى الله عليه وآله) فَلاَ تُضَيعُوا سُنتَهُ، أَقِيمُوا هذَيْنِ الْعَمُودَينِ، وَخَلاَ كُمْ ذَم.
English: I enjoin you, as my dying wish, not to regard anything as a partner with Allah, not to disregard the Sunnah of Muhammad. Establish these two pillars and light these two lamps. You will then be free from evil.

Arabic: أَنَا بالامْسِ صَاحِبُكُمْ، وَالْيَوْمَ عِبْرَةٌ لَكُمْ، وَغَداً مُفَارِقُكُمْ.
English: Yesterday, I was your companion. Today, I am (just) a lesson for you, while tomorrow I shall be leaving you.

Arabic: إِنْ أَبْقَ فَأَنَا وَلِي دَمِي، وَإِنْ أَفْنَ فَالْفَنَاءُ مِيعَادِي.
English: If I survive, I shall be the master of my blood (to avenge or not to avenge it), and if I die, then death is a promised event.

Arabic: وَإِنْ أَعْفُ فَالْعَفْوُ لِي قُرْبَةٌ، وَهُوَ لَكُمْ حَسَنَةٌ، فَاعْفُوا.
English: If I forgive, it is for me a means of nearness (to Allah) and for you a good deed. Therefore, do forgive. “What?!

Arabic: (أَلاَ تُحِبونَ أَنْ يَغْفِرَ اللهُ لَكُمْ).
English: Do not you love that Allah should forgive you?” (Holy Quran, 24: 22).

Arabic: وَاللهِ مَا فَجَأَنِي مِنَ الْمَوْتِ وَارِدٌ كَرِهْتُهُ، َلاَ طَالِعٌ أَنْكَرْتُهُ.
English: By Allah! This sudden death is not an event that I dislike, nor is it an accident that I hate.

Arabic: ووَمَا كُنْتُ إِلا كَقَارِب وَرَدَ، وَطَالِب وَجَدَ، (وَمَا عِنْدَ اللهِ خَيْرٌ لِلابْرَارِ)
English: I am just like a night traveller who reaches the spring (in the morning), or like or seeker who secures (his aim): “And whatever is with Allah is the best for the righteous” (Holy Quran, 3: 198).

Arabic: وقد مضى بعض هذا الكلام فيما تقدّم من الخطب، إلاّ أنّ فيه هاهنا زيادة أوجبت تكريره.
English: Sayyid ar-Radi says the following: “A portion of this statement has already appeared in the sermons, but I found it necessary to record it again because of some additional matter.”

Arabic: ومن وصية له (عليه السلام)بما يُعمل في أمواله، كتبها بعد منصرفه من صفين.
English: Imam Ali Ibn Abu Talib’s Will Regarding How His Property Should Be Dealt With. He Wrote it upon His Return from Siffin.

Arabic: هذَا مَا أَمَرَ بِهِ عَبْدُ اللهِ عَلِي بْنُ أَبِي طَالِب أمِيرُالْمُؤْمِنِينَ فِي مَالِهِ، ابْتِغَاءَ وَجْهِ اللهِ، لِيُولِجَني بِهِ الْجَنةَ، وَيُعْطِيَني الامَنَةَ.
English: This is what Ali ibn Abu Talib, the slave of Allah, has laid down about his property, seeking Allah’s pleasure, so that He may, by its virtue, grant him entry into Paradise and accord him peace.

Arabic: منها:فَإِنهُ يَقُومُ بِذلِكَ الْحَسنُ بْنُ علِيّ.
English: An excerpt from the same:It will be administered by [my oldest son] Hassan ibn Ali.

Arabic: يأْكُلُ مِنْهُ بِالْمعْروفِ، وَيُنْفِقُ مِنْهُ فِي المَعْروفِ.
English: He will take from it a suitable portion for his own livelihood while also spending of it on charity.

Arabic: فَإِنْ حَدَثَ بِحَسَن حَدَثٌ وَحُسَيْنٌ حَي، قَامَ بِالامْرِ بَعْدَهُ، وَأَصْدَرَهُ مَصْدَرَهُ.
English: If something happens to Hassan and Hussainsurvives him, he (Hussain []) will administer it after Hassan and deal with it accordingly.

Arabic: وَإِن لاِبْنَيْ فَاطِمَةَ مِنْ صَدَقةِ عَلِيّ مِثْلَ الذِي لِبَنِي عَلِيّ.
English: In the charitable estate of the two sons of Fatima, they have the same rights as all (other) sons of Ali.

Arabic: وَإِني إِنمَا جَعَلْتُ الْقِيَامَ بِذلِكَ إِلَى ابْنَيْ فَاطِمَةَ ابْتِغَاءَ وَجْهِ اللهِ، وَقُرْبَةً إِلَى رَسُولِ اللهِ(صلى الله عليه وآله)، وَتَكْرِيماً لِحُرْمَتِهِ، وَتَشْرِيفاً لِوُصْلَتِهِ.
English: I have laid down the (functions of) administration of the two sons of Fatimain order to seek the pleasure of Allah and nearness to the Messenger of Allahwith due regard for his honor and in consideration of his kinship [to them].

Arabic: وَيَشْتَرِطُ عَلَى الذِي يَجْعَلُهُ إِلَيْهِ أَنْ يَتْرُكَ الْمَالَ عَلَى أُصُولِهِ، وَيُنْقفِقَ مِنْ ثَمَرِهِ حَيْثُ أُمِرَ بِهِ وَهُدِيَ لَهُ.
English: It is obligatory on him who administers it to retain the estate as it is and to spends the surplus as he has been required and instructed.

Arabic: أَلا يَبِيعَ مِنْ أَوْلاَدِ نَخِيلَ هذِهِ الْقُرَى وَدِيةً حَتى تُشْكِلَ أَرْضُهَا غِرَاساً.
English: He should not sell the seedlings in the plantations of these villages till the land changes its face by turning them into [fully grown] plants.

Arabic: وَمَنْ كَانَ مِنْ إِمَائِي ـ اللاتِي أَطُوفُ عَلَيْهِن ـ لَهَا وَلَدٌ، أَوْهِيَ حَامِلٌ، فَتُمْسَكُ عَلَى وَلَدِهَا وَهِيَ مِنْ حَظهِ.
English: As for those of my slave girls, if any of them has a child or is pregnant, she would be retained for the sake of the [birth of the] child and will partake of his share.

Arabic: فَإِنْ مَاتَ وَلَدُهَا وَهِيَ حَيةٌ فَهِيَ عَتِيقَةٌ، قَدْ أَفْرَجَ عَنْهَا الرق، وَحَررَهَا الْعِتْقُ.
English: If the child dies and she survives, then she is free; bondage is removed from her and emancipation is granted to her.

Arabic: قوله (عليه السلام) في هذه الوصية: “وألا يبيع من نخلها وَدِيةً”، الوَدِيةُ: الفَسِيلَةُ، وجمعها وَدِي.
English: Sayyid ar-Radi says the following: “In this will, in Imam Ali ibn Abu Talib’s phrase ‘alla yabi’a min nakhliha wadiyyatan’, the word wadiyyah means ‘seedling of a date-palm’, and its plural is wadiyy.

Arabic: وَقوله (عليه السلام): “حتى تشكل أرضها غراساً” هو من أفصح الكلام.
English: And his words ‘hatta tushkila arduha ghirasan’ is one of the most eloquent form of expression.

Arabic: والمراد به: أن الارض يكثر فيها غراس النخل حتّى يراها الناظر على غير تلك الصفة التي عرفها بها فيشكل عليه أمرها ويحسبها غيرها.
English: and it means that when a number of date plants grow on the land, then whoever had seen it before the growth will now regard it as a different land.”

Arabic: ومن وصية له (عليه السلام)كان يكتبها لمن يستعمله على الصدقات.
English: Imam Ali ibn Abu Talibused to write the following to whoever he appointed for the collection of zakat and charities. Al- Sharif says the following:

Arabic: و إنما ذكرنا منها جملاً هاهنا ليُعلَمَ بها أنه(عليه السلام) كان يقيم عماد الحق، ويشرع أمثلة العدل، في صغير الامور وكبيرها، ودقيقها وجليلها.
English: “We have recorded a few portions of it here to show that he always erected the pillars of right and created examples of justice in all matters, small or big, delicate or serious.”

Arabic: انْطَلِقْ عَلَى تَقْوَى اللهِ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ.
English: Move on with the fear of Allah Who is One and has no partner.

Arabic: وَلاَ تُرَوعَن مُسْلِماً.
English: Do not frighten any Muslim.

Arabic: وَلاَ تَجْتَازَن عَلَيْهِ كَارِهاً.
English: Do not pass over anyone’s land so as to make him feel unhappy.

Arabic: وَلاَ تَأْخُذَن مِنْهُ أَكثَرَ مِنْ حَق اللهِ فِي مَالِهِ.
English: Do not take from him more than Allah’s share in his property.

Arabic: فَإِذَا قَدِمْتَ عَلَى الْحَي فَانْزِلْ بِمَائِهِمْ مِنْ غَيْرِ أَنْ تُخَالِطَ أَبْيَاتَهُمْ.
English: When you go to a tribe, you should get down at its watering place instead of entering their houses.

Arabic: ثُم امْضِ إِلَيْهِمْ بِالسكِينَةِ وَالْوَقَارِ، حَتى تَقوُمَ بَيْنَهُمْ فَتُسَلمَ عَلَيْهِمْ، وَلاَ تُخْدِجْ بِالتحِيةِ لَهُمْ.
English: Then proceed towards them with peace and dignity till you stand among them. Salute them and do not be negligent in greeting them.

Arabic: ثُم تَقُولَ: عِبَادَ اللهِ، أَرْسَلَنِي إِلَيْكُمْ وَلِي اللهِ وَخَلِيفَتُهُ، لاِخُذَ مِنْكُمْ حَق اللهِ فِي أَمْوَالِكُمْ.
English: After that, say to them, “O servants of Allah! The vicegerent of Allah and His caliph has sent me to you to collect from you Allah’s share of your properties.

Arabic: فَهَلْ لِلهِ فِي أَمْوَالِكُمْ مِنْ حَقّ فَتُؤَدوهُ إِلَى وَلِيهِ؟ فَإِنْ قَالَ قَائِلٌ: لاَ، فَلاَ تُرَاجِعْهُ.
English: Is there anything of His share in your properties? If so, give it to His vicegerent.” If someone among them says, “No,” then do not repeat the demand.

Arabic: وَإِنْ أَنْعَمَ لَكَ مُنْعِمٌ فَانْطَلِقْ مَعَهُ مِنْ غَيْرِ أَنْ تُخِيفَهُ أَوْ تُوعِدَهُ أَوْ تَعْسِفَهُ أَوْ تُرْهِقَهُ.
English: If someone speaks to you in the affirmative, go with him without frightening him, threatening him, pressuring him or oppressing him.

Arabic: فَخُذْ مَا أَعْطَاكَ مِنْ ذَهَب أَوْ فِضة.
English: Take what he gives you, such as gold or silver (coins).

Arabic: فَإنْ كَانَتْ لَهُ مَاشِيَةٌ أَوْ إِبِلٌ فَلاَ تَدْخُلْهَا إِلا بِإِذْنِهِ، فَإِن أَكْثَرَهَا لَهُ.
English: If he has cattle or camels, do not enter upon them save with his permission because their major part is his.

Arabic: فَإِذَا أَتَيْتَهَا فَلاَ تَدْخُلْها دُخُولَ مُتَسَلط عَلَيْهِ وَلاَ عَنِيف بِهِ.
English: When you get there, do not enter upon them like one who has full control over them or in any violent manner whatsoever.

Arabic: وَلاَ تُنَفرَن بَهِيمَةً وَلاَ تُفْزِعَنهَا وَلاَ تَسُوءَن صَاحِبَهَا فِيهَا.
English: Do not scare any animal. Do not tease anyone, and do not let the owner feel grieved over anything.

Arabic: وَاصْدَعِ الْمَالَ صَدْعَيْنِ، ثُم خَيرْهُ.
English: Divide the property into two parts and let the owner choose one.

Arabic: فَإِذَا اخْتَارَ فَلاَ تَعْرِضَن لِمَا اخْتَارَهُ، ثُم اصْدَعِ الْبَاقيَ صَدْعَيْنِ، ثُم خَيرْهُ.
English: Once he has chosen, do not object to it. Then divide the remaining into two parts and let him choose one.

Arabic: فَإِذَا اخْتَارَ فَلاَ تَعْرِضَن لِمَا اخْتَارَ.
English: Once he has chosen, do not raise any objection.

Arabic: فَلاَ تَزَالُ بِذلِكَ حَتى يَبْقَى مَا فِيهِ وَفَاءٌ لِحَق اللهِ فِي مَالِهِ.
English: Continue like this till only that much remains which is enough to satisfy Allah’s dues.

Arabic: فَاقْبِضْ حَق اللهِ مِنْهُ، فَإِنِ اسْتَقَالَكَ فَأَقِلْهُ، ثُم اخْلِطْهُمَا، ثُم اصْنَعْ مِثْلَ الذِي صَنَعْتَ أَولاً حَتى تَأْخُذَ حَق اللهِ فِي مَالِهِ.
English: Then take Allah’s due from it. If he contends your action, allow his views to prevail, then mix the two (separated) parts and repeat what you had done before till you take Allah’s due from his property.

Arabic: وَلاَ تَأْخُذَن عَوْداً، وَلاَ هَرِمَةً، وَلاَ مَكْسُورَةً، وَلاَ مَهْلُوسَةً، وَلاَ ذَاتَ عَوَار.
English: Do not take any old, decrepit, broken-limbed, sick or unsound animal.

Arabic: وَلاَ تَأْمَنَن عَلَيْهَا إِلا مَنْ تَثِقُ بِدِينِهِ، رَافِقاً بِمَالِ الْمُسْلِمِينَ حَتى يُوصِلَهُ إِلَى وَلِيهِمْ فَيَقْسِمَهُ بَيْنَهُمْ.
English: Do not entrust the animals except to one whom you trust to take care of Muslims’ property till he hands it over to their chief who will distribute it.

Arabic: وَلاَ تُوَكلْ بِهَا إِلا نَاصِحاً شَفِيقاً، وَأَمِيناً حَفِيظاً، غَيْرَ مُعَنف وَلاَ مُجْحِف، وَلاَ مُلْغِب وَلاَ مُتْعِب.
English: Do not entrust it to anyone except to whoever is a well wisher, God-fearing, trustworthy and watchful, to one who is not harsh with regard to Muslims’ property. Nor should you make them run too much, nor should you expose them to exhaustion, nor should you over­work them.

Arabic: ثُم احْدُرْ إِلَيْنَا مَا اجْتَمَعَ عِنْدَكَ، نُصَيرْهُ حَيْثُ أَمَرَ اللهُ بِهِ.
English: Then send us all that you have collected. We shall deal with it as Allah has ordered.

Arabic: فَإِذَا أَخذَهَا أَمِينُكَ فَأَوْعِزْ إِلَيْهِ: أَلا يَحُولَ بَيْنَ نَاقَة وَبَيْنَ فَصِيلِهَا، وَلاَ يَمْصُرَ لَبَنَهَا فَيَضُر ذلِكَ بِوَلَدِهَا.
English: When your trustee takes over (the animal), tell him that he should not separate the she-camel from its young and should not milk all its milk because that will affect its young.

Arabic: وَلاَ يَجْهَدَنهَا رُكُوباً.
English: Also, he should not exert it in riding.

Arabic: وَلْيَعْدِلْ بَيْنَ صَوَاحِبَاتِهَا فِي ذلِكَ وَبَيْنَهَا، وَلْيُرَفهْ عَلَى اللاغِبِ، وَلْيَسْتَأْنِ بِالنقِبِوَالظالِعِ.
English: In this matter, he should deal justly with it and with all its companions. He should give rest to the [tired] camels and drive with ease those whose hoofs have been rubbed off.

Arabic: وَلْيُورِدْهَا مَا تَمُر بِهِ مِنَ الْغُدُرِ، وَلاَ يَعْدِلْ بِهَا عَنْ نَبْتِ الارْضِ إِلَى جَوَاد الطرُقِ.
English: When you pass a water spring, keep the camels there to drink and do not take them away from a vegetated land to barren paths.

Arabic: وَلْيُرَوحْهَا فِي الساعَاتِ، وَلْـيُمْهِلْهَا عِنْدَ النطَافِ وَالاعْشَابِ.
English: He should allow them rest now then and give them time near the water and the grass.

Arabic: حَتى تَأْتِيَنَا بِإِذْنِ اللهِ بُدناً مُنْقِيَات، غَيْرَ مُتْعَبَات وَلاَ مَجْهُودَات.
English: In this way, when they reach us by leave of Allah, they will be fat with plenty of marrow and will not be fatigued or distressed.

Arabic: لِنَقْسِمَهَا عَلَى كِتَابِ اللهِ وَسُنةِ نَبِيهِ(عليه السلام).
English: We will then distribute them according to the (commands of) the Books of Allah and the Sunnah of His Prophet.

Arabic: فَإِن ذلِكَ أَعْظَمُ لاجْرِكَ، وَأَقْرَبُ لِرُشْدِكَ، إِنْ شَاءَ اللهُ.
English: Certainly, this will be a great source of reward for you and a means to secure guidance, if Allah so wills.

Arabic: ومن عهد له (عليه السلام)إلى بعض عمّاله، وقد بعثه على الصدقة
English: Given to One of His Officers Whom He Sent for the Collection of Zakat and Charities.

Arabic: آمَرَهُ بِتَقْوَى اللهِ فِي سَرَائِرِ أُمُورِهِ وَخَفِياتِ أَعْمَالِهِ، حَيْثُ لاَ شَهِيدَ غَيْرُهُ، وَلاَ وَكِيلَ دُونَهُ.
English: He (Imam Ali ibn Abu Talib []) ordered him to fear Allah in his secret matters and hidden actions, where there is no witness except the One and only Who watches over all.

Arabic: وَآمَرَهُ أَلا يَعْمَلَ بَشَيْء مِنْ طَاعَةِ اللهِ فِيما ظَهَرَ فَيُخَالِفَ إِلَى غَيْرِهِ فِيَما أَسَر.
English: He also orders him that whatever he does in obedience to Allah openly should not be different from what he does secretly.

Arabic: وَمَنْ لَمْ يَخْتَلِفْ سِرهُ عَلاَنِيَتُهُ، وَفِعْلُهُ وَمَقَالَتُهُ، فَقَدْ أَدّى الامَانَةَ، وَأَخْلَصَ الْعِبَادَةَ.
English: Anyone whose hidden attitude is not different from his open one and whose action is not different from his words has discharged his obligation and his adoration is pure.

Arabic: وَآمَرَهُ أَلا يَجْبَهَهُمْ، وَلاَ يَعْضَهَهُمْ، وَلاَ يَرْغَبَ عَنْهُمْ تَفَضلاًبِالامَارَةِ عَلَيْهِمْ، فَإِنهُمُ الاخْوَانُ فِي الدينِ، وَالاعْوَانُ عَلَى اسْتِخْرَاجِ الْحُقُوقِ.
English: He also ordered him that he should not harass the public. He should not be harsh to them and should not turn away from them because of the superiority of his official status over them because they are all brethren in faith and assist in the recovery of taxes:

Arabic: وَإِن لَكَ في هذِهِ الصدَقَةِ نَصِيباً مَفْرُوضاً، وَحَقّاً مَعْلُوماً، وَشُرَكَاءَ أَهْلَ مَسْكَنَة، وَضَعَفَاءَ ذَوِي فَاقَة.
English: Certainly, you have a fixed share and a known right in this levy, and there are others who are poor, weak and starving.

Arabic: إِنا مُوَفوكَ حَقكَ، فَوَفهِمْ حُقُوقَهُمْ.
English: We shall discharge your rights. So, you should [first] discharge their rights.

Arabic: وَإِلا تَفْعَلْ فَإِنكَ مِنْ أَكْثَرِ الناسِ خُصُوماً يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ.
English: If you do not do so, you will have the largest number of enemies on the Day of Judgement.

Arabic: وَبُؤْساً لِمَنْ خَصْمُهُ عِنْدَ اللهِ الْفُقَرَاءُ وَالْمَسَاكِينُ وَالسائِلُونَ وَالْمَدْفُوعُونَ وَالْغَارِمُ وَابْنُ السبِيلِ!
English: How wretched is the man whose enemies in the view of Allah are theneedy, the destitute, the beggars, the turned away, the indebted and the (penniless) travellers?!

Arabic: وَمَنِ اسْتَهَانَ بِالامَانَةِ، وَرَتَعَ فِي الْخِيَانَةِ، وَلَمْ يُنَزهَ نَفْسَهُ وَدِينَهُ عَنْهَا، فَقَدْ أَحَل بِنَفْسِهِ فِي الدنْيَا الْخِزْيَ، وَهُوَ فِي الاْخِرَةِ أَذَل وَأَخْزَى.
English: Whoever treats the trust lightly, indulges in treachery and does not keep himself and his faith untarnished by it has certainly secured humiliation in this world while his humiliation and disgrace in the next world will be much greater.

Arabic: وَإِن أَعْظَمَ الْخِيَانَةِ خِيَانَةُ الامةِ، وَأَفْظَعَ الْغِش غِش الائِمةِ، وَالسلاَم.
English: Surely, the greatest treachery is the treachery against the Muslim community, and the most ugly deceit is deceiving the Muslim leaders, and that is the end of the matter.

Arabic: ومن عهد له (عليه السلام) إلى محمد بن أبي بكر حين قلّده مصر
English: Given to Muhammad Ibn Abu Bakr (May Allah Be Pleased with Him), When Imam Ali Ibn Abu TalibAppointed Him as Governor of Egypt:

Arabic: فَاخْفِضْ لَهُمْ جَنَاحَكَ، وَأَلِنْ لَهُمْ جَانِبَكَ، وَابْسُطْ لَهُمْ وَجْهَكَ، وَآسِ بَيْنَهُمْ فِي اللحْظَةِ وَالنظْرَةِ، حَتى لاَ يَطْمَعَ الْعُظَمَاءُ فِي حَيْفِكَ لَهُمْ، وَلاَ يَيْأَسَ الضعَفَاءُ مِنْ عَدْلِكَ عَلَيْهِمْ.
English: Deal humbly with the public. Remain lenient. Meet them large- heartedly, accord them equal treatment so that the mighty should not expect injustice from you in their favor and the lowly should not be despondent of your justice.

Arabic: وَإن اللهَ تَعَالَى يُسَائِلُكُمْ مَعْشَرَ عِبَادِهِ عَنِ الصغِيرَةِ مِنْ أَعْمَالِكُمْ وَالْكَبِيرَةِ، وَالظاهِرَةِ وَالْمَسْتُورَةِ.
English: Allah, the Sublime, will certainly question you, O community of His creatures, about your actions, small or big, open or concealed.

Arabic: فَإِنْ يُعَذبْ فَأَنْتُمْ أَظْلَمُ، وَإِنْ يَعْفُ فَهُوَ أَكْرَمُ.
English: If He punishes you, it is because you have been oppressive, and if He forgives you, then it is because He is the most Generous.

Arabic: وَاعْلَمُوا عِبَادَ اللهِ، أَن الْمُتقِينَ ذَهَبُوا بِعَاجِلِ الدنْيَا وَآجِلِ الاْخِرَةِ، فَشَارَكُوا أَهْلَ الدنْيَا فِي دُنْيَاهُمْ، وَلَمْ يُشَارِكُهم أَهْلُ الدنْيَا فِي آخِرَتِهِمْ.
