English: Be informed, O servants of Allah, that the God-fearing share the joys of this transient world as well as those of the next, for they share with the people of this world in their worldly matters while their people did not share with them in the matters of the next.

Arabic: سَكَنُوا الدنْيَا بَأَفْضَلِ مَا سُكِنَتْ.
English: They lived in this world in the best manner of living.

Arabic: وَأَكَلُوهَا بِأَفْضَلِ مَا أُكِلَتْ، فَحَظُوا مِنَ الدنْيَا بِمَا حَظِيَ بِهِ الْمُتْرَفُونَ.
English: They ate the choicest food and enjoyed herein all that the people with ease of life enjoyed.

Arabic: وَأَخَذُوا مِنْهَا مَا أَخَذَهُ الْجَبَابِرَةُ الْمُتَكَبرُونَ.
English: They secured from it what the haughty and the vain secured.

Arabic: ثُم انْقَلَبُوا عَنْهَا بِالزادِ الْمُبَلغِ، وَالْمَتْجَرِ الرابِحِ.
English: Then they departed from it after taking provision enough to take them to the end of their journey, having contracted a profitable transaction.

Arabic: أَصَابُوا لَذةَ زُهْدِ الدنْيَا فِي دُنْيَاهُمْ، وَتَيَقنُوا أَنهُمْ جِيرَانُ اللهِ غَداً فِي آخِرَتِهِمْ، لاَ تُرَد لَهُمْ دَعْوَةٌ، وَلاَ يَنْقُصُ لَهُمْ نَصِيبٌ مِنْ لَذة.
English: They tasted the pleasure of renouncing the life in this world, firmly believing that on the Coming Day, they will be neighbors of Allah, where their call will not be repulsed, nor will their share of pleasure be small.

Arabic: فَاحْذَرُوا عِبَادَ اللهِ الْمَوْتَ وَقُرْبَهُ، وَأَعِدوا لَهُ عُدتَهُ.
English: O servants of Allah! Fear death and its measures, and prepare all that is needed for it.

Arabic: فَإِنهُ يَأْتِي بِأَمْر عَظِيم، وَخَطْب جَلِيل، بِخَيْر لاَ يَكُونُ مَعَهُ شَر أَبَداً، أَوْ شَر لاَ يَكُونُ مَعَهُ خَيْرٌ أَبَداً.
English: It will come as a big event and a great affair, either as something good in which there will never be any evil, or an evil one in which there will never be any good.

Arabic: فَمَنْ أَقْرَبُ إِلَى الْجَنةِ مِنْ عَامِلِهَا! وَمَنْ أَقْرَبُ إِلى النارِ مِنْ عَامِلِهَا! وَأَنْتُمْ طُرَدَاءُ الْمَوْتِ.
English: Who is nearer to Paradise than one who works towards it, and who is nearer to Hell than one who works for it? You are being chased by death.

Arabic: إِنْ أَقَمْتُمْ لَهُ أَخْذَكُمْ، وَإِنْ فَرَرْتُمْ مِنْهُ أَدْرَككُمْ، وَهُوَ أَلْزَمُ لَكُمْ مِنْ ظِلكُمْ.
English: If you stop, it will catch you, and if you run away from it, it will grab you. It is more attached to you than your own shadow.

Arabic: الْمَوْتُ مَعْقُودٌ بِنَوَاصِيكُمْ، وَالدنْيَا تُطْوَى مِنْ خَلْفِكُمْ.
English: Death is tied to your forelocks while the world is being wrapped up from behind you.

Arabic: فَاحْذَرُوا نَاراً قَعْرُهَا بَعِيدٌ، وَحَرهَا شَدِيدٌ، وَعَذَابُهَا جَدِيدٌ.
English: Therefore, fear the Fire whose hollow is deep, whose flames are severe and whose punishment is novel.

Arabic: دَارٌ لَيْسَ فِيها رَحْمَةٌ، وَلاَ تُسْمَعُ فِيهَا دَعْوَةٌ، وَلاَ تُفَرجُ فِيهَا كُرْبَهٌ.
English: It is a place wherein there is no mercy. No call is heard in it. No pain is healed in it.

Arabic: وَإِنِ اسْتَطَعْتُمْ أَنْ يَشْتَد خَوْفُكُمْ مِنَ اللهِ، وَأَنْ يَحْسُنَ ظَنكُمْ بِهِ، فَاجْمَعُوا بيْنَهُمَا، فَإِن الْعَبْدَ إِنمَا يَكُونُ حُسْنُ ظَنهِ بِرَبهِ عَلَى عَلَى قَدْرِ خَوْفِهِ مِنْ رَبهِ.
English: If it is possible for you to have severe fear of Allah and to rest hope in Him, then do both these things because every individual can have hope in His Lord to the extent of his fear of His Lord.

Arabic: وَإِن أَحْسَنَ الناسِ ظَنّاً بِاللهِ أَشَدهُمْ خَوْفاً لله.
English: Certainly, the most hopeful person with Allah is whoever fears Him the most.

Arabic: وَاعْلَمْ ـ يَا مُحَمدُ بْنَ أَبِي بَكْر ـ أَني قَدْ وَليْتُكَ أَعْظَمَ أَجْنَادِي فِي نَفْسِي أَهْلَ مِصْرَ.
English: O Muhammad son of Abu Bakr! Be informed that I have given you charge of Egypt which is my biggest force.

Arabic: فَأَنْتَ مَحْقُوقٌ أَنْ تُخَالِفَ عَلَى نَفْسِكَ، وَأَنْ تُنَافِحَ عَنْ دِينِكَ، وَلَوْ لَمْ يَكُنْ لَكَ إِلا سَاعَةٌ مِنَ الدهْرِ.
English: You are duty-bound to oppose your passions and to serve as a shield against your religion even though you may get only an hour in the world.

Arabic: وَلاَ تُسْخِطِ اللهَ بِرِضَى أَحَد مِنْ خَلْقِهِ، فَإِن فِي اللهِ خَلَفاً مِنْ غَيْرِهِ، وَلَيْسَ مِنَ اللهِ خَلَفٌ فِي غَيْرِهِ.
English: Do not enrage Allah for pleasing others because (Allah) is such that He may take the place of others, yet others cannot take the place of Allah.

Arabic: صَل الصلاَةَ لِوَقْتِهَا الْمُوَقتِ لَهَا.
English: Say prayers at their appointed times.

Arabic: وَلاَ تُعَجلْ وَقْتَهَا لِفَرَاغ، وَلاَ تُؤْخرْهَا عَنْ وَقْتِهَا لاشْتِغَال، وَاعْلَمْ أَن كُل شَيْء مِنْ عَمَلِكَ تَبَعٌ لِصَلاَتِكَ.
English: Do not say your prayers earlier for the sake of (available) leisure, nor should you delay them on account of any preoccupation. Remember that every deed of yours is dependent on your prayers.

Arabic: ومن هذا العهدفَإِنهُ لاَ سَوَاءَ، إِمَامُ الْهُدَى وَإِمَامُ الردَى،وَوَلِي النبِى وَعَدُو النبِي.
English: An excerpt of the same:The leader of guidance and the leader of destruction cannot be equal, nor can the friend of the Prophetand the enemy of the Prophet.

Arabic: وَلَقَدْ قَالَ لِي رَسُولُ اللهِ(صلى الله عليه وآله): “إِني لاَ أَخَافُ عَلَى أُمتِي مُؤْمِناً وَلاَ مُشْرِكاً.
English: The Messenger of Allahhas told me that: “With regard to my people, I am afraid neither of a believer nor of an unbeliever.

Arabic: أَما الْمُؤمِنُ فَيَمْنَعُهُ اللهُ بِإِيمَانِهِ.
English: As for the believer, Allah will afford him protection because of his belief.

Arabic: وَأَما الْمُشْرِكُ فَيَقْمَعُهُ اللهُ بِشِرْكِهِ.
English: As for the unbeliever, Allah will humiliate him because of his lack of belief.

Arabic: لكِني أَخَافُ عَلَيْكُمْ كُل مَنَافِقِ الْجَنَانِ، عَالِمِ اللسَانِ، يَقُولُ مَا تَعْرِفُونَ،وَيَفْعَلُ مَا تُنْكِرُونَ”.
English: But I fear for anyone of you who is hypocrite in his heart and who has mastered the language. He speaks what you hold as good but does whatever you dislike.

Arabic: ومن كتاب له (عليه السلام) إلى معاوية جواباًوهو من محاسن الكتب.
English: In Reply to Muawiyah, One of His Most Elegant Writings:

Arabic: أَما بَعْدُ، فَقَدْ أَتَانِي كِتَابُكَ تَذْكُرُ [فِيهِ] اصْطِفَاءَ اللهِ تعالى مُحَمداً(صلى الله عليه وآله) لِدِينِهِ، وَتَأْيِيدَهُ إِياهُ بِمَنْ أَيدَهُ مِنْ أَصْحَابِهِ.
English: Now, your letter has reached me wherein you recall that Allah chose Muhammadfor His religion and helped him through those companions who assisted him.

Arabic: فَلَقَدْ خَبأَ لَنَا الدهْرُ مِنْكَ عَجَباً، إِذْ طَفِقْتَ تُخْبِرُنَا بِبَلاَءِ اللهِ عِنْدَنَا، وَنِعْمَتِهِ عَلَيْنَا فِي نَبِينَا.
English: Strange things about you have remained concealed (by theirony of fate) from us, since you have started telling us of Allah’s trials for us and His bounties through [the kinship to] our Prophet.

Arabic: فَكُنْتَ فِي ذلكِ كَنَاقِلِ التمْرِ إِلَى هَجَرَ، أَوْ دَاعِي مُسَددِهِ إِلَى النضَالِ.
English: In this regard, you are like one who carries dates to Hajar, or who challenges his own master to a duel in archery.

Arabic: وَزَعَمْتَ أَن أَفْضَلَ الناسِ فِي الاسْلاَمِ فُلاَنٌ وَفُلاَنٌ.
English: You think that so-and-so are the most distinguished persons in Islam.

Arabic: فَذَكَرْتَ أَمْراً إِنْ تَم اعْتَزَلَكَ كُلهُ، وَإِنْ نَقَصَ لَمْ يَلْحَقْكَ ثَلْمُهُ.
English: You have said such a thing with which, were it true, you have nothing to do, but if it is not so, then the defect in it will not affect you.

Arabic: وَمَا أَنْتَ وَالْفَاضِلَ وَالْمَفْضُولَ، وَالسائِسَ وَالْمَسُوسَ!
English: And what are you going to do with the question of who is better and who is worse, or who is the ruler and who is the ruled?

Arabic: وَمَا لِلطلَقَاءِ وَأَبْنَاءِ الطلَقَاءِ، وَالـتمْييزَ بَيْنَ الْمُهَاجِرِينَ الاولِينَ، وَتَرْتِيبَ دَرَجَاتِهِمْ، وَتَعْرِيفَ طَبَقَاتِهِمْ!
English: What do the freed ones and their sons have to do with distinguishing between the first Muhajirun and determining their status or defining their ranks?

Arabic: هَيْهَاتَ لَقَدْ حَن قِدْحٌ لَيْسَ مِنْهَا، وَطَفِقَ يَحْكُمُ فِيهَا مَنْ عَلَيْهِ الْحُكْمُ لَهَا!
English: What a pity! The sound of an arrow is being produced by what is not a real arrow, and he against whom the judgement is to be passed is seated to judge!

Arabic: أَلاَ تَرْبَعُ أَيهَا الانْسَانُ عَلَى ظَلْعِكَ، وَتَعْرِفُ قُصُورَ ذَرْعِكَ، وَتَتَأَخرُ حَيْثُ أَخرَكَ الْقَدَرُ! فَمَا عَلَيْكَ غَلَبَةُ الْمَغْلُوبِ، وَلاَ لَكَ ظَفَرُ الظافِرِ!
English: O mankind! Why do you not see your own lameness and thus remain within the bounds, and why do you not realize the shortness of your measure and stay back where destiny has placed you?! You have no concern with the defeat of the defeated or with the victory of the victor.

Arabic: وَإِنكَ لَذَهّابٌ فِي التيهِ، رَواغٌ عَنِ الْقَصْدِ.
English: You are wandering in bewilderment, straying from the right path.

Arabic: أَلاَ تَرَى ـ غَيْرَ مُخْبِر لَكَ، لكِنْ بِنِعْمَةِ اللهِ أُحَدثُ ـ أَن قَوْماً اسْتُشْهِدُوا في سَبِيلِ اللهِ مِنَ الْمُهاجِرينَ،لِكُل فَضْلٌ.
English: Do you not realize it? I am not giving you any news: I am just recounting Allah’s bounty, namely that a number of people from among the Muhajirun (immigrants from Mecca) and the Ansar (helpers) fell as martyrs in the way of Allah the Sublime and that each of them is distinguished (on that account).

Arabic: حَتى إِذَا اسْتُشْهِدَ شَهِيدُنَا قِيلَ: سَيدُ الشهَدَاءِ، وَخَصهُ رَسُولُ اللهِ(صلى الله عليه وآله) بِسَبْعِينَ تَكْبِيرَةً عِنْدَ صَلاَتِهِ عَلَيْهِ!
English: But when one of us secures martyrdom, he is named the chief of martyrs, and the Messenger of Allah grants him the special honor of saying seventy takbir (Allahu Akbar) during his funeral prayer.

Arabic: أَوَلاَ تَرَى أَن قَوْماً قُطعَتْ أَيْديِهِمْ فِي سَبِيلِ اللهِ ـ وَلِكُلّ فَضْلٌ ـ حَتى إذَا فُعِلَ بِوَاحِدِنَا كمَا فُعِلَ بِوَاحِدِهِمْ، قِيلَ: الطيارُ فِي الْجَنةِ وَذُوالْجَنَاحَيْنِ!
English: Do you not know that a number of people lost their hands in the way of Allah and that everyone is distinguished (on that account)? But when the same thing takes place to one of us [such as Ja’fer al- Tayyar], he is given the title “the flier in Paradise” and “the two-winged one”?

Arabic: وَلَوْ لاَ مَا نَهَى اللهُ عَنْهُ مِنْ تَزْكِيَةِ الْمَرْءِ نَفْسَهُ، لَذَكَرَ ذَاكِرٌ فَضَائِلَ جَمةً، تَعْرِفُهَا قُلُوبُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ، وَلاَ تَمُجهَا آذَانُ السامِعِينَ.
English: Had not Allah forbidden self-praise, the writer would have mentioned numerous distinctions which the believer knows fully well and which the ears of the listeners do not wish to forget.

Arabic: فَدَعْ عَنْكَ مَنْ مَالَتْ بِه الرمِيةُ، فَإِنا صَنَائِعُ رَبنَا، وَالناسُ بَعْدُ صَنَائِعُ لَنَا.
English: Better leave those whose arrows miss themark. We [Ahl al-Bayt ] are the direct recipients of our Lord’s favors while others receive favors from us after that.

Arabic: لَمْ يَمْنَعْنَا قَدِيمُ عِزنَا وَلاَ عَادِي طَوْلِنَا عَلَى قَوْمِكَ أَنْ خَلَطْنَاكُمْ بَأَنفُسِنَا، فَنَكَحْنَا وَأَنْكَحْنا، فِعْلَ الاكْفَاءِ، وَلَسْتُمْ هُنَاكَ!
English: In spite of our established honor and well- known superiority over people, we did not stay away from mingling with you, intermarrying with you like equals although you are not so.

Arabic: وَأَنى يَكُونُ ذلِكَ كَذَلِكَ وَمِنا النبِي وَمِنْكُمُ الْمُكَذبُ، وَمِنا أَسَدُ اللهِ وَمِنْكُمْ أَسَدُ الاحْلاَفِ، وَمِنا سَيدَا شَبَابِ أَهْلِ الْجَنةِ وَمِنْكُمْ صِبْيَةُ النارِ، وَمِنا خَيْرُ نِسَاءِ الْعَالَمِينِ وَمِنْكُمْ حَمالَةُ الْحَطَبِ، فِي كَثِير مِما لَنَا وَعَلَيْكُمْ!
English: And how could you be so when (our status is that) among us is the Prophetwhile among you is his opponent, among us is the lion of Allah while among you is the lion of the opposing groups, among us are the two masters of the youths of Paradise while among you are the children of Hell, among us is the choicest of all the women of the worlds while among you is the bearer of firewood, any many more distinctions on our side while shortcomings [abound] on yours?!

Arabic: فَإِسْلاَمُنَا مَا قَدْ سُمِعَ، وَجَاهِلِيتُنَا لاَ تُدْفَعُ.
English: Our Islam is well-known and our (greatness in the ) pre-Islamic period too cannot be denied.

Arabic: وَكِتَابُ اللهِ يَجْمَعُ لَنَا مَا شَذ عَنا، وَهُوَ قَوْلُهُ سُبْحَانَهُ:
English: Whatever remains has been mentioned in the words of Allah, the most Glorified One, the Sublime:

Arabic: (وَأُولُو الارْحَامِ بَعْضُهُمْ أَوْلَى بِبَعْض فِي كِتَابِ اللهِ).
English: “… blood relatives have the better claim with regard to one another according to the Book of Allah” (Holy Quran, 33: 6).

Arabic: وَقَوْلُهُ تَعَالَى: (إِن أَوْلَى الناسِ بِإِبْرَاهِيمَ لَلذِينَ اتبَعُوهُ وَهذَا النبِي وَالذِينَ آمَنُوا وَاللهُ وَلِي الْمُؤمِنِينَ).
English: He (Allah) the Sublime, also says the following: “Verily, of men the nearest to Abraham are surely those who followed him and this Prophet (Muhammad []) and those who believe, and verily, Allah, is the Guardian of the faithful” (Holy Quran, 3: 68).

Arabic: فَنَحْنُ مَرةً أوْلَى بِالْقَرَابَةِ، وَتَارَةً أَوْلَى بِالطاعَةِ.
English: Thus, we are superior firstly because of kinship and, secondly, because of obedience [of the Almighty].

Arabic: وَلَما احْتَج الْمُهَاجِرُونَ عَلَى الانْصَارِ يَوْمَ السقِيفَةِ بِرَسُولِ الله(صلى الله عليه وآله)فَلَجُوا عَلَيْهِمْ، فَإِنْ يَكُنِ الْفَلَجُ بِهِ فَالْحَق لَنَا دُونَكُمْ، وَإِنْ يَكُنْ بِغَيْرِهِ فَالاْنْصَارُ عَلَى دَعْوَاهُمْ.
English: At the saqifa (of Banu Sa’idah), the Muhajirun contended kinship with the Messenger of Allah against the Ansar, scoring over them. If that success was based on kinship, then the right will be ours better than yours; otherwise, the Ansar’s contention stands.

Arabic: وَزَعَمْتَ أَني لِكُل الْخُلَفَاءِ حَسَدْتُ، وَعَلَى كُلهِمْ بَغَيْتُ.
English: You think that I have been jealous of every caliph and have revolted against them all.

Arabic: فَإِنْ يَكُنْ ذلِكَ كَذلِكَ فَلَيْسَ الْجِنَايَةُ عَلَيْكَ، فَيَكُونَ الْعُذْرُ إِلَيْكَ.
English: Even if this is so, it is not an offence against you and, therefore, I owe you no explanation.

Arabic: وَتِلْكَ شَكَاةٌ ظَاهِرٌ عَنْكَ عَارُهَا
English: This is a matter for which no blame comes to you.

Arabic: وَقُلْتَ: إِني كُنْتُ أُقَادُ كَمَا يُقَادُ الْجَمَلُ الْـمَخْشُوشُ حَتى أُبَايِعَ.
English: You have said that I was dragged like a camel with a nose string to swear the oath of allegiance (to Abu Bakr).

Arabic: وَلَعَمْرُ اللهِ لَقَدْ أَرَدْتَ أَنْ تَذُم فَمَدَحْتَ، وَأَنْ تَفْضَحَ فَافْتَضَحْتَ!
English: By the Eternal One (Allah), you had intended to revile me, but you have instead praised me, and you intended to humiliate me but have your own selves been humiliated.

Arabic: وَمَا عَلَى الْمُسْلِمِ مِنْ غَضَاضَة فِي أَنْ يَكُونَ مَظْلُوماً مَا لَمْ يَكُنْ شَاكّاً فِي دِينِهِ، وَلاَ مُرْتَاباً بِيَقِينِهِ!
English: What humiliation does it mean for a Muslim to be the victim of oppression so long as he does not entertain any doubt in his religion, nor any misgiving in his firm belief?!

Arabic: وَهذِهِ حُجتِي إِلَى غَيْرِكَ قَصْدُهَا، وَلكِني أَطْلَقْتُ لَكَ مِنْهَا بِقَدْرِ مَا سَنَحَمِنْ ذِكْرِهَا.
English: This argument of mine is intended for others, but I have stated it to you only in so far as it is appropriate.

Arabic: ثُم ذَكَرْتَ مَا كَانَ مِنْ أَمْرِي وَأَمْرِ عُثْمانَ.
English: Then you recalled my status vis-a-vis Othman.

Arabic: فَلَكَ أ َنْ تُجَابَ عَنْ هذِهِ لِرَحِمِكَ منْهُ
English: In this regard, an answer is due to you because of your own kinship to him.

Arabic: فَأَينَا كَانَ أَعْدَى لَهُ،أَهْدَى إِلَى مَقَاتِلِهِ! أَمْ مَنْ بَذَلَ لَهُ نُصْرَتَهُ فَاسْتَقْعَدَهُ وَاسْتَكَفهُ، أَمْ مَنِ اسْتَنْصَرَهُ فَتَرَاَخى عَنْهُ بَث الْـمَنُونَ إِلَيْهِ، حَتى أَتَى قَدَرُهُ عَلَيْهِ.
English: So (now tell me), which of us was more inimical to Othman and who did more to bring about his killing?! Who offered him his support and made him sit down, stopping him? Whose help was solicited but turned his face away from the solicitor, drawing his[Othman’s] death near till his fate overtook him?

Arabic: كَلا وَاللهِ لَقَد عَلِمَ اللهُ الْمُعَوقِينَمِنْكُمْ وَالْقَائِلِينَ لاخْوَانِهِمْ هَلُم إِلَيْنَا وَلاَ يَأَتُونَ الْبَأْسَ إِلا قَليلاً.
English: No, no; by Allah. “Indeed, Allah knows those who hinder others from among you and those who say to their brethren: ‘Come here to us’ and they do not go to fight but a little” (Holy Quran, 33: 18).

Arabic: وَمَا كُنْتُ لاعْتَذِرَ مِنْ أَني كُنْتُ أَنْقِمُ عَلَيْهِ أَحْدَاثاً، فَإِنْ كَانَ الذنْبُ إِلَيْهِ إِرْشَادِي وَهِدَايَتِي لَهُ، فَرُب مَلُوم لاَ ذَنْبَ لَهُ.
English: I am not going to offer my excuse for reproaching him [Othman] for (some of) his innovations, for if my good counsel and guidance to him was [considered by you as] a sin, then very often a person who is blamed is no sinner at all.

Arabic: وَقَدْ يَسْتَفِيدُ الظنةَ الْمُتَنَصحُ وَمَا أَرَدْتُ
English: and sometimes the only reward a counselor reaps is suspicion (of being an evildoer).

Arabic: (إِلا الاصْلاَحَ مَا اسْتَطَعْتُ وَمَا تَوْفِيقِي إِلا بِاللهِ عَلَيْهِ تَوَكلْتُ)
English: I desired naught but reform whatever I am able to (reform). “My guidance is only with Allah; On Him (alone) do I rely and to Him (alone) do I turn” (Holy Quran, 11: 88).

Arabic: وَذَكَرْتَ أَنهُ لَيْسَ لِي وَلاَ لاصْحَابِي عِنْدَكَ إِلا السيْفُ.
English: You have mentioned that for me and for my followers you have only the sword.

Arabic: فَلَقَدْ أَضْحَكْتَ بَعْدَ اسْتِعْبَار! مَتَى أُلْفِيَتْ بَنُو عَبْدِ الْمُطلِبِ عَنِ الاعْدَاءِ نَاكِلِينَ، وبِالسيُوفِ مُخَوفِينَ؟!
English: This makes even a weeping person laugh. Did you ever see the descendants of ‘Abdul-Muttalib running away from battle, or being frightened by swords?!

Arabic: فَـ لَبثْ قَلِيلاً يَلْحَقِ الْهَيْجَا حَمَلْ فَسَيَطْلُبُكَ مَنْ تَطْلُبُ، وَيَقْرُبُ مِنْكَ مَا تَسْتَبْعِدُ.
English: “Wait a little till Hamal joins the battle shortly.”And my sword appeased me by killing Hudhayfah. Then whoever you are seeking will seek you, and whoever you think to be far away will approach you.

Arabic: وَأَنَا مُرْقِلٌ نَحْوَكَ فِي جَحْفَل مِنَ الْمُهَاجِرِينَ وَالانْصَارِ، وَالتابِعِينَ [لَهُمْ] بِإِحْسَان.
English: I am (shortly) speeding towards you with a force of Muhajirun and Ansar and those who follow them in virtue.

Arabic: شَدِيد زِحَامُهُمْ، سَاطِع قَتَامُهُمْ، مُتَسَرْبِلِينَ سَرَابِيلَ الْمَوْتِ، أَحَب اللقَاءِ إِلَيْهِمْ لِقَاءُ رَبهِمْ.
English: Their number will be great and their dust will spread all around. They will be wearing their shrouds, and their most coveted desire is to meet Allah.

Arabic: قَدْ صَحِبَتْهُمْ ذُريةٌ بَدْرِيةٌ، وَسُيُوفٌ هَاشِمِيةٌ، قَدْ عَرَفْتَ مَوَاقِعَ نِصَالِهَا فِي أَخِيكَ وَخَالِكَ وَجَدكَ وَأَهْلِكَ.
English: They will be accompanied by the descendants of those who took part in the battle of Badr. They will have Hashemite swords whose splitting you have already seen in the case of your brother, maternal uncle, grandfather and kinsmen.

Arabic: (وَمَا هِيَ مِنَ الظالِمِينَ بِبَعِيد)
English: “… nor are they far distant from the unjust ones” (Holy Quran, 11: 83).

Arabic: ومن كتاب له (عليه السلام)إلى أهل البصرة
English: To the people of Basra

Arabic: وَقَدْ كَانَ مِنِ انْتِشَارِ حَبْلِكُمْ وَشِقَاقِكُمْ مَا لَوْ تَغْبَوْا عَنْهُ، فَعَفَوْتُ عَنْ مُجْرِمِكُمْ، وَرَفَعْتُ السيْفَ عَنْ مُدْبِرِكُمْ، وَقَبِلْتُ مِنْ مُقْبِلِكُمْ.
English: Whatever disunity and schism you have is not hidden from you. I have forgiven your wrongdoers and I have held back my sword from those who ran away. I received everyone who came to me from among you.

Arabic: فَإِنْ خَطَتْ بِكُمُ الامُورُ الْمُرْدِيَةُ، وَسَفَهُ الاْرَاءِ الْجَائِرَةِ، إِلَىُ مُنَابَذَتِي وَخِلاَفِي، فَهَا أَنَاذَا قَدْ قَربْتُ جِيَادِي، وَرَحَلْتُ رِكَابِي.
English: If devastating matters and wrong and silly views are prompting you to break the pledge to me and to oppose me, then listen! I have readied and saddled my horses.

Arabic: وَلَئِنْ أَلْجَأْتُمُونِي إِلَى الْمَسِيرِ إِلَيْكُمْ، لاوقِعَن بِكُمْ وَقْعَةً لاَ يَكُونُ يَوْمُ الْجَمَلِ إِلَيْهَا إِلا كَلَعْقَةِ لاَعِق.
English: and if you force me to advance towards you, I shall come down in such a manner that before it the Battle of Jamal will appear like the last licking of the tongue.

Arabic: مَعَ أَني عَارِفٌ لِذِي الطاعَةِ مِنْكُمْ فَضْلَهُ، وَلِذِي النصِيحَةِ حَقهُ، غَيْرُ مُتَجَاوِز مُتهَماً إِلَى بَرِيّ، وَلاَ ناكِثاً إِلَى وَفيّ.
English: At the same time, I know the high status of the obedient among you and the right of the sincere ones without confusing the sinless with the offenders of the faithful with the pledge-breakers.

Arabic: ومن كتاب له (عليه السلام)إلى معاوية
English: To Muawiyah

Arabic: فَاتقِ اللهَ فِيَما لَدَيْكَ، وَانْظُرْ في حَقهِ عَلَيْكَ، وَارْجِعْ إِلَى مَعْرِفَةِ مَا لاَ تُعْذَرُ بَجَهَالَتِهِ.
English: Fear Allah regarding what you have amassed and find out your true right turn to understand, for you will not be excused on the grounds of ignorance.

Arabic: فَإِن لِلطاعَةِ أَعْلاَماً وَاضِحَةً، وَسُبُلاً نَيرَةً، وَمَحَجةً نَهْجَةً، وَغَايَةً مُطلَبَةً، يَرِدُهَا الاكْيَاسُ، وَيُخَالِفُهَا الانْكَاسُ.
English: Certainly, for (following the path of) obedience there are clear signs, shining ways, straight highways and a fixed aim. The shrewd proceed towards them while the mean ones turn away from them.

Arabic: مَنْ نَكَبَ عَنْهَا جَارَ عَنِ الْحَق، وَخَبَطَ فِي التيهِ، وَغَيرَ اللهُ نِعْمَتَهُ، وَأحَل بِهِ نِقْمَتَهُ.
English: Whoever turns his face from them deviates from righteousness and gropes in bewilderment. Allah takes away His bounty from him and afflicts him with His chastisement.

Arabic: فَنَفْسَكَ نَفْسَكَ! فَقَدْ بَينَ اللهُ لَكَ سَبِيلَكَ، وَحَيْثُ تَنَاهَتْ بِكَ أُمُورُكَ.
English: Therefore, beware of your own selves. Allah has already shown you your way and the end where your affairs will terminate.

Arabic: فَقَدْ أَجْرَيْتَ إِلَى غَايَةِ خُسْر، وَمَحَلةِ كُفْر، وَإِن نَفْسَكَ قَدْ أَوْحَلَتْكَ شَرّاً، وَأَقْحَمَتْكَ غَيّاً، وَأَوْرَدَتْكَ الْمَهَالِكَ، وَأَوْعَرَتْ عَلَيْكَ الْمَسَالِكَ.
English: You are speeding towards the aim of loss and the status of unbelief. Your ego has pushed you towards evil, thrown you into misguidance and conveyed you to destruction, placing obstacles in your way.

Arabic: ومن وصيّته (عليه السلام)للحسن بن علي(عليه السلام)، كتبها إليه بـ “حاضرين” عند انصرافه من صفّين:
English: He Wrote it for His Son al-Hassan ibn Ali (g)1 When He Camped at Al-hadirin on His Way Back from Siffin:

Arabic: مِنَ الْوَالِدِ الْفَانِ، الْمُقِر لِلزمَانِ، الْمُدْبِرِ الْعُمُرِ، الْمُسْتَسْلِمِ لِلدهْرِ، الذامِ لِلدنْيَا، الساكِنِ مَسَاكِنَ الْمَوْتَى، الظاعِنِ عَنْهَا غَداً، إِلَى الْمَوْلُودِ الْمُؤَملِ مَا لاَ يُدْرَكُ.
English: From the father who is (shortly) to die, who acknowledges the hardships of times, who has turned away from life, who has submitted himself to the (calamities of) time, who realizes the evils of the world, who is living in the abodes of the dead and is due to depart from them any day… to the son who yearns for what is not to be achieved.

Arabic: السالِكِ سَبِيلَ مَنْ قَدْ هَلَكَ، غَرَضِ الاسْقَامِ،رَهِينَةِ الايامِ، وَرَمِيةِ الْمَصَائِبِ، وَعَبْدِ الدنْيَا، وَتَاجِرِ الْغُرُورِ، وَغَرِيمِ الْمَنَايَا، وَأَسِيرِ الْمَوْتِ، وَحَلِيفِ الْهُمُومِ،قَرِينِ الاحْزَانِ، وَنُصْبِ الاْفَاتِ، وَصَرِيعِ الشهَوَاتِ، وَخَلِيفَةِ الامْوَاتِ.
English: who is treading the path of those who have died, who is the victim of ailments, who is entangled in the (worries of the ) days, who is a target of hardships, a slave of the world, a trader of its deception, a debtor of wishes, a prisoner of morality, an ally of worries, a neighbor of griefs, a victim of distresses who has been overpowered by desires and a successor of the dead.

Arabic: أَما بَعْدُ، فَإِن فِيَما تَبَينْتُ مِنْ إِدْبَارِ الدنْيَا عَني، وَجُمُوحِ الدهْرِ عَلَي، وَإِقْبَالِ الاْخِرَةِ إِلَي، مَا يَزَعُنِي عَنْ ذِكْرِ مَنْ سِوَايَ، وَالاْهْتمامِ بِمَا وَرَائِي.
English: Now (you should know that) what I have learned from the turning away of this world from me, the onslaught of time over me and the advancing of the next world towards me is enough to prevent me from remembering anyone except my soul and from thinking beyond myself.

Arabic: غَيْرَ أَني حَيْثُ تَفَردَ بِي دُونَ هُمُومِ الناسِ هَم نَفْسِي، فَصَدَفَنِيرَأْيِي، وَصَرَفَنِي عَنْ هَوَايَ، وَصَرحَ لِي مَحْضُ أَمْرِي، فَأَفْضَى بِي إِلَى جِدّ لاَ يَكُونُ فِيهِ لَعِبٌ، وَصِدْق لاَ يَشُوبُهُ كَذِبٌ.
English: But when I confined myself to my own worries, leaving aside the worries of others, my intelligence saved me and protected me from my own desires. It clarified to me my affairs and led me to seriousness wherein there was no trickery and truth which was not tarnished by falsehood.

Arabic: وَوَجَدْتُكَ بَعْضِي، بَلْ وَجَدْتُكَ كُلي، حَتى كَأَن شَيْئاً لَوْ أَصَابَكَ أَصَابَنِي، وَكَأَن الْمَوْتَ لَوْ أَتَاكَ أَتَانِي.
English: Here, I found you a part of myself, rather I found you my whole, so much so that if anything befell you, it was as though it befell me, and if death came to you, it was as though it came to me.

Arabic: فَعَنَانِي مِنْ أَمْرِكَ مَا يَعْنِيني مِنْ أَمْرِ نَفْسِي، فَكَتَبْتُ إِليْكَ كِتَابِي هَذا، مُسْتظْهِراً بِهِ إِنْ أَنا بَقِيتُ لَكَ أَوْ فَنِيتُ.
English: Consequently, your affairs meant to me what my own matters meant to me. So, I have written this piece of advice (to you) as an instrument of seeking help, whether I remain alive or cease to exist.

Arabic: فَإِني أُوصِيكَ بِتَقْوَى اللهِ ـ أَيْ بُني ـ وَلُزُومِ أَمْرِهِ، وَعِمَارَةِ قَلْبِكَ بِذِكْرِهِ، وَالاْعْتِصَامِ بِحَبْلِهِ، وَأَي سَبَب أَوْثقُ مِنْ سَبَب بَيْنكَ وَبَيْنَ اللهِ عَزّوَجَل إِنْ أَنْتَ أَخَذْتَ بِهِ!
English: I admonish you to fear Allah, O my child, to abide by His commands, to fill your heart with His remembrance and to cling to hope from Him. No regard is more reliable than the regard between you and Allah provided you take hold of it.

Arabic: أَحْيِ قَلْبَكَ بِالْمَوْعِظَةِ، وَأَمِتْهُ بِالزهَادَةِ، وَقَوهِ بِالْيَقِينِ، وَنَورْهُ بِالْحِكْمَةِ، وَذَللْهُ بِذِكْرِ الْمَوْتِ، وَقَررْهُ بِالْفَنَاءِ، وَبَصرْهُ فَجَائِعَ الدنْيَا، وَحَذرْهُ صَوْلَةَ الدهْرِ وَفُحْشَ تَقَلبِ الليَالِي وَالايامِ.
English: Enliven your heart with preaching, kill it by renunciation, energize it with firm belief, enlighten it with wisdom, humiliate it by recalling death, make it believe in mortality, make it see the misfortunes of this world, make it fear the authority of the time and the severity of some changes during the nights and the days.

Arabic: وَاعْرِضْ عَلَيْهِ أَخْبَارَ الْمَاضِينَ، وَذَكرْهُ بِمَا أَصَابَ مَنْ كَانَ قَبْلَكَ مِنَ الاولِينَ، وَسِرْ فِي دِيَارِهِمْ وَآثَارِهِمْ، فَانْظُرْ مَا فَعَلُواعَما انْتَقَلُوا، وَأَيْنَ حَلوا وَنَزَلُوا!
English: Place before it the events of past peoples, recall to it what befell those who were before you and walk among their cities and ruins, then see what they did and from what they have gone away, where they have gone and stayed.

Arabic: فَإِنكَ تَجِدُهُمْ انْتَقَلُوا عَنِ الاحِبةِ، وَحَلوا دَارَالْغُرْبَةِ، وَكَأَنكَ عَنْ قَلِيل قَدْ صِرْتَ كَأَحَدِهِمْ.
English: You will find that they departed from (their) friends and remained in loneliness. Shortly, you, too, will be like one of them.

Arabic: فَأَصْلِحْ مَثْوَاكَ، وَلاَ تَبِعْ آخِرَتَكَ بِدُنْيَاكَ.
English: Therefore, plan for your place of stay and do not sell your next life for this one.

Arabic: وَدَعِ الْقَوْلَ فِيَما لاَ تَعْرِفُ، وَالْخِطَابَ فِيَما لَمْ تُكَلفْ.
English: Give up discussing what you do not know and speaking about what does not concern you.

Arabic: وَأَمْسِكْ عَنْ طَرِيق إِذَا خِفْتَ ضَلاَلَتَهُ، فَإِن الْكَف عِنْدَ حَيْرَةِ الضلاَلِ خَيْرٌ مِنْ رُكُوبِ الاهْوَالِ.
English: Keep off the track from which you fear to go astray because refraining (from moving) when there is fear of straying is better than embarking on dangers.

Arabic: وَأْمُرْ بالْمَعْرُوفِ تَكُنْ مِنْ أَهْلِهِ، وَأَنْكِرِ المُنكَرَ بِيَدِكَ وَلِسَانِكَ، وَبَايِنْ مَنْ فَعَلَهُ بِجُهْدِكَ.
English: Ask others to do good; you will thus be among the doers of goodness. Discourage others from evil deeds with your own actions as well as speech and keep off, to the best of your ability, from whoever commits it.

Arabic: وَجَاهِدْ فِي اللهِ حَق جَهَادِهِ، وَلاَ تَأْخُذْكَ فِي اللهِ لَوْمَةُ لاَئم.
English: Struggle for Allah as is His due, and the reviling of a reviler should not deter you in matters relevant to Allah.

Arabic: وَخُضِ الْغَمَرَاتِ إلَى الحَق حَيْثُ كَانَ، وَتَفَقهُ فِي الدينِ.
English: Leap into dangers for the sake of what is right wherever it may be. Acquire insight into religious law.

Arabic: وَعَودْ نَفْسَكَ الصبْرَ عَلَى الْمَكْرُوهِ، وَنِعْمَ الْخُلُقُ التصَبرُ.
English: Habituate yourself to endure hardships since the best trait of character is endurance in matters of righteousness.

Arabic: وَأَلْجِىءْ نَفْسَكَ فِي الاُمُورِ كُلهَا إِلَى إِلهِكَ، فَإِنكَ تُلجِئُهَا إِلَىكَهْف حَرِيز، وَمَانِع عَزِيز.
English: In all your affairs, resign yourself to your Lord because you will thus be resigning yourself to a secure shelter and a strong protector.

Arabic: وَأَخْلِصْ فِي الْمَسْأَلَةِ لِرَبكَ، فَإِن بِيَدِهِ الْعَطَاءَ وَالْحِرْمَانَ.
English: You should ask only from your Lord because in His hand is all the giving and depriving.

Arabic: وَأَكْثِرِ الاسْتِخَارَةَ.
English: Seek goodness (from Allah) as much as you can.

Arabic: وَتَفَهمْ وَصِيتِي، وَلاَ تَذْهَبَن [عَنْكَ ]صَفْحاً، فَإِن خَيْرَ الْقَوْلِ مَا نَفَعَ.
English: Understand my advice and do not turn away from it because the best saying is that which benefits.

Arabic: وَاعْلَمْ أَنهُ لاَ خَيْرَ فِي عِلْم لاَ يَنْفَعُ، وَلاَ يُنْتَفَعُ بِعِلْم لاَ يَحِق تَعَلمُهُ.
English: Be informed that there is no good in that knowledge which is futile, and if knowledge is not implemented, then its acquisition is not justified.

Arabic: أَيْ بُنَي، إِني لَما رَأَيْتُنِي قَدْ بَلَغْتُ سِنّاً، وَرَأَيْتُنِي أَزْدَادُ وَهْناً، بَادَرْتُ بِوَصِيتِي إِلَيْكَ، وَأَوْرَدْتُ خِصَالاً مِنْهَا قَبْلَ أَنْ يَعْجَلَ بِي أَجَلِي دُونَ أَنْ أُفْضِيَ إِلَيْكَ بِمَا فِي نَفْسِي، أَوْ أَنْ أَنْقُصَ فِي رَأْيِي كَمَا نُقِصْتُ فِي جِسْمِي، أَوْ يَسْبِقَنِي إِلَيْكَ بَعْضُ غَلَبَاتِ الْهَوَى وَفِتَنِ الدنْيَا، فَتَكُونَ كَالصعْبِ النفُورِ.
English: O my child! When I noticed that I was of goodly age and noticed that I was increasing in weakness, I hastened with regard to my will to you and wrote down salient points lest death should overtook me before I divulged to you what I have in my heart, or lest my wit should be affected just as my body has been, or the forces of passions or the mischiefs of the world overtake you making you like a stubborn camel.

Arabic: وَإِنمَا قَلْبُ الْحَدَثِ كَالارْضِ الْخَالِيَةِ مَا ألْقِيَ فِيهَا مِنْ شَيء قَبِلَتْهُ، فَبَادَرْتُكَ بِالادَبِ قَبْلَ أَنْ يَقْسُو قَلْبُكَ، وَيَشْتَغِلَ لُبكَ، لِتَسْتَقْبِلَ بِجِد رَأْيِكَ مِنَ الامْرِ مَا قَدْ كَفَاكَ أَهْلُ التجَارِبِ بُغْيَتَهُ وَتَجْرِبَتَهُ.
English: Certainly, the heart of a young man is like an uncultivated land. It accepts whatever is strewn on it. So, I hastened to mold you properly before your heart hardened and your mind became occupied, so that you might be ready to accept through your intelligence the results of the experience of others and be saved from going through these experiences yourself.

Arabic: فَتَكُونَ قَدْ كُفِيتَ مَؤُونَةَ الطلَبِ، وَعُوفِيتَ مِنْ عِلاَجِ التجْرِبَةِ، فَأَتَاكَ مِنْ ذلِكَ مَا قَدْ كُنا نَأْتِيهِ، وَاسْتَبَانَ لَكَ مَا رُبمَا أَظْلَمَ عَلَيْنَا مِنْهُ.
English: In this way, you will avoid the hardship of seeking them and the difficulties of experimenting. Thus, you are getting to know what we had experienced and even those things are becoming clear to you which we might have missed.

Arabic: أَيْ بُنَي، إِني وَإِنْ لَمْ أَكُنْ عُمرْتُ عُمُرَ مَنْ كَانَ قَبْلِي، فَقَدْ نَظَرْتُ فِي أَعْمَالِهِمْ، وَفَكرْتُ فِي أَخْبَارِهِمْ، وَسِرْتُ فِي آثَارِهِمْ، حَتى عُدْتُ كَأَحَدِهِمْ.
English: O my child! Even though I have not reached the age which those before me have, yet I looked into their behavior and thought over events of their lives. I walked among their ruins till I was like one of them.

Arabic: بَلْ كَأَني بِمَا انْتَهَى إِلَي مِنْ أُمُورِهِمْ قَدْ عُمرْتُ مَعَ أَولِهِمْ إِلَى آخِرِهِمْ.
English: In fact, by virtue of their affairs that have become known to me, it is as though I have lived with them from the very first to the very last.

Arabic: فَعَرَفْتُ صَفْوَ ذلِكَ مِنْ كَدَرِهِ، وَنَفْعَهُ مِنْ ضَرَرِهِ.
English: I have, therefore, been able to discern the impure from the clean and benefit from harm.

Arabic: فَاسْتَخْلَصْتُ لَكَ مِنْ كُل أَمْر نَخِيلَتَهُ،تَوَخيْتُ لَكَ جَمِيلَهُ، وَصَرَفْتُ عَنْكَ مَجْهُولَهُ.
English: have selected for you the choicest of those matters and collected for you their good points and have kept away from you their useless points.

Arabic: وَرَأَيْتُ حَيْثُ عَنَانِي مِنْ أَمْرِكَ مَا يَعْنِي الْوَالِدَ الشفِيقَ.
English: Since I feel for your affairs as a living father should, I aim at giving you guidance.

Arabic: وَأَجْمَعْتُ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَدَبِكَ أَنْ يَكُونَ ذلِكَ وَأَنْتَ مُقْبِلُ الْعُمُرِ مُقْتَبَلُ الدهْرِ، ذُونِية سَلِيمَة، وَنَفْس صَافِيَة، وَأَنْ أَبْتَدِئَكَ بِتَعْلِيمِ كِتَابِ اللهِ عَز وَجَل وَتَأْوِيلِهِ، وَشَرَائِعِ الاسْلاَمِ وَأَحْكَامِهِ، وَحَلاَلِهِ وَحَرَامِهِ، لاَ أُجَاوِزُ ذلِكَ بَكَ إِلَى غَيْرِهِ.
English: I thought it should be at a time when you are advancing in age and new to the state of the world, possessing upright intention and a clean heart and that I should, being with the teaching of the Book of Allah, to Whom belong Might and Majesty, and its interpretation, the laws and commandments of Islam, its lawful matters and unlawful ones and that I should not go beyond these for you.

Arabic: ثُم أَشْفَقْتُ أَنْ يَلْتَبِسَ عَلَيْكَ مَا اخْتَلَفَ الناسُ فِيهِ مِنْ أَهْوَائِهِمْ وَآرَائِهِمْ مِثْلَ الذِي الْتَبَسَ عَلَيْهِمْ.
English: Then I feared lest you should get confused as other people had been confused on account of their passions and (different) views.

Arabic: فَكَانَ إِحْكَامُ ذلِكَ عَلَى مَا كَرِهْتُ مِنْ تَنْبِيهِكَ لَهُ أَحَب إِلَي مِنْ إِسْلاَمِكَ إِلَى أَمْر لاَ آمَنُ عَلَيْكَ بِهِ الْهَلَكَةَ، وَرَجَوْتُ أَنْ يُوَفقَكَ اللهُ فِيهِ لِرُشْدِكَ، وَأَنْ يَهْدِيَكَ لِقَصْدِكَ، فَعَهِدْتُ إِلَيْكَ وَصِيتِي هذِهِ.
English: Therefore, in spite of disliking the thought of warning you, I thought it better for me to make this issue strong rather than leave you in a status where I do not regard you safe from falling into destruction. I hoped that Allah will help you in your straightforwardness and guide you in your resoluteness. Consequently, I wrote this piece of my will for you.

Arabic: وَاعْلَمْ يَا بُنَي، أَن أَحَب مَا أَنْتَ آخِذٌ بِهِ إِلَي مِنْ وَصِيتِي تَقْوَى اللهِ، وَالاقْتِصَارُ عَلَى مَا فَرَضَهُ اللهُ عَلَيْكَ، وَالاخْذُ بِمَا مَضَى عَلَيْهِ الاولُونَ مِنْ آبَائِكَ، وَالصالِحُونَ مِنْ أَهْلِ بَيْتِكَ.
English: Be informed, O my child, that what I love the most for you is that you adopt my will to fear Allah, to confine yourself to what Allah has made obligatory on you, to follow the actions of your forefathers and the virtuous people of your household.

Arabic: فَإِنهُمْ لَمْ يَدَعُوا أَنْ نَظَرُوا لانْفُسِهِمْ كَمَا أَنْتَ نَاظِرٌ، وَفَكرُوا كَمَا أَنْتَ مُفَكرٌ.
English: These did not fall short in seeing for themselves what you will see for yourself, and they did about their affairs as you will like to think (about your own affairs).

Arabic: ثُم رَدهُمْ آخِرُ ذلِكَ إِلَى الاخْذِ بِمَا عَرَفُوا، وَالامْسَاكِ عَما لَمْ يُكَلفُوا.
English: Thereafter, their thinking led them to discharge the obligations which they came to know and to desist from what they were not required to do.

Arabic: فَإِنْ أَبَتْ نَفْسُكَ أَنْ تَقْبَلَ ذلِكَ دُونَ أَنْ تَعْلَمَ كَمَا عَلِمُوا فَلْيَكُنْ طَلَبُكَ ذلِكَ بَتَفَهم وَتَعَلم، لاَ بِتَوَرطِ الشبُهَاتِ، وَعُلَقِ الْخُصُومَاتِ.
English: If your heart does not accept this without acquiring knowledge as they acquired it, then your search should first be by way of understanding and learning, not by falling into doubts or getting entangled in quarrels.

Arabic: وَابْدَأْ قَبْلَ نَظَرِكَ فِي ذلِكَ بِالاسْتِعَانَةِ بِإِلهِكَ، وَالرغْبَةِ إِلَيْهِ فِي تَوْفِيقِكَ، وَتَرْكِ كُل شَائِبَة أَوْلَجَتْكَ فِي شُبْهَة، أَوْ أَسْلَمَتْكَ إِلَى ضَلاَلَة.
English: Before you probe into this, you should begin by seeking your Lord’s help, turning to Him for competence and keeping aloof from everything that throws you into doubt or flings you towards misguidance.

Arabic: فَإذا أَيْقَنْتَ أَنْ قَدْ صَفَا قَلْبُكَ فَخَشَعَ، وَتَم رَأْيُكَ وَاجْتَمَعَ، وَكَانَ هَمكَ فِي ذلِكَ هَمّاً وَاحِداً، فَانْظُرْ فِيَما فَسرْتُ لَكَ.
English: When you have made sure that your heart is clean and humble and your thoughts have come together, and once you have only a reflection about this matter…, it is then that you will see what I have explained to you.

Arabic: وَإِنْ أنْتَ لَمْ يَجْتَمِعْ لَكَ مَا تُحِب مِنْ نَفْسِكَ، وَفَرَاغِ نَظَرِكَ وَفِكْرِكَ، فَاعْلَمْ أَنكَ إِنمَا تَخْبِطُ الْعَشْوَاءَ، وَتَتَوَرطُ الظلْمَاءَ، وَلَيْسَ طَالِبُ الدينِ مَنْ خَبَطَ وَلاَ مَنْ خَلطَ، وَالامْسَاكُ عَنْ ذلِكَ أَمْثَلُ.
English: If you have not been able to achieve that peace of observation and thinking which you will like to have, then be informed that you are only stamping the ground like a blind she-camel and falling into darkness while a seeker of religion should not grope in the dark, nor should he create confusion. It is better to avoid this.

Arabic: فَتَفَهمْ يَا بُنَي وَصِيتِي، وَاعْلَمْ أَن مَالِكَ الْمَوْتِ هُوَمَالِكُ الحَيَاةِ، وَأَن الْخَالِقَ هُوَ الْمُمِيتُ، وَأَن الْمُفْنِيَ هُوَ الْمُعِيدُ، وَأَن الْمُبْتَلِيَ هُوَ الْمُعَافِي.
English: Appreciate my advice, O my child, and be admonished that Whoever is the master of death is also the master of life, that the Creator causes death as well as gives life, that Whoever destroys is also the restorer of life, and that Whoever inflicts disease is also the one Who cures.

Arabic: وَأَن الدنْيَا لَمْ تَكُنْ لِتَسْتَقِر إِلا عَلَى مَا جَعَلَهَا اللهُ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ النعْمَاءِ، وَالابْتِلاَءِ، وَالْجَزَاءِ فِي الْمَعَادِ، أَوْ مَاشَاءَ مِما لاَ تعْلَمُ.
English: This world continues in the way which Allah has made it with regard to its pleasures, trials, rewards on the Day of Judgement and all that He wishes and you do not know.

Arabic: َإِنْ أَشْكَلَ عَلَيْكَ شَيْءٌ مِنْ ذلِكَ فَاحْمِلْهُ عَلَى جَهَالَتِكَ بِهِ، فَإِنكَ أَولُ مَا خُلِقْتَ جَاهِلاً ثُم عَلِمْتَ، وَمَا أَكْثَرَ مَا تَجْهَلُ مِنَ الامْرِ، وَيَتَحَيرُ فِيهِ رَأْيُكَ، وَيَضِل فِيهِ بَصَرُكَ ثُم تُبْصِرُهُ بَعْدَ ذلِكَ !
English: If anything of this advice is not understood by you then attribute it to your ignorance of it because when you were first born, you were born ignorant. Thereafter, you acquired knowledge. There are many masters of whom you are ignorant. There are many issues regarding which your sight first wonders and your eye wonders then, after this, you shall see them as they are.

Arabic: ففَاعْتَصِمْ بِالذِي خَلَقَكَ وَرَزَقَكَ وَسَواكَ، وَلْيَكُنْ لَهُ تَعَبدُكَ، وَإِلَيْهِ رَغْبَتُكَ، وَمِنْهُ شَفَقَتُكَ.
English: Therefore, cling to the One Who created you, Who fed you and put you in order. Your worship should be for Him, your eagerness should be towards Him and your fear should be of Him.

Arabic: وَاعْلَمْ يَا بُنَي أَن أَحَداً لَمْ يُنْبِىءْ عَنِ اللهِ سُبْحَانَهُ كَمَا أَنْبَأَ عَنْهُ نَبِينَا(صلى الله عليه وآله)فَارْضَ بِهِ رَائِداً، وَإِلَى النجَاةِ قَائِدَاً.
English: Be informed, O my child, that no one received messages from Allah, the Glorified One, as the Prophetdid. Therefore, regard him as your guide and leader towards salvation.

Arabic: فَإِني لَمْ آلُكَ نَصِيحَةً، وَإِنكَ لَنْ تَبْلُغَ فِي النظَرِ لِنَفْسِكَ ـ وَإِنِ اجْتَهَدْتَ ـ مَبْلَغَ نَظَرِي لَكَ.
English: Certainly, I shall spare no effort in giving you advice, and surely even if you try, you cannot acquire such insight for your welfare as I have for you.

Arabic: وَاعْلَمْ يَا بُنَي، أَنهُ لَوْ كَانَ لِرَبكَ شَرِيكٌ لاتَتْكَ رُسُلُهُ، وَلَرَأَيْتَ آثَارَ مُلْكِهِ وَسُلْطَانِهِ، وَلَعَرَفْتَ أَفْعَالَهُ وصِفَاتِهِ.
English: Be informed, O my child, that if there had been a partner with your Lord, his [alleged partner’s] messengers, too, should have come to you and you would have seen signs of his authority and power; you should have known his deeds and qualities.

Arabic: وَلكِنهُ إِلهٌ وَاحدٌ كَمَا وَصَفَ نَفْسَهُ، لاَ يُضَادهُ فِي مُلْكِهِ أَحَدٌ، وَلاَ يَزُولُ أَبَداً وَلَمْ يَزَلْ.
English: But He is only One god, Allah, and He has described Himself. No one can dispute with Him regarding His authority. He is from eternity and will remain for eternity.

Arabic: أَولٌ قَبْلَ الاشْيَاءِ بِلاَ أَولِية، وَآخِرٌ بَعْدَ الاشْيَاءِ بِلاَ نِهَايَة، عَظُمَ عَنْ أَنْ تَثْبُتَ رُبُوبِيتُهُ بَإحَاطَةِ قَلْب أَوْ بَصَر.
English: He is before all things without any beginning. He will remain after all things without an end. He is far too great to have His divinity proved by any encompassing heart or by any vision.

Arabic: فَإِذَا عَرَفْتَ ذلِكَ فَافْعَلْ كَمَا يَنْبَغِي لِمِثْلِكَ أَنْ يَفْعَلَهُ فِي صِغَرِ خَطَرِهِ، وَقِلةِ مَقْدِرَتِهِ، وَكَثْرَةِ عَجْزِهِ،عَظِيمِ حَاجَتِهِ إِلَى رَبهِ، فِي طَلَبِ طَاعَتِهِ.
English: Once you have understood this, you should do what is done by him who is like you by way of his low status, his lack of authority, his increasing incapability and his great need for his Lord so as to seek His obedience.

Arabic: وَالرهْبَةِ مِنْ عُقُوبَتِهِ، وَالشفَقَةِ مِنْ سُخْطِهِ، فَإِنهُ لَمْ يَأْمُرْكَ إِلا بِحَسَن، وَلَمْ يَنْهَكَ إِلا عَنْ قَبِيح.
English: Fear His chastisement and be forewarned of His wrath because He does not command you save to be virtuous; He does not refrain you save from evil.

Arabic: يَا بُنَي، إِني قَدْ أَنْبَأْتُكَ عَنِ الدنْيَا وَحَالِهَا، وَزَوَالِهَا وَانْتِقَالِهَا، وَأَنْبَأْتُكَ عَنِ الاْخِرَةِ وَمَااُعِد لاهْلِهَا فِيهَا،وَضَرَبْتُ لَكَ فِيهِمَا الامْثَالَ، لِتَعْتَبِرَ بِهَا، وَتَحْذُوَعَلَيْهَا.
English: O my child! I have informed you about the world, its condition, its decay and its passing away, and I have informed you of the next world and of what has been provided in it for its people. I have recounted to you parables about it so that you may draw instruction from them and depend upon them.

Arabic: إِنمَا مَثَلُ مَنْ خَبَرَ الدنْيَا كَمَثَلِ قَوْم سَفْر، نَبَا بِهِمْ مَنْزِلٌ جَدِيبٌ، فأَموا مَنْزِلاً خَصِيباً وَجَنَاباً مَرِيعاً.
English: The example of those who have understood the world is like those travelers who, being fed-up with drought-stricken places, set off for greenery and a fruitful place.

Arabic: فَاحْتَمَلُوا وَعْثَاءَ الطرِيقِ، وَفِرَاقَ الصدِيقِ، وَخُشُونَةَ السفَرِ، وَجُشُوبَةَ الْمَطْعَمِ، لِيَأتُوا سَعَةَ دَارِهِمْ، وَمَنْزِلَ قَرَارِهِمْ.
English: Then they endure difficulties on the way, separation from friends, hardships of the journey and unwholesome food in order to reach their fields of plenty and places of stay.

Arabic: فَلَيْسَ يَجِدُونَ لِشَيْء مِنْ ذلِكَ أَلَماً، وَلاَ يَرَوْنَ نَفَقَةً مَغْرَماً، وَلاَ شَيْءَ أَحَب إِلَيْهِمْ مِما قَربَهُمْ مِنْ مَنْزِلِهِمْ، وَأَدْنَاهُمْ مِنْ مَحَلهِمْ.
English: Consequently, they do not feel any pain in all this and do not regard any expenditure to be a waste. Nothing is more lovable to them than what takes them near their goal and carries them closer to their place of stay.

Arabic: وَمَثَلُ مَنِ اغْتَر بِهَا كَمَثَلِ قَوْم كَانُوا بِمَنْزِل خَصِيب، فَنَبا بِهِمْ إِلَى مَنْزِل جَدِيب، فَلَيْسَ شَيْءٌ أَكْرَهَ إِلَيْهِمْ وَلاَ أَفْظَعَ عِنْدَهُمْ مِنْ مُفَارَقَةِ مَا كَانُوا فيِهِ، إِلَى مَا يَهْجُمُونَ عَلَيْهِ، وَيَصِيرُونَ إِلَيْهِ.
English: (Contrariwise), the example of those who are deceived by this world is like the people who were in a green place but became disgruntled with it and went to a drought-stricken place. Therefore, for them nothing is more detestable or abominable than to leave the place where they were and go to a place which they will reach unexpectedly and for which they were heading.

Arabic: يَا بُنَي، اجْعَلْ نَفْسَكَ مِيزَاناً فِيَما بَيْنَكَ وَبَيْنَ غَيْرِكَ، فَأَحْبِبْ لِغَيْرِكَ مَا تُحِب لِنَفْسِكَ، وَاكْرَهْ لَهُ مَا تَكْرَهُ لَهَا.
English: O my child! Make yourself the measure (for dealings) between you and others. Thus, you should wish for others what you wish for yourself and hate for others what you hate for yourself.

Arabic: وَلاَ تَظْلِمْ كَمَا لاَ تُحِب أَنْ تُظْلَمَ، وَأَحْسِنْ كَمَا تُحِب أَنْ يُحْسَنَ إِلَيْكَ.
English: Do not oppress as you do not like to be oppressed. Do good to others as you like good to be done to you.

Arabic: وَاسْتَقْبِحْ مِنْ نَفْسِكَ مَا تَسْتَقْبِحُ مِنْ غَيْرِكَ، وَارْضَ مِنَ الناسِ بِمَا تَرْضَاهُ لَهُمْ مِنْ نَفْسِكَ، وَلاَ تَقُلْ مَا لاَ تَعْلَمُ وَإِنْ قَل مَا تعْلَمُ، وَلاَ تَقُلْ مَا لاَ تُحِب أَنْ يُقَالَ لَكَ.
English: Regard as bad for yourself whatever you regard as bad for others. Accept that from others which you like others to accept from you. Do not talk about what you do not know even though what you know may be very little. Do not say to others what you do not like to be said to you.

Arabic: وَاعْلَمْ، أَن الاعْجَابَ ضِد الصوَابِ، وَآفَةُ الالْبَابِ. فَاسْعَ فِي كَدْحِكَ، وَلاَ تَكُنْ خَازِناً لِغَيْرِكَ، وَإِذَا أَنْتَ هُدِيتَ لِقَصْدِكَ فَكُنْ أَخْشَعَ مَا تَكُونُ لِرَبكَ.
English: Be informed that self-admiration is contrary to propriety (of action) and is a calamity for the mind. Therefore, increase your striving and do not become a treasurer for (wealth to be inherited by) others. When you have been guided on the right path, humble yourself before Allah as much as you can.

Arabic: وَاعْلَمْ، أَن أَمَامَكَ طَرِيقاً ذَا مَسَافَة بَعِيدَة، وَمَشَقة شَدِيدَة، وَأَنهُ لاَ غِنَى بِكَ فِيهِ عَنْ حُسْنِ الارْتِيَادِ، وَقَدْرِ بَلاَغِكَ مِنَ الزادِ، مَعَ خِفةِ الظهْرِ.
English: Be informed that in front of you lies a road of long distance and severe hardship and that you cannot avoid treading it. Take your requirements of provision keeping the burden light.

Arabic: فَلاَ تَحْمِلَن عَلَى ظَهْرِكَ فَوْقَ طَاقَتِكَ، فَيَكُونَ ثِقْلُ ذلِكَ وَبَالاً عَلَيْكَ، وَإِذَا وَجَدْتَ مِنْ أَهْلِ الْفَاقَةِ مَنْ يَحْمِلُ لَكَ زَادَكَ إِلَى يَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ، فَيُوَافِيكَ بِهِ غَداً حَيْثُ تَحْتَاجُ إِلَيْهِ.
English: Do not load your back beyond your ability lest its weight should cause you mischief. Whenever you come across a needy person who can carry for you your provision to hand it back to you on the Day of Judgement when you will need it.

Arabic: فَاغْتَنِمْهُ وَحَملْهُ إِياهُ، وَأَكْثِرْ مِنْ تَزْوِيدِهِ وَأَنْتَ قَادِرٌ عَلَيْهِ، فَلَعَلكَ تَطْلُبُهُ فَلاَ تَجِدُهُ، وَاغْتَنِمْ مَنِ اسْتَقْرَضَكَ في حَالِ غِنَاكَ، لِيَجْعَلَ قَضَاءَهُ لَكَ في يَوْمِ عُسْرَتِكَ.
English: accept it as a good opportunity and get him to carry it. Put in that provision as much as you are able to, for it is likely that if you need him (afterwards), you may not get hold of him. If a person is willing to borrow from you in the days of your affluence to pay it back to you at the time of your need, then make use of this opportunity.

Arabic: وَاعْلَمْ، أَن أمَامَكَ عَقَبَةً كَؤوداً، الْـمُخِف فِيهَا أَحْسَنُ حَالاً مِن الْمُثْقِلِ، وَالْمُبْطِىءُ عَلَيْهَا أَقْبَحُ حَالاً مِنَ الْمُسْرِعِ.
English: Be informed that in front of you lies an impassable valley wherein the light-burdened man will be in a better condition than the heavy-burdened one and the slow-paced will be in a worse condition than the swift-paced.

Arabic: وَأَن مَهْبِطَهَابِكَ لاَمَحَالَةَ عَلَى جَنة أَوْ عَلَى نَار، فَارْتَدْ لِنَفْسِكَ قَبْلَ نُزُولِكَ، وَوَطىءِ الْمنْزِلَ قَبْلَ حُلُولِكَ، فَلَيْسَ بَعْدَ الْمَوْتِ مُسْتَعْتَبٌ، وَلاَ إِلَى الدنْيَا مُنْصَرَفٌ.
English: Your terminating point at the other end of this passage will necessarily be either Paradise or Hell. Therefore, reconnoiter for yourself before alighting and prepare the place before getting down because after death there can be no preparation nor any return to this world.

Arabic: وَاعْلَمْ، أَن الذِي بِيَدِهِ خَزَائِنُ السموَاتِ وَالارْضِ قَدْ أَذِنَ لَكَ فِي الدعَاءِ، وَتَكفلَ لَكَ بِالاجَابَةِ.
English: Be informed that Whoever owns the treasuries of the heavens and earth has permitted you to pray to Him and has promised you acceptance of the prayer.

Arabic: أَمَرَكَ أَنْ تَسْأَلَهُ لِيُعْطِيَكَ، وَتَسْتَرْحِمَهُ لِيَرْحَمَكَ.
English: He has commanded you to beg from Him in order that He may give you and to seek His mercy in order that He may have mercy on you.

Arabic: وَلَمْ يَجْعَلْ بَيْنَكَ وَبَيْنَهُ مَنْ يَحْجُبُكَ عَنْهُ، وَلَمْ يُلْجِئْكَ إِلَى مَنْ يَشْفَعُ لَكَ إِلَيْهِ، وَلَمْ يَمْنَعْكَ إِنْ أَسَأْتَ مِنَ التوْبَةِ.
English: He has not placed anything between you and Him that may veil Him from you.He has not required you to get a mediator between yourself and Him, and if you err, He has not prevented you from repenting.

Arabic: وَلَمْ يُعَاجِلْكَ بَالنقْمَةِ، [وَلَمْ يُعَيرْكَ بِالانَابَةِ]، وَلَمْ يَفْضَحْكَ حَيْثُ الْفَضِيحَةُ [بِكَ أَوْلَى].
English: He does not hasten His punishment. He does not reprimand you for repenting, nor does He humiliate you when humiliation is more appropriate for you.

Arabic: وَلَمْ يُشددْ عَلَيْكَ فِي قَبُولِ الانَابَةِ، وَلَمْ يُنَاقِشْكَ بِالْجَرِيمَةِ، وَلَمْ يُؤْيِسْكَ مِنَ الرحْمَةِ، بَلْ جَعَلَ نُزُوعَكَ عَنِ الذنْبِ حَسَنةً، وَحَسَبَ سَيئَتَكَ وَاحِدَةً، وَحَسَبَ حَسَنَتَكَ عَشْراً.
English: He is not harsh in accepting repentance. He does not severely question you about your sins. He does not disappoint you regarding His mercy. Rather, He regards abstention from sin as a virtue. He counts your sin as one while counting your good deed as ten.

Arabic: وَفَتحَ لَكَ بَابَ الْمَتَابِ، فَإِذَا نَادَيْتَهُ سَمِعَ نِدَاك، وَإِذَا نَاجَيْتَهُ عَلِمَ نَجْوَاكَ.
English: He has opened for you the door of repentance. Therefore, whenever you call upon Him, He hears your call, and whenever you whisper to Him, He knows the whispers.

Arabic: فَأَفْضَيْتَ إِلَيْهِ بِحَاجَتِكَ، وَأَبْثَثْتَهُ ذاتَ نَفْسِكَ، وَشَكَوْتَ إِلَيْهِ هُمُومَك، وَاسْتَكْشَفْتَهُ كُرُوبَكَ، وَاسْتَعَنْتَهُ عَلَى أُمُورِكَ، وَسَأَلْتَهُ مِنْ خَزَائِنِ رَحْمَتِهِ مَا لاَ يَقْدِرُ عَلَى إِعْطَائِهِ غيْرُهُ، مِنْ زِيَادَةِ الاعْمَارِ، وَصِحةِ الابْدَانِ، وَسَعَةِ الارْزَاقِ.
English: Place before Him your needs, unveil yourself before Him, complain to Him of your worries, beseech Him to remove your troubles, seek His help in your affairs and ask Him to grant you from the treasuries of His mercy that which no one else has power to give, namely length of life, health of body and an increase in your sustenance.

Arabic: ثُم جَعَلَ فِي يَدَيْكَ مَفاتِيحَ خَزَائِنِهِ بِمَا أَذِنَ لَكَ فِيهِ مِنْ مَسْأَلتِهِ.
English: Then He has placed the keys of His treasures in your hands in the sense that He has shown you the way to ask Him.

Arabic: فَمَتَى شِئْتَ اسْتَفْتَحْتَ بِالدعَاءِ أَبْوَابَ نِعَمِهِ، وَاسْتَمْطَرْتَ شآبِيبَ رَحْمَتِهِ.
English: Wherever you wish, He opens the doors of His favor by virtue of your prayers. Let the abundant rains of His mercy fall on you.

Arabic: فَلاَ يُقَنطَنكَ إِبْطَاءُ إِجَابَتِهِ، فَإِن الْعَطِيةَ عَلَى قَدْرِ النيةِ.
English: Delay in acceptance of your pleas should not disappoint you because the granting of a plea is dependent on the extent of (your) intention.

Arabic: وَرُبمَا أُخرَتْ عَنْكَ الاجَابَةُ، لِيَكُونَ ذلِكَ أَعْظمَ لاجْرِ السائِلِ، وَأَجْزَلَ لِعَطَاءِ الاْمِلِ.
English: Sometimes, acceptance (of a plea) is delayed with a view to its being a source of greater reward to the pleading one and a better gift to the anticipating person.

Arabic: وَرُبمَا سَأَلْتَ الشيْءَ فَلاَ تُؤْتاهُ، وَأُوتِيتَ خَيْراً مِنْهُ عَاجلاً أَوْ آجِلاً، أ َوْ صُرِفَ عَنْكَ لِمَا هُوَ خَيْرٌ لَكَ، فَلَرُب أَمْر قَدْ طَلَبْتَهُ فِيهِ هَلاَكُ دِينِكَ لَوْ أُوتِيتَهُ.
English: Sometimes, you may ask for a thing but it is not given to you and a better thing is given to you later, or a thing is taken away from you for some greater good because sometimes you may ask for a thing which contains ruin for your religion if it is granted to you.

Arabic: فَلْتَكُنْ مَسَأَلَتُكَ فِيَما يَبْقَى لَكَ جَمَالُهُ، وَيُنْفَى عَنْكَ وَبَالُهُ، فَالْمَالُ لاَ يَبْقَى لَكَ وَلاَ تَبْقَى لَهُ.
English: Therefore, your request should be for things the beauty of which should be lasting and the burden of which should remain away from you. As for wealth, it will not last for you, nor will you live for its sake.

Arabic: وَاعْلَمْ أَنكَ إِنمَا خُلِقْتَ لِلاْخِرَةِ لاَ لِلدنْيَا، وَلِلْفَنَاءِ لاَ لِلْبَقَاءِ، وَلِلْمَوْت لاَ لِلْحَيَاةِ.
English: O my child! Be informed that you have been created for the next world, not for this one, for extinction (in this world), not for lasting, and for dying, not for living.

Arabic: وَأَنكَ فِي مَنْزِلِ قُلْعَة، وَدَارِ بُلْغَة، وَطرِيق إِلَى الاْخِرَةِ.
English: You are in a place which does not belong to you, an abode for making preparations and a passage towards the next world.

Arabic: وَأَنكَ طَريدُ الْمَوْتِ الذِي لاَ يَنْجُو مِنْهُ هَارِبُهُ، وَلاَ بُد أَنهُ مُدْرِكُهُ.
English: You are being chased by death from which the runner-away cannot escape, as it will surely overtake him.

Arabic: فَكُنْ مِنْهُ عَلَى حَذرِ أَنْ يُدْرِكَكَ وَأَنْتَ عَلَى حَال سَيئَة، قَدْ كُنْتَ تُحَدثُ نفْسَكَ مِنْهَا بِالتوْبَةِ، فَيَحُولَ بَيْنَكَ وَبَيْنَ ذلِكَ، فَإِذَا أَنْتَ قَدْ أَهْلَكتَ نَفْسَكَ.
English: So, be on guard against it least it should overtake you at a time when you are in a sinful state and you are thinking of repenting, but it creates obstruction between you and between repenting. In such a case, you will ruin yourself.

Arabic: يَا بُنَي، أَكْثِرْ مِنْ ذِكْرِ الْمَوْتِ، وَذِكْرِ مَا تَهْجُمُ عَلَيْهِ، وَتُفْضِي بَعْدَ الْمَوْتِ إِلَيْهِ، حَتى يَأْتِيَكَ وَقَدْ أَخَذْتَ مِنْهُ حِذْرَكَ، وَشَدَدْتَ لَهُ أَزْرَكَ، وَلاَ يَأْتِيَكَ بَغْتَةً فَيَبْهَرَكَ.
English: O my child! Remember death quite often and the place where you have to go suddenly and reach after death, so that when it comes, you will be already on your guard against it, having prepared yourself for it, and it does not come to you all of a sudden and surprise you.

Arabic: وَإِياكَ أَنْ تَغْتَر بِمَا تَرَى مِنْ إِخْلاَدِ أَهْلِ الدنْيَا إِلَيْهَا، وَتَكَالُبِهِمْ عَلَيْهَا، فَقَدْ نَبأَكَ اللهُ عَنْهَا، وَنَعَتْ لَكَ نَفْسَهَا، وَتَكَشفَتْ لَكَ عَنْ مَسَاوِيهَا.
English: Beware lest you should become deceived by the leanings of the people towards worldly attractions and their rushing upon it. Allah has warned you about it and the world has informed you of its mortal character, unveiling to you its evils.

Arabic: فَإِنمَا أَهْلُهَا كِلاَبٌ عَاوِيَةٌ، وَسِبَاعٌ ضَارِيَةٌ، يَهِر بَعْضُهَا بَعْضاً.
English: Surely, those (who go) after it are like barking dogs or devouring carnivore who hate each other.

Arabic: يَأْكُلُ عَزِيزُهَا ذَلِيلَهَا، وَيَقْهَرُ كَبِيرُهَا صَغِيرَهَا.
English: Those who are stronger among them eat away the weaker ones, and the big among them tramples over the small.

Arabic: نَعَمٌ مُعَقلَةٌ، وَأُخْرَى مُهْمَلَةٌ، قَدْ أَضَلتْ عُقُولَهَا،رَكِبَتْ مَجْهُولَهَا، سُرُوحُ عَاهَة بِوَاد وَعْث، لَيْسَ لَهَا رَاع يُقيِمُهَا، وَلاَ مُسِيمٌ يُسِيمُهَا.
English: Some are like tied cattle, and some are like untied cattle that have lost their wits and are running in unknown directions. They are flocks of calamities wandering in rugged valleys. There is no herdsman to detain them nor anyone to tend to them and take them to graze.

Arabic: سَلَكَتْ بِهمُ الدنْيَا طَرِيقَ الْعَمَى، وَأخَذَتْ بِأَبْصَارِهِمْ عَنْ مَنَارِ الْهُدَى، فَتاهُوا فِي حَيْرَتِهَا، وَغَرِقُوا فِي نِعْمَتِهَا، وَاتخَذُواهَا رَبّاً، فَلَعِبَتْ بِهِمْ وَلَعِبُوا بِهَا، وَنَسُوا مَا وَرَاءَهَا.
English: The world has put them on the track of blindness and taken away their vision from the beacons of guidance. They have, therefore, been perplexed in its bewilderment and sunk in its pleasures. They took it as a god, so it played havoc with them. They, too, played with it and forgot what is beyond it.

Arabic: رُوَيْداً يُسْفِرُ الظلاَمُ، كَأَنْ قَدْ وَرَدَتِ الاظْعَانُ، يُوشِكُ مَنْ أَسْرَعَ أَنْ يَلْحَقَ!
English: Darkness disappears gradually. Now it is as though travellers have got down and those who hasten will soon meet.

Arabic: وَاعْلَمْ، أَن مَنْ كَانَتْ مَطِيتُهُ الليْلَ والنهَارَ، فَإِنهُ يُسَارُ بِهِ وَإِنْ كَانَ وَاقِفاً، وَيَقْطَعُ الْمَسَافَةَ وَإِنْ كَانَ مُقِيماً وَادِعاً.
English: Be informed, O my child, that everyone who is riding on the carriage of night and day is being carried by them even though he may be stationary; he is covering the distance even though he is staying and resting.

Arabic: وَاعْلَمْ يَقِيناً، أَنكَ لَنْ تَبْلُغَ أَمَلَكَ، وَلَنْ تَعْدُوَ أَجَلَكَ، وَأَنكَ فِي سَبِيلِ مَنْ كَانَ قَبْلَكَ، فَخَفضْ فِي الطلَبِ، وَأَجْمِلْ فِي الْمُكْتَسَبِ، فَإِنهُ رُب طَلَب قَدْ جَر إِلَى حَرَب.
English: Know with certainty that you cannot achieve your desire and exceed your destined life. You are on the track of those before you. Therefore, be humble in seeking and moderate in earning because often seeking leads to deprivation.

Arabic: فَلَيْسَ كُل طَالِب بِمَرْزُوق، وَلاَكُل مُجْمِل بِمَحْروُم.
English: Every seeker of livelihood does not get it [on his own], nor is everyone who is moderate in seeking is deprived.

Arabic: وَأَكْرِمْ نَفْسَكَ عَنْ كُل دَنِية وَإِنْ سَاقَتْكَ إِلَى الرغَائِبِ، فَإِنكَ لَنْ تَعْتَاضَ بِمَا تَبْذُلُ مِنْ نَفْسِكَ عِوَضاً.
English: Keep yourself away from every low thing even though it may take you to your desired aims because you will not get any return for your own respect which you exhaust.

Arabic: وَلاَ تَكُنْ عَبْدَ غَيْرِكَ وَقَدْ جَعَلَكَ اللهُ حُرّاً. وَمَا خَيْرُ خَيْر لاَ يُنَالُ إِلا بِشَر، ويُسْر لاَ يُنَالُ إِلا بِعُسْر؟!
English: Do not be the slave of others for Allah had made you free. There is no goodness in anything “good” achieved through evil, and there is no good in comfort that is achieved through a (disgracing) effort.

Arabic: وَإِياكَ أَنْ تُوجِفَ بِكَ مَطَايَا الطمَعِ، فَتُورِدَكَ مَنَاهِلَ الْهَلَكَةِ، وَإِنِ اسْتَطَعْتَ أَلا يَكُونَ بَيْنَكَ بَيْنَ اللهِ ذُونِعْمَة فَافْعَلْ، فإِنكَ مُدْرِكٌ قِسْمَكَ، وَآخِذٌ سَهْمَكَ، وَإِن الْيَسِيرَ مِنَ اللهِ سُبْحَانَهُ أَكْرَمُ أَعْظَمُ مِنَ الْكَثِيرِ مِنْ خَلْقِهِ وَإِنْ كَانَ كُل مِنْهُ.
English: Beware lest bearers of greed should carry you and make you descend down to the springs of destruction. If you can, manage that there will be no wealthy person between yourself and Allah. Do so because in any case you will find what is for you and get what is your share. A little received directly from Allah the Glorified One is more dignified than that which is more but is received through His creatures, although (really) all is from Allah.

Arabic: وَتَلاَفِيكَ مَا فَرَطَ مِنْ صَمْتِكَ أَيْسَرُ مِنْ إِدْرَاكِكَ مَا فَاتَ مِنْ مَنْطِقِكَ.
English: It is easier to rectify what you miss by silence than to secure what you lose by speaking.

Arabic: وَحِفْظُ مَا فِي الْوِعَاءِ بِشَد الْوِكَاءِ، وَحِفْظُ مَا فِي يَدَيْكَ أَحَب إِلَي مِنْ طَلَبِ مَا فِي يَدَيْ غَيْرِكَ.
English: Whatever is in a pot can be retained by closing the lid. I should prefer you retain what is in your hands rather than seeking what is in the hands of others.

Arabic: وَمَرَارَةُ الْيَأْسِ خَيْرٌ مِنَ الطلَبِ إِلَى الناسِ، وَالْحِرْفَةُ مَعَ الْعِفةِ خَيْرٌ مِنَ الْغِنَى مَعَ الْفُجُورِ.
English: The bitterness of disappointment is better than seeking a hand-out from people. Manual labor with chastity is better than the riches of a vicious life.

Arabic: وَالْمَرْءُ أَحْفَظُ لِسِرهِ، وَرُب سَاعِ فِيَما يَضُرهُ!
English: A man is the best guard of his own secrets. Often, a man strives for what harms him.

Arabic: مَنْ أَكْثَرَ أَهْجَرَ، وَمَنْ تَفَكرَ أَبْصَرَ.
English: Whoever speaks much speaks nonsense. Whoever ponders perceives.

Arabic: قَارِنْ أهْلَ الْخَيْرِ تَكُنْ مِنْهُمْ، وَبَايِنْ أَهْلَ الشر تَبِنْ عَنْهُمْ.
English: Associate yourself with the people of virtue, you will become one of them. Keep aloof from people of vic, you will remain safe from them.

Arabic: بِئْسَ الطعَامُ الْحَرَامُ!
English: The worst food is that which is unlawful.

Arabic: وَظُلْمُ الضعِيفِ أَفْحَشُ الظلْمِ.
English: Oppressing the weak is the worst type of oppression.

Arabic: إِذَا كَانَ الرفْقُ خُرْقاً كَانَ الْخُرْقُ رِفْقاً، رُبمَا كَانَ الدوَاءُ دَاءً، وَالداءُ دَوَاءً، وَرُبمَا نَصَحَ غَيْرُ الناصِحِ، وَغَش الْمُسْتَنْصَحُ.
English: Where leniency is unsuitable, harshness is lenience. Often, cure is illness and illness is cure. Often, the ill-wisher gives correct advice while the well-wisher cheats.

Arabic: وَإِياكَ وَالاتكَالَ عَلَى الْمُنَى، فَإِنهَا بَضَائِعُ النوْكَى.
English: Do not depend upon hopes because hopes are the mainstay of fools.

Arabic: وَالْعَقْلُ حِفْظُ التجَارِبِ، وَخَيْرُ مَا جَربْتَ مَا وَعَظَكَ.
English: It is wise to safeguard one’s experience. Your best experience is that which teaches you a lesson.

Arabic: بَادِرِ الْفُرْصَةَ قَبْلَ أَنْ تَكُونَ غُصةً، لَيْسَ كُل طَالِب يُصِيبُ، وَلاَ كُل غَائِب يَؤُوبُ، وَمِنَ الْفَسَادِ إِضَاعَةُ الزادِ،وَمَفْسَدَةُ الْمَعَادِ، وَلِكُل أَمْر عَاقِبَةٌ.
English: Make use of leisure before it changes into grief. Every seeker does not achieve (what he seeks), and everyone who departs never returns. To lose provision and to earn evil for the Day of Judgement means ruin. Every matter has a consequence.

Arabic: سَوْفَ يَأْتيِكَ مَا قُدرَ لَكَ، التاجِرُ مُخَاطِرٌ، وَرُب يَسِير أَنْمَى مِنْ كَثِير!
English: What is destined for you will shortly come to you. A trader undertakes a risk. Often a small quantity is more beneficial than a large one.

Arabic: لاَ خَيْرَ فِي مُعِين مَهِين، وَلاَ فِي صَدِيق ظَنِين، سَاهِلِ الدهْرَ مَا ذَل لَكَ قَعُودُهُ.
English: There is no good in an ignoble helper nor in a suspicious friend. Be compliant with the world as long as it is in your grip.

Arabic: وَلاَ تُخَاطِرْ بِشَيء رَجَاءَ أَكْثَرَ مِنْهُ، وَإِياك أَنْ تَجْمَحَ بِكَ مَطِيةُ اللجَاجِ.
English: Do not put yourself to risk regarding anything in expectation for more. Beware lest the attitude of enmity should overpower you.

Arabic: احْمِلْ نَفْسَكَ مِنْ أَخِيكَ عِنْدَ صَرْمِهِ عَلَى الصلَةِ، وَعِنْدَ صُدُودِهِ عَلَى اللطَفِ وَالْمُقَارَبَةِ، وَعِنْدَ جُمُودِهِ عَلَى الْبَذْلِ،وَعِنْدَ تَبَاعُدِهِ عَلَى الدنُو، وَعِنْدَ شِدتِهِ عَلَى اللينِ، وَعِنْدَ جُرْمِهِ عَلَى الْعُذْرِ، حَتى كَأَنكَ لَهُ عَبْدٌ، وَكَأَنهُ ذُونِعْمَة عَلَيْكَ.
English: Bear yourself towards your brother in such a way that if he disregards kinship, you maintain it; when he turns away, be kind to him and draw near to him; when he withholds, spend over him; when he distances himself, approach him; when he is harsh to you, be lenient to him; when he commits a wrong deed, think of an excuse for him as though you were a slave of his.

Arabic: وَإِياكَ أَنْ تَضَعَ ذلِكَ فِي غَيْرِ مَوْضِعِهِ، أَوْ أَنْ تَفْعَلَهُ بِغَيْرِ أَهْلِهِ.
English: Take care that this should not be done inappropriately and that you should not behave thus with an undeserving person.

Arabic: لاَ تَتخِذَن عَدُو صَدِيقِكَ صَدِيقاً فَتُعَادِيَ صَدِيقَكَ.
English: Do not take the enemy of your friend as a friend of yours because you will thus antagonize your friend.

Arabic: وَامْحَضْ أَخَاكَ النصِيحَةَ، حَسَنةً كَانَتْ أَمْ قَبِيحَةً.
English: Give true advice to your brother, be it sweet or bitter.

Arabic: وَتَجَرعِ الْغَيْظَ، فَإِني لَمْ أَرَ جُرْعَةً أَحْلَى مِنْهَا عَاقِبَةً، وَلاَ أَلَذ مَغَبةً.
English: Swallow your anger because I did not find a sweeter thing than its taste in the end, and nothing is more pleasant than it in the end.

Arabic: وَلِنْ لِمَنْ غَالَظَكَ، فَإِنهُ يُوشِكُ أَنْ يَلِينَ لَكَ، وَخُذْ عَلَى عَدُوكَ بِالْفَضْلِ فإِنهُ أَحْلَى الظفَرَيْنِ.
English: Be lenient to him who is harsh to you, for it is likely that he will shortly become lenient to you. Treat your enemy with favors because this is the sweeter of the two successes (the success of revenge and the success of doing a favor).

Arabic: وَإِنْ أَرَدْتَ قَطِيعَةَ أَخِيكَ فَاسْتَبْقِ لَهُ مِنْ نَفْسِكَ بَقِيةً يَرْجِعُ إِلَيْهَا إِنْ بَدَا لَهُ ذلِكَ يَوْماً مَا.
English: If you intend to cut yourself off from a friend, leave some room for him from your side by which he may resume his friendship if it so occurs to him some day.

Arabic: وَمَنْ ظَن بِكَ خَيْراً فَصَدقْ ظنهُ، وَلاَ تُضِيعَن حَق أَخِيكَ اتكَالاً عَلَى مَا بَيْنَكَ وَبَيْنَهُ، فَإِنهُ لَيْسَ لَكَ بِأَخ مَنْ أَضَعْتَ حَقه.
English: If anyone has a good idea about you, prove it to be true. Do not disregard the interests of your brother depending upon your terms with him, for he is not your brother if you disregard his interests.

Arabic: وَلاَ يكُنْ أَهْلُكَ أَشْقَى الْخَلْقِ بِكَ وَلاَ تَرْغَبَن فِيمَنْ زَهِدَ فِيكَ.
English: Your family should not become the most miserable people on your account. Do not lean towards him who turns away from you.

Arabic: وَلاَ يَكُونَن أَخُوكَ أَقْوَى عَلَى قَطِيعَتِكَ مِنْكَ عَلَى صِلَتِهِ، وَلاَ تكُونَن عَلَى الاسَاءَةِ أَقْوَى مِنْكَ عَلَى الاحْسَانِ.
English: Your brother should not be more firm in his disregard for kinship than you in paying regard to it and you should exceed in doing good to him than his doing evil to you.

Arabic: وَلاَ يَكْبُرَن عَلَيْكَ ظُلْمُ مَنْ ظَلَمَكَ، فَإِنهُ يَسْعَى فِي مَضَرتِهِ وَنَفْعِكَ، وَلَيْسَ جَزَاءُ مَنْ سَركَ أَنْ تَسُوءَهُ.
English: Do not feel too much the oppression of a person who oppresses you because he is only busy in harming himself and benefitting you. The reward of him who pleases you is not that you should displease him.

Arabic: وَاعْلَمْ يَا بُنَي، أَن الرزْقَ رِزْقَانِ: رِزْقٌ تَطْلُبُهُ، وَرِزْقٌ يَطْلُبُكَ، فَإِنْ أَنْتَ لَمْ تَأْتِهِ أَتَاكَ.
English: Be informed, O my child, that livelihood is of two kinds: a livelihood that you seek and a livelihood that seeks you which is such that if you do not reach it, it will reach you.

Arabic: مَا أَقْبَحَ الْخُضُوعَ عِنْدَ الْحَاجَةِ، وَالْجَفَاءَ عِنْدَ الْغِنَى!
English: How bad it is to bend down at the time of need and to be harsh while being in riches!

Arabic: إِنمَا لَكَ مِنْ دُنْيَاكَ، مَا أَصْلَحْتَ بِهِ مَثْوَاكَ، وَإِنْ جَزِعْتَ عَلَى مَا تَفَلتَ مِنْ يَدَيْكَ، فَاجْزَعْ عَلَى كُل مَا لَمْ يَصِلْ إِلَيْكَ.
English: You should have from this world only that with which you can adorn your permanent abode. If you cry over what has gone out of your hands, then also cry for what has not at all come to you.

Arabic: اسْتَدِل عَلَى مَا لَمْ يَكُنْ بِمَا قَدْ كَانَ، فَإِن الامُورَ أَشْبَاهٌ.
English: Infer about what has not yet happened from what has already happened because occurrences are ever similar.

Arabic: وَلاَ تَكُونَن مِمنْ لاَ تَنْفَعُهُ الْعِظَةُ إِلا إِذَا بَالَغْتَ فِي إِيلاَمِهِ، فَإِن الْعَاقِلَ يَتعِظُ بِالادَبِ، وَالْبَهَائِمَ لاَ تَتعِظُ إِلا بِالضرْبِ.
English: Do not be like those whom preaching does not benefit unless you inflict pain on them because the wise take instruction from teaching while beasts learn only from beating.

Arabic: اطْرَحْ عَنْكَ وَارِدَاتِ الْهُمُومِ بِعَزَائِمِ الصبْرِ وَحُسْنِ الْيَقِينِ، مَنْ تَرَكَ الْقَصْدَ جَارَ، وَالصاحِبُ مُنَاسِبٌ، وَالصدِيقُ مَنْ صَدَقَ غَيْبُهُ.
English: Ward off from yourself the onslaught of worries by firmness of endurance and purity of belief. Whoever gives up moderation commits excesses. A companion is like a relationship. A friend is one whose absence also proves his friendship.

Arabic: وَالْهَوَى شَرِيكُ الْعَمَى، رُب بَعِيد أَقْرَبُ مِنْ قَرِيب، وَقَرِيب أَبْعَدُ مِنْ بَعِيد.
English: Passion is a partner of distress. Often, the near ones are more remote than the distant ones, and often the distant ones are nearer than the near ones.

Arabic: وَالْغَرِيبُ مَنْ لَمْ يَكُنْ لَهُ حَبِيبٌ، مَنْ تَعَدى الْحَق ضَاقَ مَذْهَبُهُ، وَمَنِ اقْتَصَرَ عَلَى قَدْرِهِ كَانَ أَبْقَى لَهُ.
English: A stranger is one who has no friends. Whoever transgresses right narrows his own passage. Whoever stays in his status remains constant upon it.

Arabic: وَأوْثَقُ سَبَب أَخَذْتَ بِهِ سَبَبٌ بَيْنَكَ وَبَيْنَ اللهِ سُبْحَانَهُ.
English: The most trustworthy intermediary is that which you adopt between yourself and Allah the Glorified One.

Arabic: وَمَنْ لَمْ يُبَالِكَ فَهُوَ عَدُوكَ، قَدْ يَكُونُ الْيَأْسُ إِدْرَاكاً، إِذَا كَانَ الطمَعُ هَلاَكاً، لَيْسَ كُل عَوْرَة تَظْهَرُ، وَلاَ كُل فُرْصَة تُصَابُ، وَرُبمَا أَخْطَأَ الْبَصِيرُ قَصْدَهُ،أَصَابَ الاعْمَى رُشْدَهُ.
English: Whoever does not care for your interests is your enemy. When greed leads to ruin deprivation is an achievement. Not every defect can be reviewed and not every opportunity recurs. Often, a person with eyes misses the track while a blind person finds the correct path.

Arabic: أَخرِ الشر، فَإِنكَ إِذَا شِئْتَ تَعَجلْتَهُ، وَقَطِيعَةُ الْجَاهِلِ تَعْدِلُ صِلَةَ الْعَاقِلِ، مَنْ أَمِنَ الزمَانَ خَانَهُ، وَمَنْ أَعْظَمَهُ أَهَانَهُ، لَيْسَ كُل مَنْ رَمَى أَصَابَ، إِذَا تَغَيرَ السلْطَانُ تَغَيرَ الزمَانُ.
English: Delay an evil deed because you will be able to hasten it whenever you wish. The disregard of kinship of the ignorant is equal to regarding the kinship of the wise. Whoever takes the world to be safe, it will betray him. Whoever regards the world as great, it will humiliate him. Not everyone who shoots hits. When authority changes, the time changes, too.

Arabic: سَلْ عَنِ الرفِيقِ قَبْلَ الطرِيقِ، وَعَنِ الْجَارِ قَبْلَ الدارِ.
English: Consult the friend before taking a course, the neighbor before buying the house.

Arabic: إِياكَ أَنْ تَذْكُرَ مِنَ الْكَلاَمِ مَا يَكُونُ مُضْحِكاً، وَإِنْ حَكَيْتَ ذلِكَ عَنْ غَيْرِكَ.
English: Beware lest you should mention in your speech what may cause laughter even though you may be relating it from others.

Arabic: وَإِياكَ وَمُشَاوَرَةَ النسَاءِ، فَإِن رَأَيَهُن إِلَى أَفْن، وَعَزْمَهُن إِلَى وَهْن.
English: Do not consult women because their view is weak and their determination is unstable.

Arabic: وَاكْفُفْ عَلَيْهِن مِنْ أَبْصَارِهِن بِحِجَابِكَ إِياهُن، فَإِن شِدةَ الْحِجَابِ أَبْقَى عَلَيْهِن، وَلَيْسَ خُرُوجُهُن بِأَشَد مَنْ إِدْخَالِكَ مَنْ لاَيُوثَقُ بِهِ عَلَيْهِن، وَإِنِ اسْتَطَعْتَ أَلا يَعْرِفْنَ غَيْرَكَ فَافْعَلْ.
English: Cover their eyes by keeping them under the veil because strictness of veiling keeps them for long. Their coming out is not worse than your allowing an untrustworthy man to visit them. If you can manage that they should not know anyone other than you, do so.

Arabic: وَلاَ تُمَلكِ الْمَرْأَةَ مِنْ أَمْرِهَا مَا جَاوَزَ نَفْسَهَا، فَإِن الْمَرْأَةَ رَيْحَانَةٌ، وَلَيْسَتْ بِقَهْرَمَانَة.
English: Do not allow a woman matters other than those about herself because a woman is a flower not an administrator.

Arabic: وَلاَ تَعْدُ بِكَرَامَتِهَا نَفْسَهَا، وَلاَ تُطْمِعْهَا أَنْ تَشْفَعَ لِغَيْرِهَا.
English: Do not pay her regard beyond herself. Do not encourage her to intercede for others.

Arabic: وَإِياكَ وَالتغايُرَ فِي غَيْرِ مَوْضِعِ غَيْرَة، فَإِن ذلِكَ يَدْعُوالصحِيحَةَ إِلَى السقَمِ، وَالْبَرِيئَةَ إِلَى الريَبِ.
English: Do not show suspicion out of place because this leads a woman on the right course to evil and a chaste woman to deflection.

Arabic: وَاجْعَلْ لِكُل إِنْسَان مِنْ خَدَمِكَ عَمَلاً تَأْخُذُهُ بِهِ، فَإِنهُ أَحْرَى أَلا يَتَوَاكَلُوا فِي خِدْمَتِكَ.
English: For everyone among your servants fix a task for which you may hold him responsible. In this way, they will not fling the task one over the other.

Arabic: وَأَكْرِمْ عَشِيرَتَكَ، فَإِنهُمْ جَنَاحُكَ الذِي بِهِ تَطِيرُ، وَأَصْلُكَ الذِي إِلَيْهِ تَصِيرُ، وَيَدُكَ التي بِهَا تَصُولُ.
English: Respect your kinsmen because they are your wings with which you fly, the origin towards which you return and the hands with which you attack.

Arabic: أسْتَوْدِعُ اللهَ دِينَكَ وَدُنْيَاكَ، وَأسْأَلُهُ خَيْرَ الْقَضَاءِ لَكَ فِي الْعَاجِلَةِ وَالاْجِلَةِ، وَالدنْيَا وَالاْخِرَةِ، إنْ شَاءَاللهُ.
English: Place your religion and your world at Allah’s disposal and beg Him to ordain the best for you with regard to thenear and the far, this world and the next, and that is the end of the matter.

Arabic: وَأَرْدَيْتَ جِيلاً مِنَ الناسِ كَثِيراً، خَدَعْتَهُمْ بِغَيكَ، وَأَلْقَيْتَهُمْ فِي مَوْجِ بَحْرِكَ، تَغْشَاهُمُ الظلُمَاتُ،تَتَلاَطَمُ بِهِمُ الشبُهَاتُ، فَجاروا عَنْ وِجْهَتِهِمْ، وَنَكَصُوا عَلَى أَعْقَابِهِمْ، وَتَوَلوْا عَلَى أَدْبَارِهِمْ، وَعَولُوا عَلَى أحْسَابِهِمْ.
English: You have ruined a large group of people whom you have deceived by your misguidance and have flung them into the currents of your sea where darkness covers them and misgivings toss them about. As a result, they have strayed from the right path and turned on their backs. They turned their backs and pushed forward.

Arabic: إِلا مَنْ فَاءَ مِنْ أَهْلِ الْبَصَائِرِ، فَإِنهُمْ فَارَقُوكَ بَعْدَ مَعْرِفَتِكَ، وَهَرَبُوا إِلَى اللهِ سُبحانَهُ مِنْ مُوَازَرَتِكَ، إِذْ حَمَلْتَهُمْ عَلَى الصعْبِ، وَعَدَلْتَ بِهِمْ عَنِ الْقَصْدِ.
English: except those wise ones who came back, leaving you behind, having come to understand you very well. They ran towards Allah away from assisting you when you put them to troubles and caused them to deviate from themiddle path.

Arabic: فَاتقِ اللهَ يَا مُعَاوِيَةُ فِي نَفْسِكَ، وَجَاذِبِ الشيْطَانَ قيَادَكَ، فَإِن الدنْيَا مُنْقَطِعَةٌ عَنْكَ، وَالاْخِرَةَ قَرِيبَةٌ مِنْكَ، وَالسلاَمُ.
English: Therefore, O Mu’awiyah, fear Allah about yourself and take your rein away from Satan since this world is shortly to be cut off from you and the next world is near you, and that is the end of the matter.

Arabic: ومن كتاب له (عليه السلام)إلى قُثَمَ بن العبّاس، وهو عامله على مكّة
English: To Othman ibn al-Abbas, his Governor over Mecca

Arabic: أَما بَعْدُ، فَإِن عَيْنِي ـ بِالْمَغْرِبِ ـ كَتَبَ إِلَي يُعْلِمُنِي أَنهُ وُجهَ إِلَى المَوْسِمِ أُنَاسٌ مِنْ أَهْلِ الشامِ، الْعُمْيِ الْقُلُوبِ، الصُم الاسْمَاعِ، الْكُمْهِ الابْصَارِ.
English: My informer in the West has written to me telling me that some people from Syria have been sent for hajj and who are blind at heart, deaf in the ears and devoid of vision.

Arabic: الذِينَ يَلْتَمِسُونَ الْحَق بِالبَاطِلِ، وَيُطِيعُونَ الْـمَخْلُوقَ فِي مَعْصِيَةِ الْخَالِقِ، وَيَحْتَلِبُونَ الدنْيَا دَرهَا بِالدينِ، وَيَشْتَرُونَ عَاجِلَهَا بِآجِلِ الابْرَارِ الْمُتقِينَ.
English: They confound the truth with vanity, obey men while disobeying Allah, lay a claim on the milk of the world in the name of religion and trade in the pleasures of this world by forsaking the rewards of the virtuous and the God-fearing.

Arabic: وَلَنْ يَفُوزَ بِالْخَيْرِ إِلا عَامِلُهُ، وَلاَ يُجْزَى جَزَاءَ الشر إِلا فَاعِلُهُ.
English: No one achieves good except whoever labors for it, and no one is awarded the recompense of evil except whoever commits it.

Arabic: فَأَقِمْ عَلَى مَا فِي يَدَيْكَ قِيَامَ الْحَازِمِ الصلِيبِ، وَالناصِحِ اللبِيبِ، التابِعِ لِسُلْطَانِهِ، الْمُطِيعِ لامَامِهِ.
English: Therefore, carry out your duties like an intelligent, experienced, well-wishing and wise man who follows his superior and is obedient to his Imam.

Arabic: وَإِياكَ وَمَا يُعْتَذَرُ مِنْهُ، وَلاَ تَكُنْ عِنْدَ النعْمَاءِ بَطِراً، وَلاَ عِنْدَ الْبَأْسَاءِ فَشِلاً، وَالسلاَمُ.
English: You should avoid what you may have later to explain. Do not rise up in riches nor lose courage when in distress, and that is the end of the matter.

Arabic: ومن كتاب له (عليه السلام)إلى محمد بن أبي بكر لما بلغه توجّده من عزله بالاشتر عن مصر، ثم توفي الاشتر في توجهه إلى هناك قبل وصوله إليها.
English: To Muhammad Ibn Abu Bakr on Coming to Know That He Had Assumed the Position of (Malik) Al-Ashtar as Governor of Egypt after the Latter Had Died on His Way to Egypt

Arabic: وَقَدْ بَلَغَنِي مَوْجِدَتُكَ مِنْ تَسْرِيحِ الاشْتَرِ إِلَى عَمَلِكَ، وَإِني لَمْ أَفْعَلْ ذلِكَ اسْتِبْطَاءً لَكَ فِي الجَهْدِ، وَلاَ ازدِياداً لَكَ فِي الْجِد، وَلَوْ نَزَعْتُ مَا تَحْتَ يَدِكَ مِنْ سُلْطَانِكَ، لَوَليْتُكَ مَا هُوَ أَيْسَرُ عَلَيْكَ مَؤُونَةً، وَأَعْجَبُ إِلَيْكَ وِلاَيَةً.
English: I have come to know of your anger at the status quo of al-Ashtar, but I did not do so because of any shortcoming on your part or to get you to increase your responsibilities. But when I take away what was under your authority, I will place you in a status which will then be less exhausting and more attractive to you.

Arabic: إِن الرجُلَ الذِي كُنْتُ وَليْتُهُ أَمْرَ مِصْرَ كَانَ رَجُلاً لَنَا نَاصِحاً، وَعَلَى عَدُونَا شَدِيداً نَاقِماً، فَرَحِمَهُ اللهُ! فَلَقَدِ اسْتَكْمَلَ أَيامَهُ، وَلاَقَى حِمَامَهُ، وَنَحْنُ عَنْهُ رَاضونَ.
English: The man whom I have made Governor of Egypt was my well- wisher and very harsh and vengeful towards our enemies. May Allah have mercy on him since he has finished his days and met his death. I am quite pleased with him.

Arabic: أَوْلاَهُ اللهُ رِضْوَانَهُ، وَضَاعَفَ الثوَابَ لَهُ.
English: May Allah, too, accord him His pleasure and multiply his rewards.

Arabic: فَأَصْحِرْ لِعَدُوكَ، وَامْضِ عَلَى بَصيرَتِكَ، وَشَمرْ لِحَرْبِ مَنْ حَارَبَكَ، وَادْعُ إِلَى سَبِيلِ رَبكَ، وَأَكْثِرِ الاسْتِعَانَةَ بِاللهِ يَكْفِكَ مَا أَهَمكَ، وَيُعِنْكَ عَلَى مَا يُنْزِلُ بِكَ، إِنْ شَاءَ اللهُ.
English: Now get ready for your enemy and act according to your intelligence. Prepare to fighting one who fights you and call to the path of Allah. Seek Allah’s help earnestly. If Allah wills, He will assist you in what worries you and help you with what befalls upon you.

Arabic: ومن كتاب له (عليه السلام)إلى عبدالله بن العباس، بعد مقتل محمّد بن أبي بكر بمصر
English: To Abdullah Ibn Abbas after Muhammad Ibn Abu Bakr Had Been Killed

Arabic: أَما بَعْدُ، فَإِن مِصْرَ قَدِ افْتُتِحَتْ، وَمُحَمدُ بْنُ أَبِي بَكْر ـ رَحِمَهُ اللهُ ـ قَدِ اسْتُشْهِدَ، فَعِنْدَ اللهِ نَحْتَسِبُهُ، وَلَداً نَاصِحاً، وَعَامِلاً كَادِحاً، وَسَيْفاً قَاطِعاً، وَرُكْناً دَافِعاً.
English: Now then, Egypt has been conquered and Muhammad ibn Abu Bakr, may Allah have mercy on him, has been martyred. We seek his reward from Allah. He was a son who was a well-wisher, a hard worker, a sharp sword and a bastion of defense.

Arabic: وَقَدْ كُنْتُ حَثَثْتُ الناسَ عَلَى لَحَاقِهِ، وَأَمَرْتُهُمْ بِغِيَاثِهِ قَبْلَ الْوَقْعَةِ، وَدَعَوْتُهُمْ سِرّاً وَجَهْراً، وَعَوْداً وَبَدْءاً، فَمِنْهُمُ الاْتِي كَارِهاً، وَمِنْهُمُ الْمُعْتَل كَاذِباً، وَمِنْهُمُ الْقَاعِدُ خَاذِلاً.
English: I had called upon the people to join him and ordered them to reach him to help him prior to this incident. I repeatedly called upon them secretly and openly. Some of them came half-heartedly, some put up false excuses, and some sat away leaving me behind.

Arabic: أَسْأَلُ اللهَ تَعَالى أَنْ يَجْعَلَ لِي مِنْهُمْ فَرَجاً عَاجلاً، فَوَاللهِ لَوْ لاَ طَمَعِي عِنْدَ لِقَائِي عَدُوي فِي الشهَادَةِ، وَتَوْطِينِي نَفْسِي عَلَى الْمَنِيةِ، لاحْبَبْتُ أَلا أَبْقَى مَعَ هؤُلاَءِ يَوْماً وَاحِداً، وَلاَ أَلْتَقِيَ بِهِمْ أَبَداً.
English: I ask Allah, the Sublime One, to grant me an early relief from them, for by Allah, had I not been yearning to meet the enemy for the sake of martyrdom and not prepared myself for death, I would not have liked to be with these people for a single day, nor ever to face the enemy with them.

Arabic: ومن كتاب له (عليه السلام) في ذكر جيش أنفذه إلى بعض الاعداء، وهو جواب كتاب كتبه إليه أخوه عقيل بن أبي طالب
English: To His Brother, Aqil ibn Abu Talib1, in Reply to His Letter Containing a Reference to the Army Which Imam Ali Ibn Abu TalibHad Sent to Meet an Enemy.

Arabic: فَسَرحْتُ إِلَيْهِ جَيْشاً كَثِيفاً مِنَ الْمُسْلِمِينَ، فَلَما بَلَغَهُ ذلِكَ شَمرَ هَارباً، وَنَكَصَ نَادِماً، فَلَحِقُوهُ بِبَعْضِ الطرِيقِ، وَقَدْ طَفلَتِ الشمْسُ لِلايَابِ.
English: I sent him a large army of Muslims. When he came to know of it, he fled away and retreated in repent. They met him on the way when the sun was about to set.

Arabic: فَاقْتَتَلُوا شَيْئاً كَلاَ وَلاَ، فَمَا كَانَ إِلا كَمَوْقِفِ سَاعَة حَتى نَجَا جَرِيضاً بَعْدَمَا أُخِذَ مِنْهُ بِالْـمُخَنقِ، وَلَمْ يَبْقَ مِنْهُ غَيْرُ الرمَقِ، فَلاياً بِلاي مَا نَجَا.
English: They grappled for a while like nothing. It was about an hour then he rescued himself, half-dead, as he had almost been taken by the neck and only the last breath had remained in him. In this way, he escaped in panic.

Arabic: فَدَعْ عَنْكَ قُرَيشاً وَتَرْكَاضَهُمْ فِي الضلاَلِ، وَتَجْوَالَهُمْ فِي الشقَاقِ، وَجِمَاحَهُمْ فِي التيهِ.
English: Leave the tribesmen of Quraish rushing in misguidance, their galloping in disunity and their leaping over destruction.

Arabic: فَإِنهُمْ قَدْ أَجْمَعُوا عَلَى حَرْبِي كَإِجمَاعِهِمْ عَلَى حَرْبِ رَسوُلِ اللهِ(صلى الله عليه وآله) قَبْلِي.
